Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Customer billing not so much”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie W
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was absolutely wonderful. I stayed for two nights and the rooms are very clean, modern, and super Large!!!! My only complaint was billing!!!!! The Accounts receivable representative was not understanding and had a "I am right, and your wrong" kind of attitude. I had to speak with her supervisor to get me issue resolved, after the Hotel put another $300 hold on my credit card after I had checked out. I guess they don't know how to release a hold before they run a whole other transaction!!!!! Finally got it straight after 4 messages, on the phone for an hour, and then next day leaving 3 additional messages and then speaking with her supervisor!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Chic, Accommodating, Impressive”
Reviews.Author: happywhenitravel
Reviews.Content: From the incredible decor, the well-appointed room, surreal spa and friendly front desk, spa, and restaurant staff this hotel provided me with the most appealing and unforgettable experience I've had at a hotel to date. Check-in was fast, easy and welcoming. Our bell hop not only took our luggage to our room, but told us all about the hotel and surrounding area. The room was drop-dead gorgeous. The sheets on the bed were meticulously pressed and the bed itself was a cloud from heaven above. Bathroom was HUGE with double sink, big soaking tub and shower stall. The toiletries were spa quality and smelled amazing. I wanted to take a bottle home! Junior Suite room was outfitted with a small kitchenette and Illy espresso machine. Best mini bar selection I've ever seen. Club 50 at the roof top was hopping and happening. The pool was like being at a resort/beach all wrapped in one. I was so jealous of the people who live in residences on the property. I would come back to the Viceroy in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay at the Viceroy Miami”
Reviews.Author: kate d
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last Friday night (9 March, 2012) and had a very disappointing experience with my stay. We were due to stay two nights but after receiving such poor, and rude, service we checked out early and instead stayed at the Mandarin Oriental on Saturday - which was fabulous. At the request of the front desk manager, I lodged a complaint with the hotel's security team related to an allergic reaction that I believe was caused by MSG or another flavour additive in the room service food on Friday night (tagliatelle bolognese). My issue was not so much with the allergic reaction - it happens, but more with the way I was spoken to and made to feel. I was told someone would call or email me to let me know the outcome of the 'investigation' and whether it was in fact the food that caused my reaction, as suspected, I have not heard anything in response. Yes, the rooms and amenities are lovely but I have never been so poorly treated at what is meant to be a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience!!”
Reviews.Author: AngSimm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Viceroy on March, 3rd 2012 for our wedding day, and had a terrible experience. First of all, the layout on the hotel's website misleads the guests. My wife did the wedding preparation there and she had the makeup artist, stylist and photographers there also. We were counting that there will be a 1/2 bath in the "one bedroom suite", but this was non existent in room 2001. That was the main reason we specifically booked a "one bedroom suite", because it had 2 bathrooms making it very uncomfortable to share it. She ordered food that took 50 minutes to get to the room! however, the food was really good. The mini bar is on the hotel's website but was also non existent in that room. The valet parking took 25 minutes to bring the car and they were very rude, except for the cashier who was the only one helpful! My wife was late for the ceremony thanks to the terrible valet service. The room was nothing impressive, the "blackouts" were cheap plastic curtains and did not cover at all. We had to leave in a hurry from that room because we couldn't sleep well. There were not enough towels in the room, and in the morning we had to order extra towels. Also, there were no bathrobes, and on the website clearly says "Sferra linens and robes custom designed by Kelly Wearstler" On the hotel's website it says "One-Bedroom Suites offer modern sophistication accented by a timeless East Asian sensibility." but the decor was horrible (IKEA like), not Asian at all! The view was partial ocean view and we booked a "One Bedroom Water View Suite" We live on Brickell and that "one bedroom suite" we stayed at The Viceroy ws a cheap imitation from the apartment we live in, so we should have stayed at our place instead of paying $540 per night for a mediocre room and service. When we checked out the valet, of course, took about 30 minutes to bring our car and we were at the lobby waiting for that long.  This was our first time at the Viceroy hotel and we were wrong for choosing this hotel for our wedding night! Very unpleasant experience!

Reviews.Title: “Nice get away”
Reviews.Author: Sana I
Reviews.Content: Loved the Viceroy hotel. Beautiful Hotel, Great Staff! Really liked the room it was elegant and comfortable. Loved the Pool/Spa area, Beautiful view, not too loud nice quiet and relaxing. Will definitely return to Viceroy for a future get away.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay in Nice Surroundings, but...”
Reviews.Author: GreenMonster19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Viceroy for a long weekend away with friends. We enjoyed the hotel, but felt like it didn't quite hit the mark in all respects. On the plus side, our rooms were terrific. Very comfortable seating area, balcony, large 4-poster bed. The front desk, guest services, and spa staff were extremely friendly and responsive. The pool is enormous and makes a good swim easy. On the other hand, the design of the pool deck requires you to move a few times to stay in the sun and we were admonished for putting our feet in a very shallow cool water pool because it was evidently just for show. We had also hoped to enjoy a relaxing few minutes in the really large and comfortable hot tub after dinner one evening but were disappointed that we could not do so because the pool closes at 6 pm. We also asked to borrow a few pool towels for our day on the beach and were told by the pool staff person that use was limited to the pool only. Other things created small annoyances. The valet parking is poorly designed. There is one driveway for the hotel, the residences and Club 50 and we were frequently backed up waiting for space to clear to drive to the curb. At times, we could not get in and cars exiting the garage could not get out. Also, water and flooring don't work well together here. The pool deck is lined with rows of stone that are very slippery when wet, and the shower floors in both the rooms and the spa are made of marble. They too became slippery. Finally, the spa, while well equipped, has a work out room that is not well-ventilated. The large windows afford a great view, but they let in a lot of sun and it gets hot pretty quickly. I raise these small points because if we are paying $400 a night for a room, we expect the little things to work as well as the big things. All in all, we had a really good time in Miami and enjoyed the Viceroy but we would consider other options when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious & very cool Miami hotel”
Reviews.Content: The Viceroy is a luxurious and very cool destination on Brickell Avenue. The interior is fabulous while the exterior (e.g. 15th & 50th floor pool decks and chill out locations) are magnificent. My deluxe room had an entrance hall, an enormous bathroom, a 4 poster bed and a mini kitchen (hob, microwave ..etc...) plus the most expansive mini bar (i.e. mini shop!!) I've ever come across! Service was excellent throughout the hotel, and the food first class. Compliments to management for making this hotel come together for their guests. Highly recommended, I will return!.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay/Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Alisa B
Reviews.Content: My husband & I ended our Key West/Miami week long trip at the Viceroy Hotel and what a perfect ending for such a great trip. The customer service was above & beyond our expectations - everyone was super friendly & helpful. Hannika at the front desk sent up a bottle of Prosecco & chocolate truffels for our anniversary which was such a nice touch. Our 1 bedroom suite was gorgeous with great decor. The Viceroy will definitely be our hotel of choice when we visit Miami again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and great after-stay service”
Reviews.Author: KenOkumura
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I were in town for the Radiohead concert at the AA arena and stayed at the Viceroy for 3 nights. Having got rather tired of the excessive prices that you pay for a South Beach hotel and not really being beachy-sorts (we live in the Caribbean and the local beaches are a lot nicer) we saw a good deal on a travel site for the Viceroy Junior Suite and decided to stay there. Hotel is very nicely designed - lots of marble in the bathroom, very nice furnishings and plenty of room. We only got out to the pool area once as we were busy, but despite the overcast sky and gusting winds, enjoyed a soak in their enormous jacuzzi pool. If you see photos of the pool area, first smallest pool is almost decorative only, second is a jacuzzi pool and the third and longest is a very long lap pool. We didn't eat there (other than raiding the minibar for snacks - which were excellent), but very much enjoyed the time that we did spend there. We rather carelessly left a bunch of clothes in the room after we checked out and I spoke with Alberto who is the head of security who was very helpful and has arranged for the items to be couriered back to me. Great customer service and it's a weight off my mind knowing that it will be dealt with.

Reviews.Title: “A new boutique chain fav...”
Reviews.Author: jaxmarquez
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed at a Viceroy property before because I love Kimpton, but I tried it out because of it's location. There were many events going on the same weekend I was in town and traffic was chaos. I think my flight timing was a bit off because I didn't get a fantasticly located room as I normally do when I travel. It was still nicely decorated, clean and there was a lot of attention to detail. I loved the colors and the decor. The room was on low floor and facing the street so it was pretty noisy, but I still slept good because of the comfy large bed and great pillows. I actually found the brand and ordered them online. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The toiletries were more than I expected and a pleasant surprise. The location was perfect if you are into running or walking. I was there on business but, really looked forward to getting up early and running around across to the biscayne island on the other side. The pool was very impressive and had many nice touches. I didn't have a chance to dine at the hotel but, the room service was simple and good. Somewhat pricey for what it was but, it arrived faster than expected for a busy weekend. My favorite thing about the room was the Illy coffee machine!! Brilliant and I want one!! I'm a huge coffee drinker and loved having it in the room and always stocked. It was easy to opperate and very quick.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing all around”
Reviews.Author: C P
Reviews.Content: I am here on a business trip. This hotel is a DISAPPOINTMENT. First, the hall rugs are stained, the walls are chipped. The balcony opens onto a busy street, and no matter what floor you are on it is very NOISY if you open the balcony door. Room service ordered at 8:30pm on Sunday night is still not here- it is now 9:45pm. I ordered a caesar salad- how hard can that be to get to a room in 30 minutes? Although the property is only three years old, it is horribly RUN DOWN. Internet in your room costs $14.95 per day. Having spent the weekend at the Canyon Ranch, this is a BIG let down. I would never stay here again. The staff is very nice and trying but the place is a MESS. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Viceroy Miami Needs Viceroy Palm Spring's Playbook!”
Reviews.Author: UrbanNomadinLA
Reviews.Content: Beginning to end, our experience at this property was fraught with mistake after mistake by the staff. We were so looking forward to staying at another Viceroy property, as our experience had been stellar at other properties-- from the glam of Kelly Wearstler's designs to the courtesy of the staff, to the extraordinary dishes at reasonable prices in all of the on-site eateries. NOT IN MIAMI. I had communicated numerous times with the hotel prior to arriving as we were celebrating our 10th anniversary and we also had our 9 year old son with us. We booked a one bedroom suite, which we were assured had a pull-out in the living room and was designed to accomodate at least three people. We were assigned a "Client Associate" who e-mailed us various times prior to arrival to ensure that she got all our requests correct. We arrived at the property at 7am to no room. The valet "lost" our car. After about 30 minutes it was "found." We were told there was a 24/7 outdoor restaurant at the pool-- not so. We returned late that night, with our jet-lagged son, ready to fall into bed. We had been promised that his pull out would have been made up by the time we got back. Near midnight, there was no bed made. I tried to open the couch and to my dismay found that the couch had no pull-out! I called down to get a cot and was assured he would be up in minutes. When the non-English speaking Haitian (or possibly African) bellman arrived he smiled with a pile of sheets in his arms and said )Now make-up?" I told him there was no bed. "Make bed now?" "No we need a bed." "Sheets?" "No." "Towels then?" "OK give me the towels and please take the sheets." I closed the door. For two sleepless nights the same thing went on. Our son had to sleep with us in our bed. I will say that the sheets and bedding were terrific and comfortable. But that's about it. No hooks or racks for towels in the bathroom, so there was no way around slipping on the marble floors to retrieve your towel after a shower. The lighting in the bedroom was very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations and Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: kalifa282003
Reviews.Content: I rented a suite to celebrate my hubbie's Bday. The customer service from beginning to end was impeccable. The room was nice, a large suite with sitting area where we entertained a large group of friends. I had ordered balloons and a cake to be in the room when we arrive and everything was taken care of. They had even added a Birthday card for my husband. Nice touch. The decor was modern and upscale, the hotel superb. The bathrooms were very big and fantastic showers. No detail was overlooked. The restaurant at the hotel was just ok, for the price we paid i expected better. The beds were large and extremely comfortable, premium bedding and very romantic setting., large balcony and large room (we had suite). One thing i did not like was they charged us for delivering ice to our room. The club 50 has the most amazing view of Downtown Miami and Biscayne bay. Cool place to dance and have some drinks with friends. We definitely were treated like royalty and the hotel is absolutely a 5 star hotel. Great stay and great time!.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be nice”
Reviews.Author: Michael D
Reviews.Content: Third time we have stayed here. Loved it the first time but has gone downhill since. The spa is great but the rest of the hotel is neglected. Could no longer eat outside at the one restaurant on the property. The valet parking borders on absurd!! Getting your car in or out is a nightmare. The desk staff is great but the you will feel like an unwanted guest in someone else's condo besides that as the building is mostly a high end condo with a hotel mixed in. Housekeeping would show up every morning and afternoon and walk in unwanted and then we got no service unless requested. Very disappointing!!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer !”
Reviews.Author: Jorich
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Viceroy for one night pre-cruise at the beginning of February. I had got a very good rate booking several months in advance. We arrived mid afternoon after a 10 hour flight & were hoping to lie by the pool but it was so windy we couldn't. The receptionist was lovely, very welcoming & efficient. I asked her if she could give us a room with a nice view & she gave us one on the top floor overlooking the bay ! We had booked a King Deluxe but I am not sure if she upgraded us because the room was very spacious with a sofa & coffee table & a beautiful spacious bathroom. The hotel was within 5 minutes walk of Mary Brickell village & we had drinks in a couple of bars there before stopping at Trulucks steak house for dinner on the way back. We were really hoping to go to the nightclub on the 50th floor but it didn't open until 10pm - 3am by our bodyclocks ! We had a drink at the bar in the restaurant which was good. Next morning we had an excellent breakfast in the Eos restaurant at a window table, again served by very friendly efficient staff. We would definitely stay at the Viceroy again in the same situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrosco
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and well maintained. The decor is an asian style theme unlike any hotel I've been too. It was nice, if not a bit over the top, and very trendy. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had a city facing jr. suite but were fortunate to have a corner room so we had a wall of windows overlooking the water. The view out to the city was not that great as the buildings across the street are under construction so we felt especially fortunate to have the corner. The bathroom was the size of a bedroom with a wall of windows and mirrors. All marble, great shower, great bathtub and more space than you could possibly need. We used the spa and it was very nice. It has an amazing 2 or 3 story wall of glass that overlooks the water. Check-in is on a cross walk overlooking the windows and the spa area below. The only downside to is that the fitness center is located on the other side of the desk to check in. As you sit in the spa's below after your massage you will be viewed by those coming and going from the gym. I'm uncertain why they arranged the spa this way. The last thing I want to see after a massage and sitting in spa are people going to and coming from working out. Other than that it was great and the massage itself is worth it. The pool is really something special. On the 15th floor of the hotel surrounded by three 50 story buildings. The pool deck opens up to the water and Fisher Island and standing at the far end gives you a sense of awe. The pools consist of a single very large pool, perhaps one of the largest I've seen, and a gigantic spa which would fit 50 people easily and another reflecting pool. There are numerous chairs and cabanas all around as well as a small cafe and outdoor fireplace with seating. Overall, we had a great stay in early February 2012 and would definitely go back. Wonderful restaurants close by and plenty within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Pool. Less than Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: mkouzmine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I did a kid free trip to Miami and did a split stay with a few days in the city at The Viceroy and a week at the W South Beach. First the good...The pool is amazing. We really enjoyed relaxing at the rooftop pool every day. It can be difficult at busier times to get a drink, however. I often had to chase a waiter/waitress down. The spa is glorious. The food at restaurant was good and the nightclub on the top floor was really great too. The bad...The staff. Before arriving I got an email asking if I needed anything upon arrival. I sent an email back asking for an early dinner reservation. I got an email bounced back saying that the sender was on vacation. I was given an alternative email. I emailed this address and I never heard back. When we arrived, of course there was no reservation in our name. The next morning we woke up very early. At 7am, we asked for recommendations for breakfast. We were sent to a nice area with a lot of closed restaurants. I asked if anything would be open this early on a Sunday, I was assured several places would be open. The only thing open was Burger King. That evening, we asked the concierge for a tip on where to spend the evening. She sent us to a small district with shops and restaurants...all closed on Sun evening. Took a cab back. The next day we asked for directions to take a cab to the art museum. She sent us to a museum that was a good 25 min cab drive away. The museum was in the middle of a neighborhood and was not at all what we were looking for. We decided to give it a go anyway, only to discover that it was CLOSED on Monday. Luckily we were able to run down the street and get our cab to take us back to the Viceroy. Not once did the front desk staff send us somewhere that was actually open. The also had no tips or ideas for us. I began to wonder if they actually lived in Miami since they knew so little about it.

Reviews.Title: “The Viceroy rules (especially pools)”
Reviews.Author: parkhill24
Reviews.Content: My wife and I would stay again at Miami's Viceroy Hotel. Its location at the foot of the Brickell bridge to downtown Miami is surprisingly convenient. While the immediate neighborhood is mostly big banks and office buildings, it's an easy walk to restaurants and to the Mary Brickell Village area, with plenty of dining choices and shopping. Our room, 815, was in a setback off the front of the hotel -- a good deal, since almost all King Deluxe rooms face directly on Brickell. Traffic noise might be a problem there, but we heard only a hum during a six-night stay. The beds were excellent, room and bathroom were sizable, and the two sinks were what all hotels should have. There was no magnifying mirror, however, and bathroom and lighting overall was dim. There was no chair light, no closet light. But the thermostat worked, and so did the shower. Others have noted the open latticework divider screen between the bathroom and bedroom, and we found it odd also. Privacy is at a (bare) minimum. We ate only a snack in the hotel's well-recommended Eos restaurant. The room has a fine view, but has a chilly aura and we saw few diners the times we peeked in. Maybe the wrong times. We very much liked Fratelli Milano at 213 SE lst St. and the new La Provence French bakery and cafe at 249 E. Flagler, both across the river in easy walking distance. We were glad we chose the Viceroy. Good room, good location, and helpful staff. My wife would return even if only for the fantastic pool area, with its skyscraper views and huge main infinity pool. When the 15th-floor wind whipped up choppy water she felt she was swimming the English Channel, and loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Chillaxin'”
Reviews.Author: miami305
Reviews.Content: Very good service (for Miami). The rooms could be cleaner, but the common areas were clean. Room service was very good; quick & efficient. (nothing like breakfast in bed!) The rooms are quite small, so it's definitely worth it to upgrade to a suite. Nice granite counters, good sized tub, floor to ceiling windows. Great location for taking a stroll. Lots of restaurants & bars close by. The pool area is nice (not as nice as Epic, but still nice) It's a great spot to just lay back, drink some champagne, and chill!

Reviews.Title: “Very good for a short stay!”
Reviews.Author: sunnytravel99999
Reviews.Content: Great hotel to stay for a night or two while in the Miami area, like we did last October. There is certainly not much to do / see in the area nearby. Two blocks away there was a little shopping center and a variety of restaurants. Rooms were very spacious and clean, breakfast was good, service efficent. All what you would expect from a 5 star city (business) hotel. Anyway for a longer stay I would recommend to stay in a Miami Beach hotel.

Reviews.Title: “viceroy”
Reviews.Author: springholme
Reviews.Content: never done a review before but thought anyone wanting to stay in this 5 star hotel should know what they are about. Firstly, we stayed in a water suite which was absolutely amazing, cant fault it in any way - spacious, clean and comfortable. Thats where this hotel stops. 1. Swimming pool - not what it looks like in photo. It is really 3 seperate pools and not particularly attractive. There is not much sun to be had as most of sunbeds are in the shade. also no bar service at all - if you want a drink you have to go to the cafe!!! Not 5 star 2. SERVICE : Not very helpful. We are vegetarian and I asked the reception if they could book us into their restaurant and was told we cannot cater for vegetarians and would have to go somewhere else, and gave me a lap top to scroll for a restaurant - no advice or nothing. spent an hour looking and finally another receptionist came along and advised we go to the Epic hotel (5 minutes away) - amazing place, so helpful, beautiful restaurant and scenery and of course helped us with our veggie diet :) 3. Lastly - NO BAR - only in restaurant, unless you are there on a friday or saturday then there is club 50, which other than the view wasnt nice. Want to also mention that viceroy is a very small hotel for guests. it has loads of apartments with it and that is mainly what it consists of so..... no facilities and of course everyone is by pool. So, to conclude lovely bedroom if thats where you want to be but nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AV_Surrey
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels in the US that I have used. The rooms are spacious, modern look and feel plus small balcony for view outside the hotel. Nice internal dÃ©cor, large bed plus a mini kitchenette in case you in town for a longer stay The staff is extremely cordial and on a look out to help where possible. The nightclub on 50th floor has amazing views of the Miami skyline and sea, pity it only operates Fri and Sat. Long queues to get in but express and free entry for the hotel guests. Not too far from downtown, the hotel is in a handy location

Reviews.Title: “Design hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aja-Boutique
Reviews.Content: Design hotel, spacy rooms, centrally located, with amazing pool on top. Peferct views with Miami bay. Service in restaurant needs to be improved!

Reviews.Title: “What a refreshing weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: Lysistrata79
Reviews.Content: I met my husband in miami over Jan 27th weekend. He checked in the day before and loved the room that he had to upgrade for the nights I came. We've been to a lot of top rated miami hotels thru the help of trip advisor, however I have to say this may be my favorite hotel. Yes, its not on the beach, but you can easily take a cab there or drive, if you're renting. The decor is very art deco, and so beautiful. The rooms are very spacious and you dont really feel like you are staying at a hotel, more like renting a luxury apartment (if you get the suit). The staff was very kind and helpful and I thought it was very courteous to inform us with a letter brought over thru the evening turndown that the miami marathon was happening the next day and the possibiltiy of traffic. They also offered to help with travel needs. The pools are on the roof of the 15th floor, and wow what a view. It felt like you were on the ground floor until you realize that you are floating between buildings. The restaurant EOS was beautiful and serviced some delicious fare. And the spa... The most unique Ive seen for sure! So beautiful and relaxing. I didnt get any services, however because checkout was at noon and they were fully commited, we werent flying out until evening, we were told that we could use the pool, gym and spa facilities. The waiting room was like no other, chaise lounges, sofas, jacuzies, apples and water all with a great view of the port and ocean. The locker room was so serene, and the steam room was entirely enclosed in glass. Overall, exceptional service, luxurious ambiance, and a fabulous stay. I would definitely go back once our bank account recovers ;)

Reviews.Title: “Over-the-top decor”
Reviews.Author: marles83
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business to be close to a conference hotel. The room was spacious, very well outfitted, huge tub, hot plate, microwave, coffee service, etc. The decorator must have been paid on the amount of variation in the rooms and common areas. Everything elegant but a bit large and a few too many - but fun to be in for a few days. The pool area was fabulous as was the spa/fitness area. The bar was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Among the best”
Reviews.Author: MrCouture
Reviews.Content: Great location, Amazing place, great View, staff was amaZing . No complaints about the wild Party being held In my suite. The numerous times I had a request front desk had Whatever I requested at my door pronto. Make the right choice and stay at the viceroy.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and unhygienic rooms paired with horrible service”
Reviews.Author: snaujoks
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel started off very badly when we were "greeted" by front desk assistant manager Jose Rico-Arango in a very unprofessional manner. He was unable to confirm advertised pricing options from the internet and made the check-in process a nightmare. The same front desk manager did not act on a complaint about MANY mosquitoes in our room. Instead "offered" to DOWNGRADE the room from a suite to a normal king room. The reasoning was that the other room was on a higher level with less likelihood of having mosquitoes. No action was taken to remedy the situation, even though the bath tub had evidence of many mosquitoes that had died in the meantime. After that we discovered additional cleanliness issues, the most annoying one being that the carpet had patches with lots of sand on it. On top of all of that the hotel is in a very noisy area with most rooms facing a 6 lane street, one could hear cars, honking, and rush hour traffic all night and morning. I would not recommend this hotel if you are a light sleeper or are picky about the cleanliness of your rooms. Not to mention that the front desk service was unacceptable for a hotel that expensive. An a good note: the suites are spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good service + food but not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: ClientServiceExpert
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed it but during my week-long stay not everything was perfect in restaurant and with their service. Spa/gym/pool is located in a building across the square and to get there, one has to cross a large square. When I was staying, it was heavily raining few days and it was not comfortable to walk there. Location = really depends on purpose of the visit. It is close to downtown but not south beach

Reviews.Title: “viceroy outstanding”
Reviews.Author: mikevortho
Reviews.Content: Best hotel ever! Check out the pools! The rooms and staff were a solid 10+. We will stay here ever time we are in Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel 5 minutes from port”
Reviews.Author: Worldvoyager1
Reviews.Content: Found hotel on Trip Advisor and stayed there one night before a cruise because it appeared closest to the port. What a wonderful surprise...colorful modern oceanfront hotel...excellent service...great food. Loved all the art...sometimes beautiful, sometimes whimsical art pieces wherever you looked. Next time in Miami will definitely stay there. Only drawback may be that its location is such that there is nothing, no restaurant or shop withing walking distance.You have to taxi everywhere if you want to leave the property.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, rude service!”
Reviews.Author: Blake1234
Reviews.Content: Just awful! Room and facilities were very nice although we had problems with the shower and sink. Also the bathroom was dirty. Some staff were slimy, rude and/or inappropriate. I took the time to fill out the survey they emailed after my stay detailing all of the issues and never heard from them...not really surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Waswo
Reviews.Content: We selected the Viceroy for the night before a cruise. Any of the South Beach hotels would have required enormous taxi fares but the Viceroy is close to the cruise port. We thought it was a delightful room; the bed was comfortable; the bathroom was elegant. The decor was very stylish and had some strangely intriguing and artistic touches. We had dinner at the hotel's restaurant, Eos, and it was superb. The following morning before checking out we saw the fitness center which was magnificent. The pool is fantastic. Indeed, we took several photographs. I only had one complaint: although the breakfast at Eos was excellent, they had the radio turned on to some sort of loud, pulsating, dj house sort of music. The previous night the music was soft and appropriate. Who wants a $50.00 breakfast to sound like a nightclub at 2 AM???? Who wants to eat breakfast eggs and not be able to speak to one's companion? I asked the waitress about the music in hopes that she would turn it down and she told me it was a "special DJ mix." Otherwise this would be a 5 star review. Management should consider softer morning music. I will stay there next time I go to Miami, but would not go there for breakfast. Overall, good and convenient choice.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated!”
Reviews.Author: abadra
Reviews.Content: With a very common Miami feeling in every space, itÂ´s not a luxury hotel no matter how you try to sell it. Dark rooms, dark halls, small front desk attended by unexperienced people, noise all day long and poor Brickell Ave. views, a very costly valet service. On the other hand, original rooms, an allegued trendy club, and very good location. A Ok room service.

Reviews.Title: “daughters 16th”
Reviews.Author: trimom1
Reviews.Content: I got a room which was wonderful large enough for all of us, the pool was very large awesome views, but the weather did not really cooperate that day. My daughters b day was at EO's upstairs and everything was taken care of,even down to the menus with the pre-chosen selection on them. With the heading #### birthday bash, forgot to mention there where 18 of them. I would say it was Sunday so it was quite.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Spacious, Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: mkbnj
Reviews.Content: If you are in the are this is a very good hotel. The room was HUGE, the bathroom spacious beautiful and modern, the bed comfortable, the tv, furniture and amenities top-rate and in new, clean condition. The restaurant is very good, I used it for breakfast and dinners. The wireless internet was a bit slow but usable. The swimming pool was strangely out of the sun for most of the day, it is shared by 3 condo buildings which cast the pool in the shadows. The spa is very upscale and exercise room was perfect, though it's a bit of a walk and in another building. The lobby is small and not conducive to sitting around, and the restaurant/bar closes at 11pm, a bit early to be fully useful.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, just be careful on wet marble”
Reviews.Author: Stephen J
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Miami Viceroy in September 2011 and it was, in a word, fabulous! The room was large and decadently furnished. Great views. The pool was enormous, I think it's shared with the condo owners (sadly J-Lo didn't join me for a dip) but it wasn't busy. The only downside was, as nice as the marble spa area was, water + marble = injuries. Apart from that, I can't recommend it enough if you're staying in downtown Miami and fancy a splurge. It's close to the free metro mover and some great restaurants a few stops away, we particularly liked the Argentine steak restaurant Novecento.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, boring location, they charge for everything!”
Reviews.Author: CCHLondon
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a 4 night stay in Jan, staying in a one bed suite. Positives: nice big room, comfy bed, pleasant view over the water, fairly peaceful Negatives: its in downtown so all around are offices and concrete; you need a cab or use your car to go for dinner or to south beach, the staff were fine but not perhaps as committed/friendly as in other US hotels, the hotel bar was non existent (a corridor in the restaurant) and the hotel seems to have a policy of charging for literally everything. The one which really got me was charging a dollar (plus service charge!...for a coffee you make yourself!) for a pod of coffee for the in-room coffee machine. When the room rate is above 400 dollars a night this seems tight, in the extreme - i half expected them to charge for toilet roll as well.. Overall, its fine but not special.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful & modern!”
Reviews.Author: Jenn W
Reviews.Content: Quick stay of only 1 night but very spacious room, delicious bed & very friendly staff. Could be an expensive rate but look for deals & then it's really, really worth it. Didn't try the restaurant but there's other stuff nearby. 15min from the cruise ship ports by taxi!

Reviews.Title: “Ritzy New-Age Hotel--Perfect for a Miami Weekend”
Reviews.Author: BerraBerro
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Viceroy despite a few initial hiccups. If you keep your eyes open you can get steeply discounted rates, which make the stay a more affordable. We checked in late, but had called ahead to let them know we wouldn't be checking in until 9. Unfortunately, they gave our room away, but upgrade us to a suite. It was a nice gesture, but the suite was very sterile and it only had one bed. We asked to be moved on our second night to a regular room. It was well decorated and warm with a small balcony. My biggest issue with both rooms was the bathroom situation. In the suite, it was off of the bedroom, but the walls were paper thin which made it embarrassing to use. In the regular room the bathroom was "open" AKA there was no wall separating the bed from the shower and the shower had a see-through door. If you are staying alone no big deal, but if you are sharing a room with anybody other than a person who you want to share your most intimate bathroom moments with beware. The pool was amazing--just awesome. The spa was one of the most gorgeous spa waiting areas I've ever seen. Just immaculately decorated. I got a one hour massage and it was one of the worst massages EVER. I made a mention that I wasn't satisfied when I checked out and paid the $200 bill (with tip) and the receptionist apologized, but didn't offer me a discount. I later got a call from the manager and a 20% discount which was great, but I would have paid not to get the massage it was so awful. Point being, the Viceroy isn't perfect, but they sure try to be. I would stay here again in a second if I got a discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “New meaning to a "high" floor room”
Reviews.Author: econometricsquant
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I just returned from two nights at the Viceroy. I had some pretty big expectations upon arrival, and was really looking forward to using the great pool on the 15th floor. Unfortunately, the weather in Miami after the 1st of the year did not cooperate. Overall, I was very pleased with the Viceroy. We had a one bedroom suite and it was a VERY nice room. It was located on the 7th floor (the Viceroy rooms only go up to the 14th floor) overlooking the drawbridge / waterway and directly facing the Kimpton Epic. Lots of nice views of the yachts docking at the Epic. The service was very good. We ordered in-room dining three times during our two night stay and the food was very good, and the price was not unreasonable (as it usually is at a nicer hotel.) We also enjoyed the small kitchenette area with the espresso machine. Our neighbors down the hall were dancing with Mary Jane the entire time we were there, which was interesting. The smell was never particularly bothersome unless the door to our room was opened. I did find it interesting that the hotel seemed to be trying to cover it up with perfume sprays in the hallway, and some sort of air purifying device. Funny they didn't just knock on the door and tell them it was a "non-smoking (weed, too) room", ha?! I did find myself looking out our large balcony at the Epic across the water wishing we had stayed there. The views and pool deck from the Epic looked to be better than the Viceroy's. The 15th floor pool at the Viceroy is very impressive, but doesn't get a lot of sun in January and is a little crowded out by the residents of the buildings the Viceroy shares the Icon Brickell property with. Overall, the rooms are some of the nicest we've stayed in. The service was top-notch, as was the in-room food. I was just a little disappointed with the location. If you want a better water view room from a higher location, I would really advise checking out the Epic. I believe their rooms go as high as 31 floors, vs. the 14th floor at the Viceroy.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel with fantastic rooms in a dull location”
Reviews.Author: SanjG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Viceroy in December for 2 nights after a week cruise. Arrived early and room not ready. After a few hours, we were given a bigger room so it worked out well. Room very fancy but not child-friendly due to the lack of a screen between the glass wall of the bathroom and bedroom, but perfect for a couple. The area around the hotel was very quiet and the only choice was to dine at the Mary Bricknell Village or the Bay Side which is more lively.

Reviews.Title: “A Most Modern and Quirky Resting Place”
Reviews.Author: Mariner1947
Reviews.Content: Yea, the art is Modern for the most part but the eclectic Easter Island Statues on the side entrance really set the tone for this fun filled, funky but upscale digs on the water. The occasional Pirate ship Fireworks at night as seen from the roof Spa are almost as spectacular as the enormous pool on the same12th floor but not as engaging as the quint little restaurant with the most creative, killer keylime pie we've ever had including the many in Key West woofed down in earlier years of wasted youth. The room was spacious especially the marbelled bath area and the appointments all over the art deco map from ceramic dragons to replicas of elephant tusks. A wimsical setting from which to venture out to South Beach in a short taxi ride or play in Miami proper. The only negative was the staff; expect to have to follow up on your requests in order to achieve most of your arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: finediningbreathing
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed it. Rooms awesome. Carpet had little stain but over looked it. Restaurant just ok. Club very nice. Really enjoyed it. Not on beach but not far away. View and spa great. Nice walk and run area. I say stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and very reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: GrandCaymanRenee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Viceroy over Christmas 2011 and had a wonderful time. It was our first time in Downtown, as we usually stay in either Southbeach or Coconut Grove, but wanted to try something different. The hotel itself is very nice, and the rooms are fabulous (we had a one bedroom suite, and it was huge). The only negative is that it feels very residential - they do not have a bar by the pool and there are loads of children around the public areas. Downtown itself doesnt have alot happening, but is nice for a change of pace. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I regret I had a short stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Liylly
Reviews.Content: I travel to Miami at least four times a year and I love to pick different hotels.At this time my choice was Viceroy and it was an unforgetable experiece.THe coolest hotel I`ve ever stayed in Miami.Amazing decoration,large rooms(the bathroom of my junior suite was huge),nice staff. I do regret not having stayed longer to spend some time in the wonderful pool area!! I must come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, poor service”
Reviews.Author: RodrigoPAntunes
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the hotel one night, with my family, in two rooms, last november. I booked the hotel throw ------------- and payed it more than one month in advance. The hotel is very nice, the room is very modern and spacious - has one of the best beds I ever slept. The breakfast could have more options, like a buffet, it's quiet expensive. The internet needs to be free of charge, considering it's easy and cheap to access internet everywhere in the US. The big problem: they charged the two rooms twice, and I've already payed my credit card bill. I'm complaining and sending mails to the hotel since I returned to Brazil - almost one month ago - and nothing so far. In Brazil you pay taxes if you use your credit card, and the taxes that I payed will not be returned when the hotel cancel the bill - I pray they cancel, they made a big mistake. Sorry, but the accounting department seems unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “Miami roccoco style experience pushed to the max, amazing !”
Reviews.Author: BEEPfromPARIS
Reviews.Content: Viceroy hotel, club 50 (means 50th floor, not for 50s patrons...) and Viceroy residence share the same big highrise building at 485 Brickell, downtown Miami, immediately just before you cross the Brickell bridge at the mouth of the Miami river. It is 5 minute walk to the METROMOVER 5th ave. Look for the peculiar face-shape columns, where Maserati(s) and Porsche(s) queue for valet parking. Early december, it cost 1406,85 USD, all inclusive, for 3 nights, in a ONE BEDROOM WATERVIEW SUITE. This includes the view over the Miami river, the Brickell bridge and continental breakfast for 2, worths maximum 14 USD each. We like : -Unique, extravagantly Baroque and unidentified style (can call this creative freestyle), from the moment you enter the lobby. -Luxuriously appointed and large room. Kitchenette-bar with a large microwave. XXXL soft-to-die-for bed. XXXL bathroom with separate shower, tub and toilet. Yep, there is also a second toilet at the entrance. So chic ! -Incedible Olympic pool on 15th floor, with the whole pool area is as large as twice the size of a soccer field. Amazing, go to their website, it is as true as the photos are. -Polite and efficient staff We donâ€™t : -Almost 500 USD a night and internet is still extra, but at a reasonnable 9,95 USD all inclusive per 24 hours. -Almost 500 USD a night and ABSOLUTELY NOTHING complimentary, beside sugar bags. The magnificent Expresso machine you see in the kitchen from ILLY only accepts (provided) Illy capsules, each at 1 USD. For instance... -Being in the financial district, shops are few and you need all your strong feet to reach the nearest restaurant. Alternatively, the houseâ€™s restaurant, the EOS, on 15th floor has a nice menu at reasonnable price. So the Viceroy comes at no bargain, but walking on venitian marble floor in your room and lying by the pool while contemplating Miamiâ€™s skyline on a clear cloudless night (every night) alone, worth every penny. We did love the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Junior suite was spot on”
Reviews.Author: Daveth1956
Reviews.Content: Met by staff on arrival, valet parking and bell boy very helpfull could not have been nicer, reception staff just as good, unable to get a free uograde but given a corner room overlooking city and bay. Room was very big (bathroom as big as some hotel rooms) and comfortable. Hotel is in the downtown district, we only needed a place for the night en route from Key west up to Orlando so served very well, .....what a swimming pool, 300 feet long on the 15th floor with incredible views. We had a complimentary breakfast in the deal but the hotel tried charging for this but took off the bill when challenged, also we had free wi-fi but did not get it. overall we enjoyed our stay and would consider if back in Miami again

Reviews.Title: “The Second Coolest Hotel I have ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Croozcritic
Reviews.Content: From N.C. Wife and I just spent our Anniversary at the Viceroy. Loved the experience. We're not normally Downtown types, in the past its always been South Beach for us since we generally like the Beach, however the Brickell area is crazy nice. Everything is new and the nightlife active. Ton's of nice restaurants with 2 blocks. I occasionally read complaints concerning the Viceroy's room lighting or Espresso maker being hard to operate, or the Spa and Gym being hard to find. Or, that the Hotel is not on the beach. Do people not have a brain? Can they not pre-plan and or look at Hotel information on the internet prior to booking? Can they not view a map for location? We had no concerns with anything facility related at The Viceroy. Our 1 bedroom suite was by far the nicest room we have ever vacationed in, and we've been to some nice places over the years. The wife was in constant awe during our entire stay. Our bathroom was huge with marble everywhere. The room lighting wonderful, two flat screen TV,'s, dinning area, huge balcony, amazing! The Spa was by far the nicest one we're experienced. Amazing, with amazing service! Same for the Fitness area. Whats really nice about The Viceroy is, that fellow travelers and condo owners here are Pretty People. At least far more impressinve that Joe Public. The wife and I sat around the Pool and common areas making note of this daily. The River and Bay views alone are worth the trip when staying here, whether it be from the 16th floor Pool Deck or from a northern facing rooms balcony. The only downsides to The Viceroy Miami could be traffic noise from Brickell Ave.if you have a Westward facing Room, especially on a lower floor. Also the fact that Valet Only Parking cost you $34 per day. The Hotels Club 50 on the other hand is way over-rated. Yes the views are worth the elevator ride, but this place is totally worn-out and trashed. Hopefully it will soon be renivated. The patrons here at night are all younger than 22, so if your over 30 you will feel out of place. JAs for the Hotel, jst preplan your trip and you will be very happy with a Viceroy Vacation.

Reviews.Title: “trendy, sleek”
Reviews.Author: islandgirl080
Reviews.Content: My husband and i overnighted here before heading to mexico for our honeymoon. firstly we were upgraded to a huge suite which was fantastic. it was decorated very modern and the view of the pool and the ocean was great. the pool area was beautiful as well as the hotel lobby. we ate breakfast at eos restaurant which was pretty good. l

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ricardo3718
Reviews.Content: This place is actually more adult oriented, not much of a vacation hotel if you are bringing kids and just planning to stay at the hotel without going out. Regarding that, on the contrary of what we thought about when we got there with our toddler, we canâ€™t say enough how helpful, friendly and kind the staff was regarding our stay specially with how much they were willing to help with our baby, just canâ€™t recall having to struggle with anything . The rooms are really spacious and to be honest the kitchenette in the room was our day saver with all the stuff we had to do regarding baby formulas and baby bottles, not there for that purpose but either way really helpful. No complains, and no doubt in coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice, But 4-Stars at Best”
Reviews.Author: RNG1008
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during Memorial weekend in May. The room was quite nice and well appointed. The gym was fantastic, the infinity pool was enormous and the spa was also great. The downsides for this hotel are its location and service. Location being in the downtown area is more remote than staying near the beach. (But ironically, during my weekend, staying away from South Beach turned out to be a blessing due to the festivities at the time). The service was okay as well. Unfortunately, the crowd that stays in this hotel (and also the visitors to the club on the roof), is similar to what it would look like had the cast of MTV's Jersey Shore paid a visit. It may be exactly perfect for some, but unfortunately that was not what we were looking for. Many other options to consider while in Miami but if you can get this at the right price (i.e., <$150), it may be worth considering. Otherwise, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel! Great location Miami Downtown”
Reviews.Author: sunshine123_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is definitely worth the money. It is really special, the rooms are big and we had a balcony. The pools on the 15th floor are huge with a wonderful view. In walking distance are several nice restaurants and bars. We just stayed for one night at the hotel but would definitely go back there if we are in the area. Metromover is just a short walk away as well. A wonderful hotel, not cheap but worth the money if you are looking for a special place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Should be #1 in Miami!”
Reviews.Author: JSomerset
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing place - our room was great, the staff couldn't do enough to ensure we had a good stay. The swimming pool is to die for - it's 65 metres long on the roof of the 15th floor - just stunning! The Viceroy deserves all its accolades. It's the most comfortable hotel we've stayed in when visiting Miami - you can keep the ultra-trendy SoBe hotels and the increasingly tacky SoBe strip. Just up the road from the Viceroy is the Brickell Plaza, home to the full range of restaurants and bars, all happening and great value, not over-priced SoBe. Thanks to all the Viceroy staff for a really fabulous stay - especially Jennifer and Nicole on reception, Alex in the restaurant and the lovely guys who look after the pool area. You really made us welcome!

Reviews.Title: “This is one classy place!”
Reviews.Author: flossygirl
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place is lovely. We arrived for one night getting ready to go on a cruise but wished we could have stayed longer. We had a standard room and it was beautiful. I can only imagine what the other rooms were like. We even had a balcony. Check in was fast, staff were top-notch, furnishings were superb and I'd love to go back. Well done Viceroy!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in Downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: harrygill
Reviews.Content: Was there for a business trip and stayed 3 nights. I got upgraded to a deluxe room as soon as I arrived. Comfortable bed, balcony with views of the intercostals. Palatial bathroom, as big as the bed room was my favorite part of the accommodations. There was a small kitchenette, would be ideal for people with small children. My favorite part was the pool. It was on the 15th floor and the views from the far side of the pool were amazing. The gym was adequate. The gym is shared with resident in the adjoining buildings. The reason I knew that was there were 2 separate sign in sheets. Also, it was difficult to find. Also the pool bar is not open all the time. Had a hard time quenching my thirst after a hard dayâ€™s work. Overall, great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: nikkigfoster
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in Miami so far! Where do I begin? I'll start with the beautiful spa. Their spa is so relaxing and breathtaking. The customer service is so genuine and appreciated. Mary and Jessica were so accomodating as I checked in. I arrived earlier than expected for check-in and Nicole at the front desk politely advised me that I could go to the spa to relax while I waited for my room. There I was able to take a shower, visit the plunge pools, use the hot tub, enjoy the juice bar and fruit amenities, need I say more?! This was all before I even checked in my room!!! Shortly after my shower, Nicole called to let me know that my room was ready and from there it went uphill. The rooms are very spacious and I particularly enjoyed the bathroom in the King Deluxe. I felt like a queen in my palace when I walked in. The decor is phenominal and makes you feel like you're in royalty. I really enjoyed my stay. The pool is amazing as well. The view on the water is picture-perfect. The location is close to 10th street where all of the restaurants, shops, and bars are...walking distance. Again, I can't say it enough...thoroughly enjoyed my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Viceroy is the place to be in downtOwn Miami! Sleek and sexy!”
Reviews.Author: Chicken1985
Reviews.Content: Well just driving in is breathless! Very beautiful hotel and the lobby is pretty modern. Checking in was a blessing when my friend and I was staying there. A beautiful young lady upgraded our 300 ish$ room for a 2 bedroom suite. Maybe this had something to do with construction going on. It didn't bother me because we had only 7 hours of work then we would be living the night life. The room was beautiful and had a very classly yet new age design to it! 2 showers 2 room what else can you ask for. The view was awesome and we had a full kitchen! Our work had a special pass that only rooms on certain level can access with separate elevators. It was funny to get comments from the staff that I was enter the wrong side with my buddy ( we 25 and 24 ) I had my far shares of 5 stars hotels around the world and this place is something I will remember! Don't get me started on the infinity pool and just the pool area. Heated and sexy view of downtown and Miami beach!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: nwright
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel.. I found the staff upon check-in to be very nice and friendly..The rooms and overall property was clean.. I stayed in a one bedroom suite and it was incredible, lots of space, big bathroom, space to work if you are on business. Room service (Breakfast) was fast and food was good. Great gym and Spa.. Absolutely wonderful pool and deck with a fantastic view of the bay.. I used concierge to book a restaurant reservation and he did a remarkable job.. A couple things to note... the hotel is near a busy draw bridge so each time the bridge goes up the no cross bell rings quite loudly and if you are on a lower floor and facing the river it can be irritating... Also, I was peeved that wireless is not exactly complimentary as written in the hotel ad.. It is only free in the lobby of the hotel, I found the way in which the ad is written that it is free everywhere, even in the rooms. Not the case, there is a $9.00 per day charge for wireless access.. I felt there is a bit of deception in the ad the way it is written... Besides that, it is a great hotel.. love it and would return..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Drowned in Residences....”
Reviews.Author: bmordski
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Viceroy Miami for one night and found it to be an amazingly designed and executed hotel. My one complaint would be the feeling that the hotel is drowned in residences. I realize that much of Miami suffers from result of the real estate boom and crash but it is unfortunate to see such an amazing hotel project handicapped by the associated development. The pool was huge and had amazing views, the restaurants were efficient if not culinary masterpieces and while I did not have a treatment at the spa the space is amazingly well designed. The theater room is a true trip I wish I had time to experience and the spin studio looked great. The word on the street was that Club 50 on the roof was the place to be late night but after coming back from a world music club and seeing the line, and the crowd, we elected not to check it out. I would highly recommend this hotel if looking for a downtown Miami property though I personally will probably stay on South Beach next time I find myself in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and luxurious hotel”
Reviews.Author: HB4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite simply amazing. The decor and the facilities are just jaw droppingly beautiful. The pool and spa are like nothing I've ever seen. The massive tree lined main pool is on the 15th floor alongside another 2 smaller pools, a giant chess board, an outdoor fireplace, and plenty of oversize comfy loungers (more like double beds though!) for sunbathing. The indoor jacuzzi area is beautiful and serene in a library style setting all in white apart from the huge bright yellow chandelier to give the area a modern touch. There are several jacuzzis with armchairs, sofas and chaise longues for relaxing in. Even the changing rooms are the most luxurious I have every seen with chandeliers, a mirrored dressing table and oversize mirrors. The gym is large, well equipped with an amazing view of the Biscayne Bay. I stayed in a suite for a few nights with stunning views overlooking the bay. Very comfy 4 poster bed, large room with balcony and huge bathroom. Kitchenette is very handy too. One of the most stylish hotel rooms I have every stayed in. One small gripe about the hotel is the valet ... waiting time varied between 5 and 20 minutes and the service wasn't up to scratch with the rest of the hotel. Reception is also the concierge who were very friendly and knowledgable. For restaurants walk to the Mary Brickell area which is no more than 10 mins for plenty of fantastic restaurants and bars. Will definitely come back to this unique and exceptional hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: rzmitchell
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I recently had a wedding at the Viceroy and there are no words to describe the level of service, professionalism, courtesy displayed by the entire team....special thanks to Jorge & Mario who made everything possible for us....we stayed at the viceroy for a week and the experience was wonderful..the food was excellent and all staff were very helpful and courteous.....Thanks again Viceroy for everything.....

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping stole a bag of personal belongings!”
Reviews.Author: Vicki4141
Reviews.Content: We choose to stay at the viceroy so that our personal items would be secure and no one would visit unexpectedly. This choice was very frustrating and a costly mistake; that has not been correct or followed up on respectfully. Housekeeping admits to taking our items. Security manager asked for us to sent them receipts and now... We are being ignored. I can't believe they are making us get our lawyer involved to recover money that is less then 5% of the money we spent on accommodations. Valet guys are excellent, pool is great, rooms are comfortable but management is deceitful and disrespectful! Be cautious of housekeeping!!!

Reviews.Title: “$36 a night for parking, $10 per day for internet in room, $10 water bottles, MEDIOCRE SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: 369ann
Reviews.Content: $36 a night for parking, $10 per day for internet in room, $10 water bottles. The hotel has a beautiful big rooftop pool and that's about it. The service is seriously pathetic for what you're paying. They have a long way to go with service or professionalism. I found the service mediocre, polite at most but definitely not impressed nor anything close to a 4 or 5 star, overheard the parking valet attendants making a racist comment about me in spanish to my face thinking i wouldn't understand. The rooms are darkly lit, with a too hard to work coffee/espresso machine, and light switches hidden in wear angles. Be very careful before you open anything, or drink anything out of the mini fridge, just take a walk outside about a block away and pick up water from the deli it'll cost you 1/10 of what the hotel rips you of. I specifically called 2 weeks ahead to request a bay/water side view since the only reason i was paying so much was for a water view and a rooftop pool. They promised me they'll have it available, and since i gave them such advance notice it shouldn't be a problem. I followed up my call/request a few times and up to a day before i flew there. When i got there, they did not honor my request, nor any attempt to apologize or accomodate me, just a simple "it wasn't available", and i was given a room with a non impressive, loud street view. The decor is outdated and tacky, the room is so dark even with all the lights on. The hotel is in the end of nowhere, i didn't see any pedestrians walking around. While checking out, they could not locate my car, i was running late to catch my plane but was left waiting outside for my car for 30 minutes the front desk person did not seem to care, I had to keep going back in and asking, so that he'll get up and do something about it. The only upside is the rooftop pool, which due to the monsoon that hit, i couldn't even enjoy. I was just so fed up with everything, and happy to leave. I don't have a problem treating myself and putting down money for quality, But this was pathetic and disappointing. They certainly have a long way to go to come close to the quality of professional service you'll receive from hotels like the Four Seasons or Mandarin Oriental. Disappointed, overpriced. Go somewhere else for class and professionalism.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blueaquarius
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay at this hotel. We stayed for 3 nights and our experience was wonderful. The staff were very polite and helpful with all our requests. The room was beautiful and the bed was extremely comfortable, your body just melted into the bed. The bathrooms were huge and the room was well decorated. The best part of the hotel is the 15th floor. It's just the most picturesque area that I have ever seen, 2 pools, one being a beautiful infinity pool surrounded by small well groomed trees and another smaller heated pool. There are several cabanas and chairs around the pool so there is a lot of room to sit and enjoy the pool. There is also a huge balcony on the 15th floor that wraps around one side of the building with nice large cushioned chairs for two so that you can enjoy the view. I loved this hotel and would come back for sure.....I don't even know how anyone can write a bad review about this hotel, it was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Krisy06
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 night stay at the Viceroy before our cruise. The hotel was more than we expected, The Room/ Staff/ Pool & area were outstanding! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “No heart, no soul, no consideration for the traveler”
Reviews.Author: WolfG
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that has forgotten that it is in the hospitality business and that its guests comfort and needs should come first. It is a hotel that has put form and design over function and convenience. I would never stay here again. I booked a three day stay for a business trip. I stayed here once before, only for one night, shortly after the hotel opened what seemed like a year or so ago. I arrived in Miami on an early morning flight from San Francisco and met with my client and my local counsel for several hours in the morning. I left SF not feeling well, and by mid day on the day I arrived, I was feeling very bad. I didnâ€™t know then that I was walking around with pneumonia that would eventually require a six day hospital stay. All I knew was I needed to rest. I called the hotel about noon and asked for an early check-in explaining I didnâ€™t feel well. The clerk said check-in was 3:00 pm, and they had nothing available. I asked for the manager but was told he wasnâ€™t available. I said there had to be a single room that was available, that not everyone could have checked out exactly at noon, but the clerk persisted in saying nothing was available. I asked if they would call me if anything came available, stressing that I did not feel well. Whoever I spoke with was cold and indifferent, said they would call, but no one ever called. I ended up crashing for a few hours at my local counselâ€™s office and finally got to the hotel shortly after 3:00 pm. The roomâ€™s presentation, at first glance, is attractive and well laid out. But, at this place, form has trumped function. The lighting is low and inadequate for any type of work. There are inadequate towels and one little mat for the entire cold marble floor which extends to a separate toilet. You have to move the mat around or sit with your feet on cold marble. No hair dryer, no bathrobe, limited hangers all make this a very unpleasant place to stay. Itâ€™s glitz and glam, but no heart and no thought for the weary traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Darghan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Viceroy Hotel Miami for three nights recently for business. The room I was allocated was a great size with a fantastic bed and amazing bathroom. The decor of the rooms and the foyer of the hotel are very quirky but work well. The bed was comfortable and the room was extremely quiet. The staff at the hotel were extremely helpful even when we checked in very late at night. The amenities at the hotel were wonderful. There is a resort style pool and large spa and there is a great view from the pool area. The hotel is divided into residential towers and guest towers. The hotel website gives a true picture of the hotel. I took advantage of a three nights for two package, which made the hotel very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: devineelle
Reviews.Content: The Viceroy is great and the staff were amazing. Having stayed at the Viceroy for a week late August we found the hotel, services, location and staff to be brilliant hence, would recommend the hotel to others. Valet parking â€“ good We had no other parking options other than the valet, it was expensive however, what was the alternative. The staff brought out the car in good time and were very courteous. Room â€“ Excellent The room was larger than expected and very clean. The mini kitchen was a great help. Pool â€“ amazing The main pool on the 15th floor was great, it was huge and had an amazing view of the city. It was well maintained and the pool area was brilliant for relaxing. Gym â€“ excellent A wide range of equipment and good opening hours. Location â€“ good We went to the local restaurants and the I 95 was close by which enabled us to drive to south beach etc which little hassle. Service â€“ excellent All the staff were friendly and very helpful. Club â€“ excellent Club 50 was great and there was no cover charge as we were staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a modern, chic and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: rabss
Reviews.Content: Only negative - $34 mandatory valet Many many positives - Right off the bat I was impressed with the guest services at the front desk. We got there about 15 mins before check in time, and were taken care of efficiently. Also I noticed the other staff member handling a complicated guest issue with much grace and poise and was patient and friendly throughout - Kudos to her. The room was just amazing, with breathtaking views and chic decor. It was a gracious size and very clean. Even the bathroom had amazing views and the small balcony was nice too. The pools were beautiful and location of the hotel was great as well. I would wholeheartedly recommend to anyone and would go there myself when in Miami again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: protist
Reviews.Content: We have spent a night in the Viceroy this September and overall it was very disappointing. -Booked a King Room and got a Queen Room - It took Approx. 30 minutes to check us in without any excuse, 4 staff were talking and just doing nothing - Towles at the pool were out at 10 am (Remember, 5 Stars, 310 Dollar per night, unbelievable) - The whole hotel made the impression that best days are over and its only used as a cash cow without any futher investment - I wanted to talk to the management because of the problems we were faced with, not possible, they wanted to get in touch with me via email still waiting for an answer Dont get me wrong its a good place to stay and the pool is amazing but if you are used to great service dont expect too much

Reviews.Title: “Poor service: staff either a) don't speak English or b) are barely out of high school”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_30s
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself isn't bad. The rooms are reasonably well-appointed. The location is central, although not too close to the beach. The pool is nice. The spa is . . . well . . . a little cheap and tacky - and that's where the nice parts end. We went to this hotel expecting an upscale experience and good service similar to luxury hotels we've stayed in elsewhere. The biggest disappointments were the service and the food and the first sign was the young ladies checking us in. Both were perfectly nice and even willing to help, they just seemed like they'd either had too much to drink or were seriously dysfunctional. Packages went missing. Bellmen didn't talk to concierges. The valet parking guys didn't speak English and definitely did not talk to the girls at the front desk. Nobody could find our car. Nobody knew whether or not we had received the package we'd had mailed to the hotel. All service (room service, laundry, housekeeping, etc) was universally poor and slow. The food was also quite atrocious: rubber omelettes, odd-tasting juice, cold bacon, etc, and they charged us for the wrong meals and brought us menu items we didn't order. In the end, it was a poor experience. I can see that this hotel might work if you're a 25-year old kid who wants to go clubbing. The club downstairs looked pretty happening, although we didn't go. As mentioned, the location is quite central. So I guess I would recommend this hotel if you are a college kid - or a sailor (but only a very forgiving sailor who likes clubbing).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property with a horrible staff”
Reviews.Author: Imolarede46
Reviews.Content: I found a great rate on hotwire, booked a 5 night trip. What could go wrong? Let's see... Viceroy billed me twice for 2 nights on top of tagging a no smoking charge on when I had their housekeeping manager verify that the room had previously been smoked in. In my attempts to resolve the disputed charge I contacted Jose Arango, Brianna Osterberger , Nathaniel Morciego all with no resolve. The staff was rude, strung out, and had no intent on making the customer happy. I dont know their staff maintains 4.5 stars. The club was empty, the restaurants were horrible, and the crowd sub-par. Rooms were clean, pool was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulrb48
Reviews.Content: We had a few days holiday here, and had a room facing the street on the 4th floor. The room was spacious and well equipped with a kitchen built in alongside the wardrobe, including a microwave, a hob, fridge and the world's most complicated and unneccessary hard to use coffee maker. So complicated that it warrants its own instruction programme on the tv. Other than this the room was great with a large balcony - although no furniture to sit on the balcony, you have to drag a heavy room chair out there. Other things I found a little strange about this hotel was there being no sign of a decent guide to the property in the room, ie main pool opening times, where things ( eg gym ) are, how to get to the 50th floor pool, food and drink services. For example we had to go to the 15th floor restaurant to ask them if there was a bar, to be told there was one, escorted us into the restaurant to the bar but then told us they didn't do service to the outside area. No problem , we bought and carried our own drinks there ( its about 20 feet away). Still got the 18% service charge added though. So if you want a casual drink outside at night, it's made quite hard. On the positive side, the pool area is spectacular, massive, laid out excellently, great views and superb pools. Also the location is excellent for everything downtown. On request we were taken up to the 50th floor pool for a look around the view from there was also spectacular. Overall, very good, friendly and couteous staff, good valet parking service at $34/night and an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag!!”
Reviews.Author: Alison W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Viceroy for 4 nights as part of our holiday. The hotel itself is very beautiful and the interior design perfect. The rooms are huge, beautifully designed (not to mention the bathroom and 'that' bath!) and the Spa is AWESOME! However, downtown Miami is not the best location and our balcony was overlooking other hotels and office blocks. The Bar is nice but $18 for an average cocktail is a bit steep not to mention the 18% service charge already added to the bill "for my convenience"...it actually wasn't that convenient for me! We went to the rooftop club which was fun (as a hotel guest you do not have to wait in the que to get on or pay the entrance fee which is a nice touch.) However again once you are stung by $18 drinks - you don't really stay that long (the locals are all on water for the exact same reason!). To sum up we had a lovely stay at the Viceroy and would recommend people to stay there but only if they actually wanted to stay in downtown Miami...and didn't drink!

Reviews.Title: “Loud Street Noise - Poor Communication”
Reviews.Author: Aaron R
Reviews.Content: It is a beautiful hotel. Be advised tough, it is right on a main street and there is a nightclub attached to the lobby which is open until at least 3:00 AM on Friday's and Saturday's. There is a lot of street noise and bar / club noise if you are in a room facing the street. Also, while we were there, the fire alarm went off at 3:00 AM. No one seemed to know what was going on and no communication after the fact was provided to let us know what happened or to apologize for the inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible...My new favourite hotel in Miami.”
Reviews.Author: sgwlmm
Reviews.Content: Landed at MIA and took the 15 minute taxi ride for our first stay at The Viceroy. Normally that first night after the long haul from Heathrow all you care about is where you are going to rest your head! This hotel is REALLY impressive.. We soon perked up and decided to investigate it further. We were upgraded to a 1 bedroom river view suite which was huge. This was part of a special package they offer when you book online with them. The staff were warm and welcoming ALL over the hotel. The room, spa and especially the pools are fabulous. The pool is worthy of a special mention. It is on the 15th floor, surrounded by palms and overlooking the river. It is breathtaking. The only thing I cannot comment on is the food as we did not eat here during our brief stay before driving down to Key West the next morning..My experience of The Viceroy was superb and it will now be my hotel of choice in Miami (Downtown)..

Reviews.Title: “Viceroy Miami”
Reviews.Author: surfsideMichigan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Viceroy for just one night when I was in-transit and next time I will save myself the taxi fare and stay at the airport hotel! I thought I was treating myself by staying at the Viceroy but the experience was not too good. I arrived early and was checked in fine. The room was very nice although a little small. I went to the pool and it was chaos and not because the hotel was heavily booked! I backed off from the pool scene and went inside for lunch and had a waitress who not only spoke very poor English but was dense as well. My order took forever although there were very few people in the dining room, and when it came the meat was rancid. I am in the restaurant business and cook for a living so know when food is "off".
