I did not eat my lunch - sent it back to the kitchen with my complaint and nothing was done about it. The waitress just shrugged her shoulders and rolled her eyes. I cannot help but feel the only reason she has a job there is because she is very pretty but honestly, a little customer service goes a long way! There should have been apologies about the sandwich ( as I recall it was a beef dip ) and an offer to replace it with something else. I ended up with nothing and as it turns out was charged for the sandwich too! There are many excellent hotels in Miami ( earlier in the month I spent a glorious week at the Four Seasons, a wonderful place ) from which to choose and I will avoid the Viceroy.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth!”
Reviews.Author: MignonT
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the mix of the city and still have a mental, physical and spiritual vacation, stay at the Viceroy Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: Scott_Liles
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel by using Priceline. I am being very honest here as write, this is one of the most beautiful hotels I have ever stayed. My stay was July 3 and July 4th 2010 checking out on the 5th. I rank my experience very high with the other hotels that I have personally stayed and reviewed. Pros: The room, the pool, the lobby, the spa/ gym area, the hotel location, Very friendly staff. Bottom line: I just did not feel like I was in a hotel. Amazing overall experience. Cons: that I only stayed just 2 nights! Ha-ha Just for fun, I read the negative reviews. These negative people must work for the competition because I cannot relate to anything they said with my experience. I have since tried to stay again at the Viceroy, but Priceline found another hotel nearby instead. It was a nice hotel, but nothing like the Viceroy. Hope this review helps. michaelsliles@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Nicely designed downtown hotel, Don't miss the pools.”
Reviews.Author: tgdelb
Reviews.Content: The Viceroy was a nicely designed hotel with very good in room amenities. While everyone was very pleasant, I felt that the hotel was missing something in the way of service. From the moment I checked in I felt very little touch from the staff. I am not sure but it seemed kinda quiet. The hotel bar / restaurant was empty and had very little atmosphere. Maybe cause it was a weeknight but really it almost felt like they were closed at 9:30-10:00 at night. The rooms however are the highlight. They feature a great design and they do not disappoint. My room a king room had a great bathroom with a huge tub and separate shower. There was also a large wall armoire style unit with a morning kitchen with a refrigerator/minibar and a sink with a glass single burner/hotplate. While i did not use this much i imagine that if I had stayed with my wife or family I may have. One complaint though, Terribly slow valet. Here I am waiting for someone to take my car and I have a Lamborghini behind me honking his horn and revving his engine. He was probably ready to overheat. So uncool management!! Get things moving in this department please. Overall I would probably stay here again due to the location and lesser cost than Mandarin Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: M0nicaW
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel before check-in time but was able to check in early no problem. We walked around the hotel once we got settled to look at the pool and spa areas. We were pleasantly surprised that the spa was included in our room price. We got spa treatments and the people working at the spa were very nice and informative. The pool area was nice with plenty of seating for everyone. We ate lunch at the poolside cafe and the food was good but the price of the cocktails was very expensive. The bathroom in our room was see -through to the bed area so I would suggest you are very comfortable with the person you are traveling with. We just put our towels up to get some sort of privacy. The bed was supper soft and comfortable. BUT be sure to check the bedding before you go to bed we noticed once we woke up that the comforter had a stain that looked like dried blood. So gross!!!!! This almost ruined my experience. The bathroom also had a stain on the floor. Other than that the hotel looked exactly like the website.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !”
Reviews.Author: Racha2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Viceroy for 2 nights and I loved it ! I will go again. The rooms are beautiful and the hotel desig as well. The pools on the top terrace are beautilfu with a gourgeous vieuw. My only comment less positive would be that when you get a room on the main street, it's a bit noisy espacially on weekend. But for the rest, it's excellent ! It's about 15 minutes from South Beach and the price are much better at Viceroy.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: dovebvi
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent one night here on September 3rd one our way back from Portugal. It was one of my best hotel experiences to date. The front desk staff were friendly and very efficient. They gave us a complimentary upgrade to a one bedroom suite (even though we had already gotten a fantastic rate online). The room was a definite 'WOW'- two bathrooms, dining room table, living area, gigantic bathroom with soaking tub and the most comfortable four poster bed. I loved the style- Kelly Wearstler nailed the vintage Hollywood feel and the furniture in the room was all stuff I would love to take home! We ordered room service as we were exhausted from our flight- it came up fast and it was delicious. The menu was varied enough to have options for almost anyone. As for the location- I personally loved it. However, I went to University of Miami years ago and am very familiar with the city so for me it would have been a perfect jumping off point if we had a rental car. One of my favorite restaurants in the world, Michael's Genuine, is also a very short taxi ride away. I would choose to stay at this location a hundred times before I stayed on South Beach (which we did back in November). Checkout the next morning was again super fast and there was a taxi waiting outside to whisk us off to the airport. I only wish that all my hotel experiences were as satisfactory as the Viceroy- everyone we dealt with was professional yet friendly and the small touches (gorgeous bath products and unique furnishings) truly made the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Not a holiday destination”
Reviews.Author: ladykins1984
Reviews.Content: Room and hotel decor is modern and stylish. Pool area is ok, however this is shared with 3 other apartment buildings - this is not apparent until you use the area. Pool deck chairs not up to standard for hotel of this class - very uncomfortable and most have no cushions! Towels are old and resemble rags not luxury. Local area limited in activities. There a few restaurants / bars within walking distance and we ended up spending a lot of money on taxis to south beach (approx $25 one way). Would recommend for business travellers but not holiday goers.

Reviews.Title: “Great upscale hotel for economical price”
Reviews.Author: fskagdi
Reviews.Content: We nabbed this deal online at a fraction of the regular rate. As soon as you walk into the lobby you can tell that everything is very upscale and use only the finest furnishing, bedding, etc. The staff were all friendly... Nothing above and beyond regular, but were all pretty nice none-the-less. Only down side is location but then again we wanted a place that was more economical since we were there for only a day waiting for a cruise. Hotels near south beach are way more expensive, but you get the more lively location... All I heard outside the viceroy was crickets!

Reviews.Title: “Apology specialists...”
Reviews.Author: slsbrokers
Reviews.Content: this hotel has a very nice pool which may be the only reason to stay. the maid tossed my dirty clothes in with my clean clothes. there is no soap in the room. towels are hard to get. they didn't have foam/hypo allergenic pillows. i know things will go wrong for you but they with apologize profusely and consistently. if you don't mind less then seamless 4 star hotels stay and you won't mind stuff happening.

Reviews.Title: “exceptional hotel rooms and decor”
Reviews.Author: james5stars
Reviews.Content: Great but busy hotel. Rates vary significantly depending on time of booking, time of year. The pool is beautiful, with a cafe on deck. The gym and spa are exceptional, as they are part of the larger condominium complex too. The decor is very Asian influenced. A popular and busy/noisy nightclub is part of this hotel, so valet parking and access during peak club hours on the weekend can be difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent in Miami”
Reviews.Author: katherineiris
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very modern in style! Room key opens the elevator to your floor and the room is super clean and quiet. Peaceful and nice views. The spa is definitely a serene experience it is a must at this hotel. The residential part of the hotel will having you wanting to move in. Staff is helpful and your needs will be met in no time at this cool downtown hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: Newleywed09
Reviews.Content: Chic hotel in downtown Miami. There were tons of people checking in when we got there, but the hotel didn't seem overly crowded. Hotel decor is upscale, Asian inspired. The room was nice, big bathroom, large zen bed, flat screen tv,small patio facing the busy street. Not sure why there were burners in the kitchen, didn't seem to be a very safe idea. There are no ice machines, so you have to call the front desk for an ice delivery. Be sure to check your ice bucket- ours had not been cleaned in ages! The rooftop pool is very nice- we had lunch at the restaurant by the pool- healthy options and strong drinks is a plus. We went to club 50 one night- so convenient to be able to ride the elevator to your room after a hard night of partying. Had dinner in Brickell Village- the waiter was more memorable and entertaining than the food.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect setting for our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: bencarver27
Reviews.Content: The Viceroy in Miami is a fantastic hotel! From the moment we arrived to the time we left we had an unforgettable experience! We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite with a partial ocean view. We were so impressed with the room and all the amenities and walking around the hotel and pool area on the first night made us realise how spectacular the place really is! The staff throughout the hotel were always friendly, helpful and polite. The spa was amazing - jacuzzi, sauna, steam room, big chairs to relax on - all with a great view of the water! We ate at the cafe by the pool and really enjoyed the food. And the restaurant (Eos) was outstanding! I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody who is visiting Miami to stay at the hotel and I will certainly look to stay there again when I return to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Tony M
Reviews.Content: Will never come back, valet double charged me in one day, pillows have holes in it, balcony dirty, room was cleaned finally at 5pm, limited towels and were hanging not neatly. Bath products were incredible and furniture was nice. Poor customer service though. Was expecting much more from the viceroy

Reviews.Title: “LOVED It and Will be Back!”
Reviews.Author: lovetraveling8804
Reviews.Content: An amazing hotel and view right in the heart of Brickell! The room was large and the furniture and decor was different than regular chain hotels (Hilton, Marriot) which made this hotel so unique. The outside walls were all windows so two out of three walls in the bedroom and one out of two walls in the bathroom were windows. They were covered so you could see out and had plenty of light but no one could see in. I also had a view of the ocean in the distance. The pool was on the roof top and it was so amazing...just like the picture! The fitness center and spa was awesome too. The same type of views while you are working out. The staff gave great suggestions on places to eat and directions. I will definitely stay there again when I return to that area!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful place!”
Reviews.Author: edgley6127
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. Sophia checked us in and she was very polite and accomodating. She recommended a seafood restaurant walking distance from the Hotel. Oceanaire was delicious. The room is comfortable and unique. Bed is very comfortable. The pool is beautiful with plenty of space. The views are spectacular. Didn't care for: the restaurant Evos., The DJ sucked at Club 50 but the view is 5 stars. Bartender was nice. We asked for the best view she had because she couldn't upgrade us and she gave us a room on the street : ( Not cool. All in all, I would come back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind”
Reviews.Author: Croozcritic
Reviews.Content: A lovely Hotel in a grand complex. Had a grand stay. One would be hard pressed to find fault with this facility. I just hope the recent property sale doens't harm the experience at Viceroy Miami. A Maryland company acquired the Viceroy Hotel for $36.5 million this past May, buying the 148-unit property located at the ICON Brickell complex. Pebblebrook Hotel Trust bought the hotel citing strong potential for Miamiâ€™s tourism industry. The Viceroy is part of the third tower at ICON Brickell. The Hotel was 68 percent occupied in 2010, with an average daily rate of $183. As of June 1st the sale was pending, and is yet to officially close.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning pool, great service and rooms- a great Miami hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lordoftheonionrings
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5-day stay at Viceroy Miami, and was extremely pleased with my experience there. The hotel is located in the Brickell neighborhood of Miami, adjacent to downtown. South Beach is about a 15-minute drive away, but the hotel does front the water- the Miami River and Biscayne Bay- and our room had a wonderful water view. We stayed in a 1-bedroom suite that was HUGE, with a very cool and modern decor, and had 1.5 bathrooms (very large master with tub plus a powder room off the living room), a dining area (complete with dining table) and small kitchenette (microwave, mini ridge, electric stovetop). The room was very comfortable and well appointed, and also had a lovely balcony with the aforementioned water views. The service was excellent, and the hotel staff was friendly and attentive, exactly what I would expect from a higher end hotel such as the Viceroy. What set this hotel apart was the stunning pool complex- there is an Olympic-lenth pool adjacent to two smaller wading pools on the 15th floor of the hotel. The pools themselves seem to strech on forever, but there is also ample "deck" space with dozens of lounge chairs, covered and non-covered cabanas and other seating arrangements for lounging/sunbathing purposes. The view from the 15th floor pooldeck is also stunning, and I was really impressed that the hotel would give so much space and thought to the design of the pool complex. The spa is also impressive, although I did not use it. I was a bit hesitant about the Brickell location of the hotel, since it is not on the beach, but found that I didn't miss the beach at all. The fact that there are so many water views from the hotel itself, and the fact that South Beach is just a short drive away more than made up for it. Also, the Brickell neighborhood is trendy (a nice club, Bar 50, is located on the 50th floor of the hotel) and it was a fun place to stay, away from the typical throngs of beachgoers you have to deal with when staying on the beach. Overall, a great experience, and I'll definitely be staying there again the next time I am in Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible room decor and best swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: summer2me
Reviews.Content: If you like style, decor, modern, contemporary...this is the place for you!! I was blown away by the decor and quality of this very contemporary hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Excllent hotel hiddin within a cool high rise!”
Reviews.Author: mbvd
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this place. If you ever wanted to experience what it might be like to live in one of those beautiful Miami high-rises, this is the place to stay. The decor in this place is amazing- and while it may seem a little over the top - it all works very well together. Nice neighborhood feel hotel. Our room was very comfortable. The SPA is amazing - worth just checking out even if you don't get any SPA services. You really feel at home in this place. It is a short walk to BaySide and lots of attractions. We had a car and the valet was very efficient. Don't be turned off by the fact that there is a night club on the roof. Hotel guests have a special entrance if you happen to return to the hotel late at night in the midst of a club night. Overall excellent place. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, relaxing and private- highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: erika0086
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Viceroy for three nights and it was an amazing experience indeed- our room was impressive and extremely private- we could not hear our neighbours' doors closing, or any other voices in other rooms which is so common in most hotels. No detail was overlooked, from the beautiful and exquisite furnishings in our room to the divine bathroom and body products available, to the bed linen, the quality of the mini bar (there was even an Illy espresso machine, microwave and stove- which was very impressive!) I could go on and on about how amazing our experience was at this hotel. Our king size bed was majestic and we slept very well all three nights! The staff were extremely friendly, always smiling and always too pleased to assist us with anything. The spa was absolutely amazing and quite breathtaking- I cannot speak highly enough of the exceptionally enjoyable and relaxing experience we had here, I only wish I stayed long enough to book in a massage at the spa. The gym was also great- JC one of the trainers there was most pleasant and very helpful. The pool was also beautiful with incredible views of Biscayne Bay and the most relaxing sun beds and cabanas which we were not charged to use (some hotels do charge!). Highly recommend the strawberry and banana smoothies from Cafe Icon! I cannot rave enough about our experience at the Viceroy, we will definitely stay here again the next time we are in Miami!

Reviews.Title: “I'll will be backkkkkk”
Reviews.Author: drayan
Reviews.Content: Decided to do a staycation weekend for my 30th Bday at the Viceroy and what a great choice it was! The service was good, can't complain. I went to the Spa, what an amazzzing experience. I do have to say that the route in getting to the spa is a bit annoying. You first enter through the lobby of the hotel and then head to the 15th floor and then truck across the pool area to another bldg, then take the elevator up and walk down another hallway and then our there. A bit of a walk but worth it in the end. Went to the pool the next day and was there all day. The drinks are pricey but expected in that area, food was also not bad. The pool was great, it over looked the city not to mention being up on the 15th floor was nice. The room was also a plus, nothing to complain about except that it needed more lighting it was very dim in the bathroom & bedroom also adding some chairs outside on the balcony would be nice. Oh, and another thing I found was that the hallways in the hotel were very hot, walking to the room was annoying especially it already being hot outside. Overall great stay and would def go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Pinchykate
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel, beautiful decor especially in the rooms! The pool was amazing Only draw back in the location in brickell, but wasn't too bad - there are a few restaurants in walking distance and few good ones a short cab ride away. Also south beach is close. The hotel staff were very helpful!!

Reviews.Title: “Astonishing place to be!!”
Reviews.Author: moosesjackson
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I pulled up to gorgeous building, valeted fairly quickly. Walked into the most gorgeous and abstract lobby I have ever seen. The front desk attendants were very very nice. We were taken up to our one bedroom suite, and flabberghasted at the design, colors, softness of the furniture, the fur rug on the floor, the large bathroom with a deep tub and wonderful shower and the overall huge space. The bed was the most comfortable we've ever slept on. And I loved the chair with footrest in the bedroom, so comfortable! Two large armoires with 2 bathrobes for us, the espresso machine, the fridge, stove, WOW. Just loooooved everything. Then, we went to the pool! Talk about sexy. & the largest hot tub I've EVER seen! It is the epitome of what Miami represents. We would go back in a heartbeat. I have one small complaint, although it was big to me at the time: We pulled up to be valeted after a long night at an event, at about 4am (just wanting to fall down into bed and sleep) and we had to wait 20 minutes for a valet to even show up. Once they did, they were talking to people who were hanging out outside, rather than getting our car (the only ones waiting!) I went inside to inform the desk and they said "they must be busy getting other cars" and I said "no, they're socializing, now that they're back!" I was not at all happy, we had to pay 30 dollars for it each time, it is not as if the service is free. Overall, though, fabulous experience, look forward to getting back to Miami and this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyhcl
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I used to stay at the Shoreclub when visiting Miami but decided to check out the Viceroy. This hotel is beautiful and great location. The staff is friendly and nice. The price is a bit high but worth it. This is my new home when in Miami

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Krisdolphin2002
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic experience. Great customer service! Fabulous rooms! I have stayed here several times and always feel at home! If you are looking for a great hotel the Viceroy gives you value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: DaveBoi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 2 nights in June just before our cruise. The hotel is top notch and centrally located. Marble throughout our room/bathroom and a nice 4 poster king-sized bed. The view from the pool level is fantastic, looking out in two directions to the Miami harbor. Really enjoyed the fitness facilities and locker rooms which were spacious and well equipped. They loaned us a free laptop so we could use the internet. Great service. I highly recommend the place. We'd return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay while in Miami.”
Reviews.Author: juanp2
Reviews.Content: Service was great, the location is very close to all the best things to do in Miami. They upgraded us to a junior suite with a view of the bay and the city, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “SUPER DUPER HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: delPet
Reviews.Content: I loved every second of my stay in the viceroy, my biggest puller was the pool on the 15th and the club on the 50th. I was also really impressed by the rooms....boy are they sweet. Service excellent. am definitely coming back to viceroy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but pay for everything in your room.”
Reviews.Author: JockEngineer
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. Clean and well fitted out. Which for the price you would expect. There is a microwave and coffee maker in the room but you pay for any of the items in the room, including the coffee, that you use. Not too good considering the price you pay for the room. There was noise from the clientelle of the attached nightclub as they left in the wee small hours. It is well located for the Bayside Mall which has a good selection of restaurants for meals from breakfast to dinner, all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Not just professional...warm.”
Reviews.Author: anjaba
Reviews.Content: When I first entered the hotel in my gym pants that I had chosen for traveling comfort, I felt completely underdressed in the swanky facility, and thought they'd probably look down their noses at me. However, they were so kind. They took me to my gorgeous room, and then I headed to the spa, which I must say was BREATHTAKING. Sometimes a place will look great in pictures, but just so-so in person, but not so at the Viceroy Miami. It was BETTER than I expected! I took this trip for some girl time after breaking off an engagement, and I felt so low when I arrived, but the people in the spa were so comforting and genuine, and just kept building me up with the warm things they were saying to me. By the time I came out of my treatment I had my head held high! Every time you leave your room, they run in and do something nice. They clean your room in the morning, and then I noticed they come in in the evening to do a freshening up, empty the trash, etc. I mentioned this to my girlfriend and she said that they had folded all her clothes! Sophia and Colleen at the front desk were especially wonderful, sharing their tips for favorite places, and asking each day about our adventures. On our last evening they sent up a complimentary tray of gorgeous truffles and a bottle of champagne to celebrate. I have never in my life been to a better hotel, and I believe I will always have positive memories of Miami because of this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: WellTraveled61
Reviews.Content: Overall had a great experience, staff was helpful and very friendly. Pool was amazing, could of stayed longer. Room was unique, but very user friendly. We left wanting to pack up our things back home and move there.

Reviews.Title: “signed Hotel Snob, this place rocked !!!!”
Reviews.Author: baily1234
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a place, what a room I had You must have a balcony over looking the water. I had suite upgraded for Free. Spotless, beautiful, The bed so comfortable. The service was great !!! Dog Friendly with a great dog park attached. Great restaurants around there and at hotel. Great pool, Room service quick and nice. 5 stars A dream, signed hotel snob.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing on all levels!”
Reviews.Author: Jas0nS
Reviews.Content: Our stay was exceptional from the moment we checked in. After taking a red-eye flight we arrived at the hotel at 9am and amazingly our room was ready for us when we got there. Nothing is better then being able to lie down on a bed after a red-eye and the Viceroy made our dreams come true. The stay just kept getting better. Everyone we encountered from the front desk staff to the guest relations staff to the waiters and even the valet went above and beyond. By time we left we felt like we had made a whole new set of friends. This ultimately made the Viceroy stand apart from all others I've stayed at in the past. The front desk staff continually gave excellent recommendations on where to go around the hotel. The waitresses at the poolside cafe would greet us by name every day and couldn't have made us feel more welcome. On Saturday night, where the line for the rooftop club wraps around the building, the valet personally walked us past the line and introduced us to the doorman as hotel guests and made sure we got right in. The person that blew us away was an amazing woman named Christine who was the Guest Recognition Coordinator. She called our room just to check on us and when I inquired about possibly moving to a room that wasn't facing the street she said she would look into it and get back to me. I didn't think that there would be anything she could do since this is a hotel located in a very busy part of the city and I wasn't really expecting anything. To my surprise she said that she would be able to move us the next day. My jaw dropped when she opened the door to our new room and informed us that she had moved us to a river facing one bedroom suite. The trip would have been amazing even with our original room, but this was unbelievable. Christine even made sure that she came out to meet us when we checked out and just wanted to make sure that everything during our stay was up to their high standards. Everything about this hotel is perfect and the staff are really what makes it so special and wanting us to return the second we left.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Poppie20
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed at this hotel June 2nd through June 6th. Upon arriving at the hotel there was a discrepancy between us, and the deposit that was to be paid while we stayed at the hotel. I called ahead of time to find out how much the deposit would be and I was told that all they needed was a card on file and nothing would be charged. Upon arriving I was informed that the charge would be $150.00 a night for the deposit (totalling $600 for our stay). At the front desk I was working with Nicole ( who handled the situation great), and she spoke to the manager and we all came to an agreement about the deposit that satisfied both parties. So I have to give the manager and Nicole an A+ for the way that they handled the situation. They also were adamant about finding out who I spoke to when I called because they wanted to make sure this did not happen again but I was not sure because I had called a month prior to arriving. Outside of the hotel there are pillars that look like the stone heads of Easter Island. We stayed in a King Deluxe room which was amazing. The decor of this room is beautiful. The decor throughout the hotel was amazing also and I was taking pictures and videotaping the interior of the hotel as well as the room. We had a flat screen tv that was mounted on the wall. The marble bathroom has to be seen. Words just do not do it justice. Hot separate shower and tub. Double vanity sink. My partner kept saying she needs a bathroom like that at home. There was a balcony also. The bed itself was nice and if you like soft pillows these were like melting marshmellows. The infinity pool is on the 15th floor and the decor out there is nice as well. There are three pools, one we were not able to get in but the second one is heateed and I spent most of my time swimming in that one. One of the days there it was very windy on the roof and the heated pool was perfect. Also there is an amazing view from the roof top. We went up to the 50th level and they had a club in there with a small pool inside the building surrounded by lounge chairs and a bar. That was nice. The maids were all great and came on time and I have no complaints during the entire stay. Thanks Nicole and Viceroy for the great stay. All in all it was a great stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Anytthibg that u have in your room u get charged for”
Reviews.Author: koochgirl12308
Reviews.Content: My husband n I are staying here now we ae on out honeymoon...we had them take out our mini bar...well they left the food in the room and told us that we would not be charged for the bar bc we did not use it....so we ate the food...well we. Got back today and than we got charged 83 dollars for the stuff that they said we would not be charged for...this hotel is all bout taking your money

Reviews.Title: “Be careful with your credit cards in this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: oslay
Reviews.Content: I stayed on February 2011 at this hotel. It was nice and everything was fine until recently I discovered they made a fraudulent charge on my credit card on April2011. I never did a reservation for that date and now it's a real problem to get it back. Very elegant and cool, but my advice is to check your credit card after you book here. I have been in a lot of hotels and I have never had an experience like that. I will never stay here again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MNunez01
Reviews.Content: We just arrived from Miami a week ago and our stay at the Viceroy was amazing!!! From the moment we arrived the staff was warm and helpful, going above and beyond to welcome us to Miami. The suite was beautiful!!!-deep soaking tub, marble vanity with his and her sink. The kitchenette was also a nice touch. The hotel's fitness center and pool were ultra luxurious with spectacular views. On our arrival I briefly mentioned to the young lady at the front desk that we were celebrating my boyfriend graduating from Law School and that evening on our way back from dinner we had a bottle of champagne waiting for us in the suite compliments of the hotel. The hotel staff made our trip memorable by recommending amazing restaurants and attractions in the area. The Viceroy is definitely an luxurious hotel and their staff pay close attention to meet their guests needs. The only problem we encountered was finding parking. The hotel offers parking however it is pretty pricey; we parked across the street at a parking garage which was half the price the hotel was charging. I would definitely recommend the Viceroy Hotel to other travelers and we cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: hopkinsnurse
Reviews.Content: Pros-The accomodations were spacious, clean, and modern. We were able to recieve an upgrade to a King Sized Deluxe for just $20 and we loved the extra space. The pools were wonderful. I was pleasantly suprised that one of the pools was heated to hot tub temperature. The entire pool area is nice with plenty of cabana available for relaxation. Cons - The poolside bar closed at 5 pm. There was a bar in the restaurant that had happy hour but no "bar bites" as the menu in our room listed, When we asked about "bar bites", we got a funny look from the bartender and he handed us the lunch menu. We wound up paying $80 for the "happy hour" drinks and food which I consider to be pretty pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was decent”
Reviews.Author: Rush800
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the hotel was decent. We enjoyed the spa, pool area and other amenities on the 15th floor. The spa and the spa staff were outstanding! The locker room, shower area, Jacuzzi area and juice bar were exceptional! The fitness room was clean and offers an incredible view of the surrounding condominiums, hotels and water. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed each of these areas. Overall, the staff was warm, friendly and welcoming. My wife and I rented a junior suite and it was adequate, but a lot smaller than I expected. The sized of the expensive junior suite was the same size of a single room (non suite) in many of the other hotels that we have stayed at. The pictures on the hotel's website are very deceiving. Part of the building that the Viceroy is in consists of condominiums and it seems look the hotel part of the building may have been an afterthought. The lobby is tiny and it was particularly noticeable that the two featured, pink designer end chairs surrounding the coach were filthy and need to be replaced or cleaned. Also, although the hotel had a few modern artistic pieces shattered throughout the space, the decor seemed a bit outdated. For example, the carpet in the hotel room hallways was clean but had dark brown, diamond shapes with a yellowish-tan color in-between the diamond shapes. In my opinion, it looked really outdated. Additionally, there was thick, dark brown, old school wood lattice in the rooms, that was clean, but looked out of date and bulky. The club on the 50th floor also had outdated decor. Overall, we enjoyed the hotel, it was clean, we felt safe and the staff was nice. The only service problem that I experienced was an hour wait for a simple, but expensive continental breakfast consisting mostly of beard (no fruit for $39). Also, friends of ours that stayed in the hotel during the same time, experienced a repeating problem with the shower not working and they felt that the hotel should have offered another room, but did not. As I said in the beginning, we enjoyed the spa and spa areas and I would stay again only if the hotel offered a reduced price or some kind of package deal, that included a spa treatment. There are many other hotels in the surrounding with similar prices to chose from. I'm really doubted that we would chose the Viceroy again.

Reviews.Title: “groovy baby”
Reviews.Author: loungelizard2011
Reviews.Content: i am an architect and amodernist architect so the decor of this hotel was a little ott for me - but we had a superb stay, my wife and daughter loved it. lavish decor, beautiful details, toiletries etc and the little mini kitchen was perfect in our suite. the pool and spa were simply spectacular, i did not want to leave the spa. the only weirdish thing is the club. there is a club in the building where miami's beautiful people congregate and the entrance is right by the entrance to the hotel so if you come back in the evening there are throngs of party people lining up for the club which is mildly inconvenient but not a major issue. highly recommended for a stay in miami but you will definitely need a car as it is in a bank/business area

Reviews.Title: “as always luxury service and accomodation for exceptional value”
Reviews.Author: thibaut a
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at the Viceroy Miami, my third stay in less than a year, I am getting used to this wonderful property. I am very familiar with the property, as you can imagine, but for once I was able to discover and enjoy the pool service (my schedule is always too busy for that). What a treat to be able to stay in the pool under the sun overlooking brickell, love it.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: bzeltravel_11
Reviews.Content: front desk staff is excellent. accomodations were immaculate. beds were extremely comfortable. location is perfect for everything you want to do in miami. spa, fitness center, and pool area are exceptional. valet parking attentive and quick. the views from our upgraded accomodations were spectacular. we visit miami frequently and this is our #1 choice for great service and it is also a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & service”
Reviews.Author: WindsorP
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Viceroy Miami,and really enjoyed our time there.We had a junior suite which had excellent features and a great bathroom.The hotel staff were both helpful and polite at all times,and when we reported a problem with our TV,it was fixed very promptly,and a note left to explain what the problem was and apologising for the inconvenience.The Infinity pool on the 15th.floor is simply stunning,and Cafe Icon is a very relaxing spot.All in all we had a great stay at Viceroy and will certainly return on our next trip to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, Urban, Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BLS_65
Reviews.Content: This is an URBAN Design Hotel located in Miamiâ€™s Financial District and Elite Brickel Condominiums. Although, none of these Hotel Rooms face the magnificent Pool deck located on the 15th floor; it makes up with other ways â€“ â€œJunior Suitesâ€�. The hotel is located below the 15th floor and its well worth the few dollars extra to splurge for these spectacular Junior Suites #1211. These Junior Suites with balconies and kitchenette are located on the corner of the building offering you panoramic views of the Water & Brickel Avenue with their floor to ceiling windows; including the fabulous oversized washroom. The only area that is completely private is the water closet. The Suites are exquisitely furnished with unique pieces but when will the Hotel purchase some balcony furniture? There are (2) Restaurants & (1) bar located on the premises. The Icon is accessible from the pool deck and offers you a variety of gourmet salads, cold & hot pressed sandwiches. Although the food was acceptable at the EOS Restaurant; we were not impressed with the service. We had spent (4) nights at this Hotel but didnâ€™t realize until the third day that this complex includes an 18% gratuity charge . . . it would have been appreciated if the staff would have mention that policy â€“ verify your bills. This Hotel is NOT located on South Beach, but its fabulous massive Pool deck & 28,000 square foot Spa will offer you a different experience of Miami. Enjoy an illy espresso without leaving your room! Viceroy Hotel, 485 Brickell Avenue, Miami; www.viceroymiami.com.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat the amibience, the staff, facilities and comfort”
Reviews.Author: discretetraveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there for three nights over a two week period (two visits). It is an amazing value and beautifully esthetic an pleasing. The staff are fantasitc, the gym has everything you need and the rooms spacious and artful. Definetly a must hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay”
Reviews.Author: londonblf
Reviews.Content: This is an outstanding hotel property which is one component of a very impressive residential development on the waterfront in Miami. It caters to a mix of international and domestic travelers and has some very impressive amenities. The pool area (fantastic views) and gym are amazing and far better than even high end resort settings. It would be impossible to feel crowded in the pool it is so large. Even though you are downtown, the hotel still offers a resort experience from the pool area, the gym, and the high quality restaurants in walking distance. Personally, I think staying at the Viceroy offers a better all around Miami holiday than on South Beach or at a more standard resort experience (for example, Ritz Carlton Key Bisacayne). You do need to drive to the beach but is is not far either in Key Biscayne or Miami Beach. Most of all, the staff were wonderful the entire time of our stay including in-house reservations. This is a similar experience to what we incurred at the Tides (the sister property) last year. I would definitely return consistently to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel laking some amenities”
Reviews.Author: fberkeley
Reviews.Content: The guest rooms are one of the highlights of this hotel with striking decor, an extra-spacious bathroom and a well-stocked kitchenette, Still, there are some things missing that are normally found in hotels at this price point: bathrobes, a bathroom scale and a daily newspaper. Another highlight is the very large pool which evidently also serves the adjoining condo tower. I did feel ripped off at the $6.41 charge for a small coffee-to-go from the Eos restaurant and by the $30/day valet parking charge (plus tip!).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: lizbuenosaires
Reviews.Content: Beautifull hotel, perfect location, premium category. Steps from Mary Brickell, full of restauranst. I would come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!”
Reviews.Author: Rich1876
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel - only wished we'd booked more than 1 night! Got a fantastic deal on the internet for Junior Suite - wasn't ready when we arrive so received upgrade to One Bedroomed Suite. Amazing! Very high quality furnishings, great balcony - really couldn't have asked for more. Huge roof pool, excellent service from reception and fantastic food and service in EOS. Room service breakfast was perfect as well. Never wrote a review before but this hotel deserves it - fantastic experience from start to finish. If only we could have delayed our flight home by a few days! Location is just a short drive from Art Deco & South Beach - and I'm pretty sure the value for money is much, much better! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, rooms will show their age in a few years”
Reviews.Author: Globetrekker63
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very good service. Rooms a bit strangely designed, but generally nice- quality of the furniture will show its age in a few years. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Service is terrible”
Reviews.Author: ThisisKellyNims
Reviews.Content: Best advice for staying in this area: choose the Mandarin. The service at the Viceroy is very bad. We arrived at 430 and our room was not ready, yet a week later when I asked for an additional hour to check out, I was denied. You order food and they NEVER bring salt or pepper, even when you ask. Further they brought me used condiments and when I requested new ones, they never came. Finally, if you don't speak Spanish, this isn't the place for you. If you are American and want to feel like a foreigner in the United States this is the place for you. Spanish language is assumed. I called my car up to get something out of the car and asked the valet to leave the car for 15minutes while I went back upstairs and he did not speak English so when I came back the car was parked again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you are paying for, Not a family friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElTony_11
Reviews.Content: This is not the palce you want to go for the money they charge. First of all they did not ask if we need help with the suitecases. shower partially dislodge. Rooms are not sound proof so in the fifth floor you hear cars passing by the busy Brickel avenue, people partying after leaving after hours the nightclub in the hotel building, motorcycles and horns. The pool area is very restrictive, specially when there are children around, Security guards are aggresive and not polite at all. One by the name "Ronaldi" seem particularly upset with tourist laughing out loud or children playing kindly. Very expensive but not comparable with the Ritz, The Four Seasons, The Mandarin Oriental or The Epic, just blocks away. If you stil think is good...give it a trial..The valet parking $30 a night.

Reviews.Title: “New Years in MIA @ Viceroy...A++”
Reviews.Author: MissNene25
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Viceroy a truly lovely experience in Miami. Just as you see on TV lol. We are from the UK. People watching galore, everyone was so gorgeous! The rates are high but you wont be sorry. Great Restaurant on site!

Reviews.Title: “Love. Love. Love this hotel and spa!”
Reviews.Author: Simihussain
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Viceroy a total of 3 times and everytime I have absolutely loved this hotel and spa. Excellent service throughout!

Reviews.Title: “Viceroy hotel Miami”
Reviews.Author: arlenecita
Reviews.Content: a tweet from travel recommended the Viceroy Hotel, in Brickell Ave. Miami as a top world hotel, so I tried it! Never in my 50 years of traveling have I encountered such a disaster! We arrived at 2am and were shown into an empty condo unit, which had nothing but 3 beds in it and no TV or phones in the rooms. We refused to accept that and were switched to another one where the phone, TV, internet did not work. Next day my daughter's bed collapsed, bathroom stopped up, bed had no bottom sheet and pillows had no pillowcases. No room service menu, phone had no international calling possibilities, and no direct link to hotel, and never received incoming calls. Some shopping we left with valet took 2 hours to arrive in room. To top it all today they lost our car in valet parking and finally found it after 2 hours and then could not find the car keys for another 2 hours so day was lost cause. The only positive note is the personnel was very nice. For instance when we could not let our family know we had arrived as no phones worked at 2AM, a maintenance man named Boris lent us his personal cell phone to make an international call and refused a tip.The hotel had to rent another car for us and promised to pay for & return it, we will see if that pans out. This was Kindly promised by Jose Rico Arango, Brianna Osterburge & Patrick Dunkley.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: snshnst
Reviews.Content: This place is simply amazing. We truly enjoyed every thing about this hotel and will return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Very Good Service But Location Not Ideal for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: Brett_and_Sonie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Viceroy Hotel Miami for three nights during our honeymoon in January 2011. Like others, we also liked the dÃ©cor and the marble finish in the rooms. The staff at the front desk were attentive and helpful, when something went wrong (the latch on the door when we arrived) it was fixed straight away and the hotel kindly gave us a complementary bottle of honeymoon champagne and chocolate covered strawberries on arrival. They were very helpful giving directions on places to go and in renting a car. We also had the $15 breakfast on the last morning which was very filling with a good selection As a tourist, the main problem with the Viceroy was the location - Downtown is just in the middle of nowhere. Good for the Cuban sector or perhaps if you have business nearby, but thatâ€™s about it. Nowhere near South Beach. On our way back through Miami 10 days later we stayed in Coconut Grove, which had a nice, neighbourly feel. If we ever return to Miami we will stay either in Coconut Grove or closer to South Beach. We also concur with the Bar 50 comments of an earlier traveller - $17 for a so-so cocktail in a plastic glass is a bit over the top (bad), and it was a bit of a hassle to get inside in the first place (free entry if you are staying there but we went to the front of the queue then they said â€œNo armband so you canâ€™t get inâ€� (bad) so we walked away, but the porter saw what happened, apologised and put us back at the front of the line (good) but when we got upstairs all of the lounge spots were reserved (bad), but we were allowed to sit in them for a drink â€œuntil the others comeâ€� (good but awkward) which was nice but made you feel like an intruder. It all felt a bit cliquey. Also, when we returned the rental car at the end of the day, there was no place nearby to park it so we had to valet park it under the hotel at the full valet parking rate. Cheap car rental which was good but a discount on the parking seeing as we got it through the hotel would have been nice. All up it was a nice place in a nowhere location with good service, but you just got the sense that things were a little mixed up â€“ like that it was a cross between high class apartments, a nightclub and a hotel and was unsure which was most important. But our overall travel experience there was positive, and the service was very good, so we would be happy to recommend this to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive rooms with all needed amenities”
Reviews.Author: Lindino_Benedet
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best one I have stayed in south Florida to date. The renovated double queen bed rooms are bsolutely amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing more than an upgraded Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: GardeniaPalm
Reviews.Content: I was expecting great things out of Viceroy. Between their website, and Trip Advisor reviews, the bar was set pretty high. I arrived early, around 11:00 AM which I knew was not check in time. My room was not ready which was obviously fine, so they took my bags and said they would call me when the room was ready. I took a walk around Brickell Key and then Brickell. About two hours later the room was ready. The location of Viceroy is really great. I was there without a car and it is in a very walkable area, as well as an area with easy access to both Metromover (an elevated shuttle system) and Metrorail (a heavy rail system giving you access to South MIami, UM, Coral Gables, Dadeland, Coconut Grove and more) Upon getting my room keys and going up, I have to say I was very impressed with the decor. The halls (very warm, I'm not sure the A/C was on) were very chic and the room was as well. I had asked for a high floor room and was placed two floors above the lobby (i.e.- not a high floor) The room was pretty when I entered; however, the defects were very obvious (note photos.) There was a large crack in the ceiling, there were crumbs on the bench in front of the bed and it was missing several buttons as well. There were markings from construction both behind the bed and in the shower... it looked like graffiti almost. The carpet was stained in two places and one of the chairs had black staining on it as well. One of the recessed lights was falling out of the ceiling and it (the bulb) would go on and off on its own. The shower head was very flimsy and felt like it was going to break when I had to adjust the head. The glass covers are reused which I don't find to be very sanitary. Some people drink out of a cup then put the cover back on. One in the bathroom was dirty with all sorts of marks on it. It looked to be used a lot, but I thought maybe it was just at the bottom of a stack and something happened to it. I decided I would place a small mark on the inside of the two I had taken off the glass I used... the next day when housekeeping had left and replaced the glass I looked and sure enough they were the same covers. The room is very open with the bathroom. They should really put a curtain people can close between the bedroom and bathroom. Just because two people might share a bed does not mean they would want to see each other in the shower. Personally I come to South Florida during the winter to in part, enjoy the weather. I found it strange there was no balcony furniture at all. I do like leaving the balcony door open while I'm in the room to get fresh air, unfortunately this was ruined by a smoker in another room. The scent would waft down in my room and by the time I got a whiff of it, it had already got in the room and I had to deal with that until it dissipated. The pool was closed early afternoon one night of my stay until 12:30 PM the next day. There came a note from the manager... at about 8 PM or so that night. A little late, in my opinion. The pool is closed from sundown until sunrise, which was very ambiguous. A set time depending on the season would work better. To be honest, I'm not sure why the pool closes at all. There were private functions going on all over the place which was fine, but since many occurred in public areas of the hotel it felt awkward going by them when they were going on. The spa pools were nice but the marble floors get very slippery. Thank goodness they stay open until 9 and 10 PM at night since the pool closes early. Cafe Icon I only stopped in to get coffee. It seemed only one girl was really working, the other two were just sort of standing around. I'm not sure of her name, but the hard worker was the one with glasses. Staff didn't remember my name. Lower level staff members (housekeeping, valet workers, etc.) seemed to be more friendly than "the suits." The suits would walk by, ask how you were and then not even stick around for the answer. I don't expect a long conversation, but at least stop, look me in the face, smile and pretend you actually care. I wasn't asked how my stay was going until check out. I came up to the W Fort Lauderdale and the difference has been like night and day. Staff at the W are always smiling, asking how your stay is going, asking if they can get you anything, etc. I will review them later. Overall, Viceroy aspires to be a 5 star hotel, but it's just hitting the 3.75 mark (I wouldn't say it's only 3.5, but it's not 4, so I met in the middle) Will I stay again? It depends on the rate. I didn't pay top dollar, but I certainly didn't get a great deal, either. It's not a bad place, it's not a great place, it's simply a mediocre place; a Hampton Inn with upgrade decor, and no free breakfast or parking. One highlight of the trip was an employee by the name Jose at the front desk. I originally encountered him when he brought my bags up to the room. I made a note that he was very friendly then. As the stay progressed he was the one person that did say hi and would look you in the face. Upon departure I had some rental car problems and he was right there to assist with looking up other location numbers and trying to get them on the phone. I'm not sure Jose's position at Viceroy, but he certainly should be in a senior position.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool and location, expensive drinks, poor service”
Reviews.Author: TracyRegnery
Reviews.Content: Overall it was a nice stay. The viceroy is a very nice hotel on the water, walking distance to trails along the water and great places to eat, and the rooms were nice with lots of storage space. We ate lunch by the pool and it took a very long time to get a wrap and two beers which totaled $50. The pool is breathtaking but the sun alternates covering the majority of the pool/ lounge chairs durning the day. We felt like we were chasing the sun and moved our chairs at least 5 times to be in the sun. Breakfast room service was very good. Most of the staff is helpful when asked questions just the service is slow. We went to the food network food and wine festival and in hindsight wished we had stayed in south beach.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel, with amazing views.”
Reviews.Author: Kelwood
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Viceroy for 1 night and now know how the other half live! Our room had the most amazing views and the most comfortable bed. The bathroom was spotless and allowed you to take in the views whilst soaking in a deep tub. The minibar had a great selection of late night snacks and drinks. The roof top pool at this hotel has to be seen to be believed. Breakfast a the rooftop cafe was lovely and the service was great. Although the Viceroy is very pricey, if you are looking to splurge for a night of decadence, then look no further.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea123_10
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time. This is a hotel that completely overexceeded our expectations on service. We were often greeted by name and were greeted by everyone in the hotel from maintanence personal to front desk. The staff seemed genuinely happy. The pool is stunning. I was disappointed not to have a beach/ocean swim spot, but the pool made up for it. The gym is great - you can run overlooking the beautiful bay and ocean. I would definitely go back. Rooms were very quiet as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wow. We have stayed at some nice hotels but this was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: 4langes
Reviews.Content: Everything was great. We have two boys: 7 and 9, and they loved this place. This is a perfect location and easy to walk to great food. There is an enormous pool on the roof which is uniquely great for doing laps. Also had a good gym for the treadmilling wife. Big windows in the room for nice views. Oh, and very nice staff and great service. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Spa is amazing...but has some room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: NMtraveler_8
Reviews.Content: This review is specifically for the Viceroy Spa. As a local who lives in Miami, I signed up for a Signature Treatment at the Spa and was excited to check out the other facilities and use the Spa for the day. As others have mentioned, the Spa is beautiful. Just walking into the lobby inspires feelings of awe. I arrived early for my appointment and was able to take advantage of one of the fitness classes. The class was very enjoyable and the instructor was great. After a quick shower in the beautiful locker room, I was all set for my treatment. The treatment was great and very relaxing, except for a few issues (see below). After the treatment, I was able to use the outdoor pool, indoor jacuzzis and sauna. I ended up spending most of the day at the spa and really enjoyed the experience. A couple of areas for improvement: - I checked in for my treatment/massage 10 minutes early and was told to wait for my masseuse. I waited in the designated area...and waited...and waited. She didn't arrive until 25 minutes later (which was now 15 minutes after my scheduled appointment). She showed me to the treatment room and started what was supposed to be a 90 minute treatment. There were no visible clocks in the treatment room, so it wasn't until I got back to the locker room that I realized she had only done 75 minutes. This was frustrating for me, as clearly I had checked in early and she was 15 minutes late. By the time I realized that I had been jipped out of 15 minutes of my treatment, it was kindof too late to say anything, so I just dropped it. But if I'm paying essentially $2 per minute for a high-end spa treatment, I expect to receive the treatment for the alloted time period and it shouldn't be my responsibility to chase down the therapist if she ends the treatment early. - The other facilities at the spa are very nice, but out of the steam room, sauna and 3 indoor jacuzzis - the steam room and one of the jacuzzis were out of order. I'm not sure how long they had been broken, but it looked like they hadn't worked for a while (as there were permanent signs on them saying they were broken). Again, for a high end spa to have 2 out of 5 features broken is really unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “The pool takes the cake”
Reviews.Author: ameyls
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Viceroy for a long weekend with my husband and our three year old son. We got a corporate rate that made the one bedroom suite ultra-affordable. We were initially worried about bringing a three year old to such a "hip" hotel, but it ended up being a great place for the three of us. Room: We had a one-bedroom suite, which offered plenty of space for the three of us. The furniture was interesting, and we loved the little kitchenette. There were some odd things, though. As another reviewer said, there is just too much furniture in the room. They could take out at least 25% of it and still have a stylish, albeit more spacious, room. Strangely, though, there was absolutely no furniture on the expansive balcony! The room is also divided in a bizarre way that makes for two very long, narrow rooms, instead of a more open layout. That said, we still enjoyed it and found it to be good for our needs. Pool: Wow! We were initially bummed not to be on the beach, but even if the beach had been nearby, I think I still would have spent all of my time at the pool. We were there in January, and the middle pool was heated to about 85 degrees! I just melted right into it. And service by the pool is spectacular--complimentary citrus water, plenty of towels, and cafe service for other needs. My son didn't care that there weren't any fancy slides or "kid" things at the pool--he was happy to splash around in the warm water and luscious sunshine. Service: We found the service to be delightful, though not without its ups and downs. On our second day there, the valet service lost our rental car! We had planned to spend the morning on south beach. Instead, we spent over an hour trying to straighten out the situation with the valet. When they still hadn't been able to locate our car, the hotel manager put us into a cab and sent us to the beach on the hotel's dime. I was still very stressed out, though, and found it hard to enjoy the beach until we finally got a call from the hotel saying they had found our car. When we got back to the hotel that afternoon, the manager treated us to a very nice lunch at the hotel's restaurant, and he also comped two days worth of valet parking for us. When we got back to our room that evening, he had also sent up a fruit plate and bottled water, along with a personal note again expressing how sorry he was. I felt they more than made up for our difficult experience. Location: So, it's not on the beach, but downtown has it's charms, and there are some great restaurants nearby. We especially enjoyed Fratelli Milano and Cafe Bastille--yum! All in all, we had a great trip an would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Food service is also an integral part of service”
Reviews.Author: domtouche
Reviews.Content: Viceroy Miami is a pleasurable hotel that offers spacious rooms and the longest Infinity pool in the US if I understand correctly. The hotel premises are great and the rooms offer all kinds of amenities. I am not sure however if this hotel is for business or leisure travellers. When travelling on business, you often have to work before, during or after the meeting. And one would like to sit by the - longest in the world Infinity- pool, connect to the internet and grab a bite....it might be frustrating to be then forced to eat in your room after 5pm as it happened to me. especially when all you get is very average hotel food that is not up to the standard the hotel wants to reach. To their credit, I was contacted very quickly after I sent my -requested- feedback via mail....

Reviews.Title: “Did I stay at a different Viceroy?”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravelLACA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night at the Viceroy hotel the week after Christmas and after reading all the reviews, we were definitely not expecting what we found. The entrance lobby was small, unimpressive and chaotic. A couple of persons who may have been bell hops standing around, but they in no way tried to greet or help us. The front desk workers were friendly, but no one helped us to our room or even showed us which bank of elevators to select, and given the confusing, counter intuitive lobby, we ended up at the wrong set of elevators for a different tower (no signage at all). The room was perfectly adequate, but again, nothing to write home about. Terrible views, over the street, noisy. In short, a good 3 or 4 star hotel, but absolutely nothing to write home about and just can't compare to the top ranked hotels in a major city like Miami. Not sure why this hotel is ranked so highly on trip adviser, all I can figure is that we stayed at the wrong Viceroy for $300 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional experience”
Reviews.Author: Scorpio77GrandCayman
Reviews.Content: My wife, my 2 year old daughter and I stayed at the Viceroy Miami basically for the whole month of November. As a resident of one of the Caribbean islands, we chose to come to Miami in order to give birth to our second child in the US hospital system. We arrived at 37 weeks of gestation and enjoyed the Viceroy until my son arrived 4 weeks later. Firstly the room was amazing! Easily the best hotel room I have ever stayed in. I believe it was a junior suite on the 42nd floor with magnificent views of Biscayne Bay. Everything was spacious, clean and very well decorated and finished. I will not gush too much about the room itself as almost every other review has already done so, but please don't mistake brevity for dlack of satisfaction in any way. The room was fantastic. The amenities seemed second to none for me. Once again, the other reviews make it clear that the pool area is staggering. The gym was one of the better hotel gyms I have seen and the spa area an excellent touch. I think if anyone has any complaints about these then they are really hard to please. As for location, it was extremely easy to get on and off the I-95 and there was no tricky downtown driving to be done. We hadn't been to this area of Miami before and Brickell Village was a nice surprise to us. It is also a 10 minute walk (if that) to the Bayside park and shopping centre. We rarely felt at a loose end for things to do with our 2 year old either at the hotel, within walking distance or within a short drive. Most importantly however, the service was literally the best we have experienced in the United States. Professional and always friendly. The front desk staff went out of their way to help me fax and email certain business documents and for that I think them. Having been there for a month we felt like we had struck up friendships of sorts with various of the valets (who were always reliable for a friendly greeting and farewell), housekeepers and concierges. Most were so excited for us when our new son finally arrived - when my wife came out of hospital, we almost felt like we were bringing hih "home" to family. The Viceroy helped make the whole experience one that we will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “viceroy miami is one of the most beautiful hotels i've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: pineapplegolf
Reviews.Content: -the hotel was gorgeous. i love kelly wearstler!! loved the interior design of the rooms, loved the colors, loved the bedding, loved the spacious bathrooms, loved that the rooms had miniature kitchens and dishes. loved the bathrobe hanging in the closet, loved the bath products (and i think it's a great environmental decision to just provide large jars of product - instead of wastefull little jars. good work). -would have liked there to be a GREEN option of not having your sheets/ towels changed every single day. -loved having HBO -wished there was a DVR option -think that $13 for a movie rental is way too much -fitness center was nice with beautiful views of brickell bay. loved the fresh water and "healty option" vending machine. loved the towels provided. loved the sauna and steam room. however, i have a few complaints: 1. none of the guests wiped down machines after they sweated all over them. 2. tvs on many machines only displaed 3-4 channels. 3. no tv on stair climber or place to put a magazine or ipod 4. would have loved a yoga or pilates class offered in the morning - before 8am. many of us have to be at work by 9 - which means i would need the class to end by 8:15 at the latest. 5. would have loved magazine options to read while working out 6. would have liked to borrow a yoga mat to do yoga in my room -room service was really friendly. however, the food was mediocre. the vegetables were not in season and soggy with too much butter and oil. the chips (served with guacamole) were not authentic and too oily. i often ordred off the menu (grilled fish with steamed vegetables). 1. would have loved for breakfast options to be provided at dinner 2. salads should come with fresh bread and butter 3. dessert options should include a healthy alternative 4. small mixed greed salad offered with entre 5. free range fish and chicken options 6. fresh, local, and seasonal focussed food. 7. would have loved complimentary coffee/ tea.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel but takes some getting used to.”
Reviews.Author: DaSaint
Reviews.Content: The viceroy is an excellent hotel. Their service is probably exceptional and I really had to commend their cleaners who cleaned the rooms and arranged stuff as if it was their own house. The bathrooms were great and their was a lot of space. However, I found the beds a bit too firm and the restaurant was hyper expensive with a menu that was not kid friendly. The hotel takes a bit of getting used to before you finally get your bearings due to it's boutique setting. The gym was great as was the pool but I'm not a city center fan. Room service was prompt and good quality. Overall, excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and sophisticated downtown Miami hotel”
Reviews.Author: katherineclifton007
Reviews.Content: The Viceroy is a true downtown Miami gem, perfect for the discerning business or leisure traveler who is looking for a discrete, sophisticated and absolutely elegant environment. From top to bottom, it is serene and quiet, the rooms are beautifully decorated in a muted Asian theme, with tones of light green, cream, tans and black; and the lovely marble bathrooms are spacious with great Neil George amenities. The rooms have a small kitchen area with fridge and espresso machine. Excellent and fast & free wifi, and large flat screen TVs with numerous HD channels. All rooms have balconies that overlook Brickell Ave., the Miami River and/or Biscayne Bay. The pool deck is stunning. It is on the 15th floor overlooking Biscayne Bay. You will never feel crowded; there is tons of space. The pool itself is longer than Olympic length and heated in the winter, so it is perfect for laps...and most of the time you will have it all to yourself. The gym is the best Iâ€™ve experienced in Miami, and is large, modern, airy and very attractive, and the floor to ceiling windows overlook Biscayne Bay. The spa, which is included in the room rate, has co-ed hot tubs & plunge pools and gender-specific steam rooms and saunas. Again, everything about the Viceroy is elegantâ€¦your will not feel like you are â€œamong the touristsâ€� as one does on South Beach or even Coconut Grove. You will feel like youâ€™ve just joined an elite private club; an urban sanctuary. The staff is gracious, accommodating and excellent. The only drawbacks are ones that are pretty common in Miami -- the only parking option is valet parking; you cannot self-park. Since the Viceroy is not part of a mega-chain (such as Hilton or Marriot) there is currently no "rewards program", so you won't be building your points here. But my opinion is that I'd rather have a unique and lovely experience than accumulate a tons of points that can only be used at cookie-cutter chains. I am a frequent business traveler to Miami, and I can say, after staying in most of the upscale downtown hotels, this is one of the very best. At the Viceroy, Iâ€™ve stayed in the regular King rooms, the Deluxe Rooms and the Junior Suites. All are excellent, but if you can afford it, go for the Deluxe Room or Junior Suite. Having travelled extensively in the US and abroad I can honestly say that this is one of the best hotels in the worldâ€¦.and the rates wonâ€™t absolutely destroy your wallet, either. Try it, you wonâ€™t be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Powa
Reviews.Content: We planned a one week trip to Miami in November and made a reservation for 7 nights in the Grand Beach hotel. A few weeks before our trip I read an article a Dutch business magazine about the 10 most beautiful hotel swimming pools in the world. Thats where I discovered the Viceroy Miami. I discussed it with my partner and we changed our reservation into 4 nights Grand Beach and 3 nights Viceroy. We had the special: Stay 3 nights and get a free upgrade to a suite and complimentary breakfast. The check in was very quick. When we entered the suite we were speechless!! I remember the guy who helped us with the bags asked me what my first impression of the room was and I couldn't give him an answer... The right answer is: Amazing! The suite is very spacious with a long hall, 1/2 bathroom, mini kitchenette, living / dining room, large balcony and a large bedroom with a master bath. I think the most impressive part of the suite is the bathroom with a large tub, shower and a separate toilet. Of course there are two 42 inch flatscreen tv's and since there in different rooms we could watch different tv programs without disturbing each other. The breakfast was great with a ditto service. There is no better start of the day then having breakfast on the 15th floor in the morning sun. The pool area is impressive! The large infinity pool gives you the idea that you are really on top of the world. Unfortunately we didn't have the chance to take a dip due to our busy (shopping) schedule. The location is great when your on a business or shopping trip, it is a good 10 minutes walk to the Bayside marketplace and the downtown shops. We had a great time at the Viceroy but there was one minor disappointment. On our last evening we wanted to have a drink in Club 50 but they had a private event, so we didn't have a chance to take a look on the 50th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of little issues takes away from the beauty”
Reviews.Author: InformedNYTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in a junior suite facing the canal. The room was beautiful and the stay could have been wonderful, if the following issues are resolved: (1) The room was beautiful but overcrowded with furniture. This was evident when I bumped into a chair positioned next to the "workstation area." The chair and bed stand combined to create a narrow strait that one has to navigate going from the living area to the bathroom and hallway kitchen/closet area. Get rid of half of the furniture and free up the room. (2) Bathroom lacks privacy curtain. Tinted windows and thin see-through bamboo curtains in the bathroom is not enough to prevent being viewed from the outside, especially at night when one can clearly see into the room from street level. The living area has ceiling to floor privacy curtain all around but the bathroom does not. This was a major problem for me during my stay, causing me to turn the hot water full until the entire bathroom window fogged up before bathing. (3) Large 'community' sized liquid soap squirt bottles. The shower body soap and shampoo were evidently used. For the price of the room, does one really have to call and ask for new bottles? At least they replaced the used bottles promptly. (4) No electric plug by bed. Individual LED reading lights by the bed is nice but there is no electric socket by the bed to plug in a laptop. (5) Two lamps by the work area are inconvenient to use. They have dimming switches located at the rear of each lamp that are not easy to reach. (6) Lumpy bed. The king sized bed was very lumpy. Combined that with a down blanket (why?), made for a difficult night of sleep the first night. (The trick was to sleep on top of the down, which helped to reduce the lumps.) (7) Coffee machine requires taking a short lesson. What? The coffee machine is not intuitive. Apparently, I am not the first (or the only) one perplexed by the machine since they have a lesson on TV (welcome channel) and a instruction card. Given the level of complexity, the coffee isn't all that good. On the positive: the pool is beautiful and the restaurant is pricey but very good (18% tip is built in the the bill, which appears to be standard for higher priced restaurants in Miami). These minor issues should not exist for such a luxury hotel. Therefore, I will pass on this hotel the next time I visit Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful decor”
Reviews.Author: slcsav
Reviews.Content: The service at the hotel was prompt, with a smile. They greeted you by name and made every attempt to make your stay as pleasant as possible. They ask at the end what could they improve upon... the room service was also prompt and friendly. The room, we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite and it was large and spacious. Great for a couple, especially if one would like to sleep and one wants to get up and read and watch TV. There was one master bathroom and one half bath which both were beautiful. The shower and bathtub in the master was so relaxing ..made you really feel pampered and on a vacation. The location of our room (1201) was overlooking the river that leads into the Biscayne Bay...looking right at the Epic hotel across the way.. it was a nice view and fun to watch the ships go by. The restaurant in the hotel was nice enough..nothing great. I recommend going over to the Epic hotel - Area 31 restaurant was amazing. It is a short walk over the bridge. The food there was wonderful, light and tasty. The drinks too were amazing. Overall I loved the Viceroy. The best parts were the amenities - room size, decor, the bed was wonderful, sheets were delightful. At night the room was quite and I slept like a baby. The food and drinks could be improved. Club 50.. was interesting and a bit strange- but maybe I am just a bit to old to understand clubs.

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: BruceClark007
Reviews.Content: This is a first class hotel for business or pleasure. A employee of the front desk will check you in and then walk you to your elevator. The room fantastic. woderrful restaurants and a beautiful bar. Room service is perfect and the staff will treat you so well making sure you are pleased in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Urban Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Harrydog44
