Reviews.Content: Our room, a one-bedroom suite, was spacious and well-appointed. The service is excellent and affable without being fresh or painfully hip. The restaurant is very good, but not worth a special trip unless you are staying in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: dhut3
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for our 5 year anniversary. It was perfect! This is a great location for any out of town guest. You can walk or take the Miami People Mover to Downtown, Mary Brickell Village, Brickell Key, and SOBE is only a 10min drive. The rooms here are amazing, and the staff is great. The food is good, but if you donâ€™t want to eat at Hotel you have many options that are an easy 5-10min walk or $3-4 dollar cab ride away. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone. If anyone complains about this place they must complain about everything.

Reviews.Title: “Viceroy Miami is so bad that it prompted me to write my first-ever Trip Advisor Review.”
Reviews.Author: Redwine74
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights (their holiday minimum) over New Years and my birthday. It was mostly an adult vacation, though I did bring my 4-year old daughter to stay with us for two of the nights. We had two suites - both beautifully decorated with a ton of space. That was the only nice thing about the Viceroy Miami. My comments: 1. A line at check-in. The reception also serves concierge, valet, room service - they field every call. In short, they are over-worked. 2. I asked for a bottle of champagne and truffles to be delivered to my friends (they had just gotten engaged) in the next room upon their arrival. The staff was nice, brought up stationery and waited while I filled out the card. My friends never received the delivery. I called the front desk and they promised to "look into it" - I'm still waiting to hear back from them. 3. Valet ($30 additional per day) did not have our car ready -- no matter how much time we called in advance. We even tried 45 minutes - at which point they brought us someone else's car. 4. No hairdryer in the bathroom -- not a big deal, we called the front desk twice to arrange for one to be deliverd. It never came. We called again the next morning. Still nothing. The third time we called, the woman at the front desk said, "Well I called housekeeping and they told me that you already have one." (What kind of hospitality person would say that?) Clearly we did not. When we finally did manage to get a hair dryer it was broken. 5. Room service for four: After waiting an hour for our dinner, they managed to forget my daughter's order (though we were charged for it). 6. You will wait more than an hour for food service by the (mostly shaded, but beautiful) swimming pool. 7. The spa, while spectacularly decorated, was completely booked our entire stay. And the fitness classes were cancelled for two out of the four days (one day was a holiday - but still, this is a hotel). 8. Club 50. Never again. $17 dollar drinks in plastic cups. Small space, beautiful views, awkward crowd/vibe. I have never called the manager of a hotel for anything in my life -- but this was beyond ridiculous and I had to say something. The manager returned my call at 10pm that night (I missed her call). I finally got ahold of someone the next morning to explain our service issues. I simply received a nice lecture in return about how grateful he was that I called, because if these issues go unreported, he remains unaware of them and therefore cannot address them. While I didn't ask for anything, I suppose I was hoping for some nice, if small, gesture on behalf of management for all of our issues. I was left short there, too. Just a giant hotel bill and a very disappointing stay. I really wanted to be out of that hotel after just two nights. It's worth mentioning that I have stayed at the Mandarin Oriental, walking distance from the Viceroy, and it remains one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. It really is worth the extra money. I promise.

Reviews.Title: “More Concerned with Making Money than Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: lamarsands
Reviews.Content: Bathroom flooded twice and the hallway once (room 804), air conditioning did not work(room 907) keeping the room at 77 degrees overnight, large piece of glass in my drink from Club 50. Viceroy Miami's Solution Engineering Services came up and moved the shower curtain back and down 1 inch. Did not solve the problem and the bathroom in 804 flooded again. Requested to be moved. Moved to 907 where the air conditioning did not work overnight. Engineering Services opened the cooling valves and replaced the filter. It worked after that. I explained my dissatisfaction to Renee Roman - Guest Rooms Manager (including the glass in my cup) and he... 1. Apologized 2. Indicated there was not much he could do since I booked thru Expedia (which doesn't make sense since I'm a paying customer like everyone else) 3. Waived my valet parking for 3 days, and 2 breakfast room service orders. 4. Offered to "take care of me" during my next stay. 5. Wrote me a note of apology and sent me chocolate truffles. I decided to give Viceroy Miami one more chance and was willing to book another trip Dec. 30, 2011 - Jan 3, 2012. Renee contacted Bob (Sales) and offered me... 1. 2010 prices at rack rate ($395/night)since 2011 prices were going up $100 per night($495). 2. Discount of $100 my last night 3. Free breakfast I declined because they wanted me to pay more money than I payed thru Expedia(approximately $265/night)? That's how Viceroy Miami attempted to remedy my 2010 New Years Eve situation? What if I swallowed that glass thinking it was ice? I feel they are more concerned with making money than keeping their customer's satisfied. Viceroy Miami took care of me alright...thanks for a memorable New Years Eve.

Reviews.Title: “Great Alternative to South beach”
Reviews.Author: businessasusual_9
Reviews.Content: Our recent visit at the Viceroy exceeded all expectations and makes downtown Miami a wothwhile destination. The infinity pool is umatched by any other city hotel that we have visited, much to the delight of my daughter. At night it transforms into a spectacular common area with great views of the lighted skyline. The service was great too. Upon arrival, the valet recognized that I left my cell phone in the car and took immediate steps to track me down and get it to me. Throughout the stay, the staff was knowledable of the area and easily directed us to our various destinations. On our last day, a bell hop in the hallway seemed to read our minds and took care of our late checkout so that we would not have to make a request in the lobby. The room price was very competitive. We opted for special pre-pay offer and upgraded to a junior suite which was worth the additional few dollars. While the views from the rooms are nothing special (rooms are located on the first 15 floors and a little noisy in the am), the junior suite was large and the bathroom was also roomy and clean. In sum, this hotel is just as stylish as the upscale Southbeach boutiques.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of comfort and tranquility”
Reviews.Author: Pussycat-27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights early December before taking a short cruise from Miami Port. We arrived quite a considerable time later than expected due to adverse weather conditions leaving Ireland. We decided to relax and ordered room service. Meal and service was excellent. We loved the oriental decor and spacious marble bathroom. The bed was so comfortable, it was an effort to get up in the mornings! The 15th floor where the pool, restaurant and chill out areas are is amazing. The views over Miami and Bay are spectacular. We didn't have time to sample the Spa. It was just what we needed to get us back on track before we went cruising!

Reviews.Title: “Prefer the Mandarin Oriental”
Reviews.Author: as_cswin
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Manadrin Oriental previously and couldn't rate it highly enough. In comparison the Viceroy let us down on a few things. Firstly the pool area does not get sunlight all day unlike the Mandarin when you could bathe in sunshine until late in the evening. The Viceroy, unfortunately because of the design the sun disapears behind the neighbouring buildings by 4pm, but also when the sunshine does hit the pool often it is only in a small proportion of the pool, which means everybody is huddled around a small area, making it cramped. We contacted concierge via e-mail regarding getting us Miami Dolphins tickets but they never responded and when I contacted reception about a late check out they told me I would have to do it when I got there and were confused by my e-mail and put my departing flight down as my arrival flight time. We did get concierge to sort tickets out for us when we got to Miami however and we ordered them through ticketmaster. Manadrin on the other hand, concierge sorted tickets for us via e-mail and offered us late checkout complimentary, compared to the crazy amount The Viceroy wanted to charge us. Room layout was better in the Mandarin as was room service. Our room some days at the Viceroy was not cleaned until after 3pm and turn down service was always way too ealry at between 6-7pm, when we were just getting ready. Little things like the Mandarin layout of being able to sit in your bath and watch tv, which you could have done with the Viceroy had they put the bath the other way round, which would have also made the taps easier to get to. My other complaint was the road noise from the hotel room, being right on the main road, every night we were woken by cars beeping their horns and racing round like idiots. I know other reviews have mentioned Club 50 and the door staff, a couple of our party decided to check it out one night and were made to stand outside on the pavement, being told off for standing on the kerb at one point and when they were allowed access 5 minutes later when they got up to it, it was empty!!! It was just a pointless waste of time having to stand outside and made to wait for 5 minutes. Apparently the views are stunning but other than that it isn't worth visiting. Overall our stay was ok, but for my money I would chose the Mandarin everytime as they beat the Viceroy on service, room, location and just for making you feel special which I believe you should be made to feel when you go 5*.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property - Need to Fix Fitness Equipment, Add TV Channels and Turn Down Music”
Reviews.Author: xman_10
Reviews.Content: Nice property. excellent housekeeping staff. Need to fix heart rate/pulse monitors on elliptical machines in the spa. Too few TV channels on fitness equipment. Need to add TV channels to finess equipment, including CNBC and CNN to be competitive with other area properties including the Mandarin Oriental Music too loud in fitness room. Outdoor whirlpool needs to be warmer and the jets need to all be working.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, really good service”
Reviews.Author: teebosco
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here as part of our "babymoon". The Hotel was very modern and had excellent decor. The staff was very accomodating and top notch. We ate at EOS and Bistro E for both dinner and lunch respectively. Dinner on Thanksgiving was a fixed menu featuring, of course, Turkey but the best part was the squash soup. Lunch at Bistro E (the same location as EOS at night) was very good and an excellent value if you have one of the daily $15 specials which was 3 courses as well as a pint of beer. We enjoyed the offering of the day and was actually quite a bit of food. Snacks at the Cafe Icon were sufficient for a pool side drink/sandwich. The pool area was massive but a bit noisy due to construction/remodeling going on. We also spent time at Club 50 up on the top floor of the hotel. It had excellent views of the surrounding area and a large, relaxing outdoor space if you want to sip a scotch and smoke a cigar. Probably the best part of the hotel was the spa. Stunning white everywhere including a lounge area of small jacuzzi's and pools. Really amazing experience. The stay was not without a few snafu's, one being the Hotels' fault and the other seems to have been software issue. Still, the issue which the they did drop the ball on was quickly remediated that's it's not even worth complaining about. The service was exceptional. Lastly, the room was nice. We stayed in one of the 06 rooms which overlooked Brickell. Nothing great to look at outside (they should put some chairs out on the balcony) but inside the room was really cool, comfortable and had lots of "extras".

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: melaws
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Viceroy. Amazing from start to finish. My only complaint would be the lack of privacy in the bathroom. But other than that I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Staff was amazing both hotel and spa. Made our 10th anniv. very special. Hope to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Fabulous Time, Will Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: dreaming27
Reviews.Content: The hotel exceeded our expectations. Staff was always courteous, friendly and catered to our every need. The rooms are FANTASTIC!!! We stayed in a suite and it was beautiful, spacious, you couldn't ask for more! Pool was amazing...I've heard that it's the biggest pool in Florida. They have a HUGE jacuzzi--our favorite! Dinner at EOS was great as well. Staff was very knowledgeable and friendly. Bar server Albert, as the best!!! and the drinks was awesome! be sure to ask for him! Club 50 was a great place to go to after dinner. The Miami skyline from the 50th floor is breathtaking! Overall, we had a wonderful stay and will definately be back! Two thumbs up!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay and Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: tigger1106
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 3 night stay at the Viceroy and loved it. The room was clean and spacious, especially the bathroom! The room came with a balcony and a kitchenette. Dishes and silverware were provided, but there was no pans to use on the electric stove. How are we supposed to use the stove if we wanted to? The beds were extremely comfortable, and it was difficult getting up every morning. The 15th floor pool was amazing! However, there is some construction going on at the end of the balcony, so you can't sit and relax and enjoy the view of the ocean. Valet parking is $30/night with no option of self-parking. We did find a cheaper option by parking on the street at metered spaces across Brickell Ave. Metered parking has a 3 hour limit but there is the option of paying by phone, which alerts you via text when your time has expired. We found that this cut our parking fees in half. The location was convenient. It is about a 15 minute drive to South Beach and there is a People Mover station a block away on 5th Street, which we took to attend a Heats game at AA Arena. Service was great. The front desk greeted us everytime we walked in and out of the hotel, and they followed up on any requests we had. They did say we had access to Club50 right next door, but we did not have time for clubbing on this trip. Overall, I would stay here again the next time I'm in Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Great property, Poor service.”
Reviews.Author: bdevegas
Reviews.Content: This is a great property in a decent location, but just like many places in Miami, it's all flash and no service. The nice part: The rooms are great! We had a balcony which is huge since I'm a smoker. Plenty of amenities and very clean rooms. The pool area is awesome! Nice views of the city. The decoration through out the hotel was great! As far as the property is concerned everything was great, top notch..... The not so nice part: I've worked in hotels for 3 years now and know a thing or two about guest service. The service was good upon check in. We got to the room and I went to shower, but there was no soap or shampoo. I called the front desk to tell them and they send up a maid WITHOUT shampoo or soap. She came just to check and see if we weren't morons and that there was no soap or shampoo in the showers, as if I wouldn't have looked there. At least a half hour goes by and I have to call again to remind them I need soap to shower so I can go out. I finally get everything after 40 minutes or so. I also asked for a roll away and they wanted $30, which I didn't understand. Upon check out the front desk agent got my friends name and room number wrong. Then after she had the correct information she grabbed the folio of the guest that the agent next to her was printing. She found out my friend worked in hotels and asked what he did. He had told her that he works vallet. The girl responds (In front of other guests), "Well maybe you could teach our vallet a thing or two, starting with English." Wow! I couldn't believe it. I'm not one to complain, I surely don't want anyone loosing their jobs, but if she would have said that to many people, she could have very well been fired. I couldn't get away with saying that at the 3 star hotel I used to work at. Other than that though, the property and rooms are great!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service - Beautiful spa - Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: genevatraveller
Reviews.Content: Viceroy Miami truly impressed me. I come to Miami regularly and usually stay at some hotels on the beach. For once, I decided to change and stay downtown, and selected the Viceroy. The hotel is a beautiful modern and well decorated urban hotel. I had the chance to be upgraded to a beautiful suite on the 41st floor. I had 2 spa treatments which were both excellent - the spa is spacious and originally decorated. The views are very nice. But more than everything else, this is the truly exceptional service that makes a great difference at this hotel. Front desk, valet, spa therapists, guest relations (Alliette is great) - every staff member I had to deal with was very professional and courteous. Viceroy is now on top of my list for my next stays in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Discrimination @ this HOTEL!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ethio24
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went to see their "Pool" cuz our tour guide pointed it out on our visit on the 20th of August, so we plan on visiting the next morning. We called and asked them if we can use their pool without being a guest at their hotel then they said yes as long as we pay for the day pass.We were exploring and visiting Miami so why not then we paid and got there, had breakfast, changed and jumped in the pool. Memory was part of our vacation so we took lots of pictures plus we were 3 girls. After a while (while we were swimming)a security guard came and asked us if we were guests, We said nope, we paid for the day pass just for the pool then he asked for a receipt (How embarrassing is that to be piked out of 150 people and to be asked for a receipt?)and of course 3 of us were the only black ( I try not to think it that way but it is what it is). We felt so discriminated and everyone around us were wondering what we did. We said we wanted to talk to the manager and told them they need to work on their communication skills between managers and workers before coming straight to the guests and accusing us.I literally cried cuz I was embarrassed and I love my Pride. The worst part of it was they neither called or emailed us to apologize after they took our contact info!! So shameful! I have such a bad memory of that hotel and if there was a negative rating I would love to give it one!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: jbird102
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Viceroy was a great experience and I would encourage anybody who has the chance to stay there to do so. The hotel is beautiful, the service is great, and the amenities are outstanding. I am going to make it a point to revisit the Viceroy again enjoy it all over...

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Style, Miami Sizzle”
Reviews.Author: JakeAdams72
Reviews.Content: A friend on his first visit to Miami wanted to stay in South Beach. I suggested he shelve that idea for Labor Day weekend and instead stay at the Viceroy, in the hip Brickell District. It's close to great nightlife, public transit (?!), a newly revitalized downtown and just a $22 cab ride from the beaches and craziness of SoBe. The decision proved to be the right one. The rooms are spectacular - reminiscent of Aria in Las Vegas. New, sleek and roomy. However, there was a small problem. The original room had a problem with the AC and a chunk of plaster fell on my friend's head. After calling the bell desk, we were promptly moved -- to a luxurious furnished two-bedroom apartment in the Condo tower for Viceroy. AWESOME! Great views, wonderful furnishings, top-notch amenities. The pool desk is very Vegas-like, minus the annoying hip-hop music bleeding from an adult pool. It's relaxing, yet has a great social atmosphere. The east end of the pool deck has an amazing tanning area with views of Key Biscayne and Brickell Key. There is food service, and the service is just like Vegas -- slightly pricy and very slow. Taxis are plentiful and the Metromover station is just one block west, providing EZ access to bustling Mary Brickell Village, Financial District Station (Segafredo, Brickell Irish Pub, Novecento, Gordon Biersch), and downtown. If you want to see the "real" Miami without the Jersey Shore tackiness and fake pomposity that goes with Ocean Drive on a holiday weekend, STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “My Birthday was Ruined, don't stay here if you want yours ruined too!”
Reviews.Author: JASMIA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Viceroy Hotel for my birthday since I read on their website that I would have access to their Night Club on the 50th Floor. Hotel Guests could access the Club through the hotel elevator using the room key. They hadnâ€™t updated their guest list, and couldnâ€™t find my name. The bouncers wouldnâ€™t let me and my friends in, and instead told us to go outside, and make the line. Not only were they rude to us, one of the bouncers even made inappropriate comments to us. I donâ€™t what kind of behavioral issues these Viceroy employees had, but the bottom line is we had our room key, and my identity as a hotel guest could easily be verified with a phone call, or what have you. That they choose to make it so difficult to grant us access to the Hotelâ€™s Club, and treat us like thugs was just so bizarre. I was so embarrassed for my friends and myself by the unprofessional treatment these individuals exemplified, that there simply was no excuse to treat a hotel guest and their guests like that. That the Viceroy did not have its act together, and my name was not on the list did not merit the snide comments and treatment we received from these two employees in the elevator. This was supposed to be a special night, a joyous occasion, but instead my birthday was ruined. I am now left with the impression that this is how the Viceroy operates, and allows its employees to treat its hotel guests. If you have a special occasion that you want to enjoy, look elsewhere, there are plenty of hotels in the South Florida area that are much, much better and friendlier. Donâ€™t stay at the Viceroy Hotel and make the same mistake I did.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: SheShark1
Reviews.Content: I have to say, this is possibly the nicest hotel I have ever stayed at in the U.S. My friend and I were able to afford this hotel because they had a special where the 3rd night was free. We also decided to upgrade to a nicer room for $9 a night which was a great deal. There was a long hallway leading into our room and we had a corner room so it was quite spacious. We had a nice view of palm trees and a balcony that overlooked the street. Brian at the front desk was most helpful with recommending restaurants to visit in Brickell and South Beach. The beds were very comfortable and we had no problems sleeping. The hotel is situated between South Beach and Virginia Key/Coral Gables, so it's a good location if you want to visit both. There were many nice touches such as the huge towels and the high quality toiletries which come in large bottles and cut down on waste. The pool on the 15th floor is quite memorable and it's worth lounging at and getting a drink. Club 50 has spectacular views and drink specials are good on certain nights if you go early. It was also a nice touch that you can use a laptop in the lobby for free. The staff are superb and the room is gorgeous and feels like a high class apartment. However, if you are traveling with your girlfriend, you must be comfortable with the open bathroom layout (the toilet has a door at least)! I would definitely stay at this hotel next time I am in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my, Oh my.”
Reviews.Author: velvetrage
Reviews.Content: Best of the best in Miami. We stayed at the Epic and at the Viceroy. The Viceroy is just perfect under every point of view, loved the pool and the Condo (great bathroom). The girl at the front desk, Trish, was charming and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Top spot, needs some adjustments, great value right now”
Reviews.Author: Niushork
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd stay at this hotel this year always on business trips. So far I have enjoyed it very much but this last time I was able to explore the hotel a little bit more. The place is extremely well done, the Gym-SPA is very good and staff is very helpful. Also there are three different outdoor pools one with hot water which was surprising taking into consideration that Miami weather is typically hot (although last week was a little cold for Miami standards). The restaurant on the 15 floor is also good and the staff there very helpful. If you are traveling through Miami and want a nice place for a good price this is the moment to go since this hotel will not remain at this low prices for long. Once the economy rebounds this will be a very pricey location. One annoying thing was that the rooms are all with free WIFI and the hotel gives guests free laptops to use but something happened since my first stay back in January and now you have to use the laptop in the lobby which is not very helpful if you need to work. This should be corrected, I usually do not travel with my laptop to avoid airport security problems so having a courtesy laptop is high on my list but then only providing it for lobby use is not very business friendly. Apart from that, I highly rate this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service - Always with a Smile”
Reviews.Author: joeohara80
Reviews.Content: My partner and our 2 teenage children vacationed for 6 nights at the Viceroy Miami. Although we typically stay on South Beach when vacationing in Miami, this time it was time for a change. As one of the dads, I wanted a 6 days of sun, service, and relaxation in a first rate resort in downtown Miami. This was our first visit to the Viceroy. The representatives at the front desk welcomed us with smiles (and as if we were the first guests ever to visit the hotel - keep in mind, we travel often and work in customer service for fortune 500 companies. For the phenomal rate our 2 rooms (one for the kids and one for the adults), the rooms were spectacular - marble, flat screen TV, large shower, double vanity, and luxurious bed (could have slept all day). We had to leave the room to lounge by the specatcular infinity pool overlooking Byscayne Bay. After enjoying an amazing tme each morning at the Spa/Fitness Center (who couldn't workout with glass windows overlooking Byscayne Bay?) This was my ritual every morning for 6 days - away at 8, work out til 10, eat a few prunes and drink the cranberry juiice at the spa (think they were telling us something?), shower, then head to the pool for sun and swimming (with almost no one in this massive pool). At 11:30am the kids and my partner arrived for a brief swim before it was time for food at the hotels bistro/e - the service was beyond excellent and the food was outstanding - coming from DC, the decor was refreshing and relaxing. We are really food snobs (just to ourselves) - the food here was fantastic. One of the best things about this vacation - aside from the our 2 great kids and my wonderful partner, was the great staff at the Viceroy (my kids know that - if I receive great service I will always let the manager know - which isn't very often) - well, the service pool side was 10+ (even during a busy weekend). All of our servers were anticipated when we wanted something - I just hate to look for a waiter. One waiter in particular, David, was just outstanding (wish I could remember the name of the other servers - they were great too). David was always busy AND always took time to check in with every person to see if they needed more food, drinks, etc. He was an absolute professional. Well, this review has gone on too long. I guess I'm longing for another visit to the Viceroy - it's been 2 months since our visit. We are difinity looking to return very soon. The wraps at Cafe Icon are great, visit the amazing spa, linger at dusk by the pool, swim early to enjoy one of the largest pools in Miami by yourself, and, well, enjoy Miami!

Reviews.Title: “From the front door "ahhh"”
Reviews.Author: topaz1100
Reviews.Content: I booked with priceline "name your own price" for $100 per night and priceline doesn't tell you the name of your hotel until your price has been accepted. So when I checked out the hotel online I was nicely surprised but still skeptical. I figured that once we got there we get one of the older rooms that had not been upgraded or something like that. However, upon arriving I see some of the the nicest most expensive cars in the valet area/check in area. So I was pleasantly surprised. Upon checking in the front desk attendant was very nice, she helped us get checked in with no issues. Check in was painless. I don't know how to describe the lobby decor but it was different. I like it though. Everything seemed new. I asked the attendant if the hotel was new and she said it was 18 months old. She directed us around the corner to the elevators. There is a little alcove behind the check in desk before you get to the elevators where you can purchase items. At the elevator I couldn't figure out how to get it to move and the bellhop saw us informed us that we had to use our room key to activate the elevator to take us up to our floor. I thought that was a great security feature. I have never been to a hotel with this feature. So again a nice surprise. In our room, everthing seemed new and pretty (914 and 907 were our room numbers) the furniture was dark and the bathroom door was a wooden double door leading to the large bathroom. There was a seperate little room in the bathroom where the toilet was with a door so you dont have to see your spouse while you're in the shower. The shower was marble (or a similar stone) from floor to ceiling. The shower was HUGE! Double sinks and I had to (again) figure out how to use to the sink. Fancy bathroom. The bathroom was huge with large containers of lotion and body wash (smelled really good) to use and to purchase if you choose. The bedroom was spacious. It was very pleasing to the eyes. It was very unlike any Marriott or chain hotel I have been to. The carpet was super soft and so were the huge king sized pillows and the soft comfy bed! Excellent. The pool was on the 15th floor. It was an infinity pool and its HUGE. The hot tub seats 40 people. The view is spectacular from the 15th floor. They have a couple resteraunts, and a spa but we didnt visit any area other than the pool. I wish we could have stayed longer! The only thing I didn't know was teh caliber of the hotel and that there is NO PARKING. It's all valet and the cost is $30 per night so plan to add that into the cost per night. In addition you have to tip for everything but teh SERVICE WAS PHENOMENAL!!! I can't stress that enough! I would definitely go back! Oh and you can call the front desk and they will print your airline boarding passes and they will bring them to your room in less than 5 minutes! Everyone was always smiling and very nice! *I rated the hotel a 5 for value because I was able to book at a reduced rate however the hotel listed rate from their website is expensive*

Reviews.Title: “Royal. Adore This Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Anyuta320
Reviews.Content: Rooms are huge, views are great, the bathrooms are immaculate. The pool and the patio areas outside are absolutely phenomenal. All of the amenities and a great service staff are there to cater to your every need with a smile, but are not in your face the entire time clamouring for tips and such. We had the breakfast buffet, which isn't really a buffet in a traditional sense (you are brought your food, but can re-order as much as you want) and were ecstatic - the pastries are great, the granola's wonderful, all of the juices are freshly squeezed, bla bla bla - absolutely awesome. I'm a die hard New Yorker and this hotel and the surrounding condo units are making me consider Miami as a viable living option.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: tracers73
Reviews.Content: The Viceroy is a gorgeous hotel where they know how to treat their guests. Everything was fantastic about my stay, from the mini-kitchenette where I was able to keep my own food for snacks and breakfast, the insanely large bathroom with great water pressure, beautiful views of the water, I could go on and on. Fantastic fitness center as well with a great variety of equipment. Also - they offer free wireless internet in the rooms, which just makes sense in today's day and age. Nothing is more annoying than a ridiculous charge by a hotel to access the internet. My only complaints would be the valet service can sometimes be slow - I called 10 minutes prior to going downstairs one morning, and still waited another 10 minutes before my car was brought around; and the only way to the fitness center is to go outside to the 15th level, walk across the pool deck into the other building and go down an elevator. A little ridiculous, and would really suck in bad weather. And a suggestion, unless I missed it, it would be nice to have somewhere to pick up a cup of coffee "to go" in the AM - you need a Ph.D. to work the cappuccino machine in the guest rooms. Overall, this was a fantastic hotel and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “A superb hotel with an excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: MadCobraStyle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Viceroy for two weeks on a business trip. The Viceroy far exceeded my expectations. The entire staff was wonderful. They are friendly, helpful, and always taking care of their guests. The room was spacious and beautifully decorated. The views from my corner room were of the bay and the financial district. The pools and tanning areas are awesome. I found the view from the infinity pool looking out over the bay was most relaxing. The fitness center was spacious and well equipped, and it too had a beautiful view of the water. The spa was a special treat and a great place to unwind. At the end of my two weeks, I only wished it had been a longer stay (without the business part)!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: annvaronaharris
Reviews.Content: One of the most beautiful and original spas I have ever seen. Beautiful and Lavish Hotel with outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: cutielulu828
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay!! Everything from the staff, the food, the rooms, and the spa!!! All was amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best of Miami”
Reviews.Author: gibonarelli
Reviews.Content: I go often to Miami and have stayed in most hotels in the Brickell area. I have to say the Viceroy is without a doubt the best one. Everything was great, from the reception, to the rooms, to the service. I had a couple of minor issues but the staff was always very helpful and attentive. The only drawback I see from the hotel is the issue with Club 50's entrance being right next to the hotel entrance. It is annoying to come in late at night and have to deal with drunk kids, etc... Another issue is the valet parking takes a lot of time because they have to take care of the cars from the club + the cars from the hotel. I had to wait more than 20 minutes in the lobby for my car to be picked up. I have to admit that once I complained the staff took care of the matter. (I had the same issue at the Epic Hotel right next door, I guess thats the price you have to pay for staying in a hio hotel). Besides this small matter, everything is perfect. I will be going to Miami in a couple of weeks and will stay at the Viceroy for sure. Giovanni

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: cammieBaltimore_Md
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic spa day arranged by Priscilla -- thanks to Regina for the wonderful raindrop therapy and massage and to Chris for the mani/pedi and conversation. The hotel is fabulous and the amenities are top-notch. The staff are extremely courteous and remember your name -- a rarity these days. The front desk staff (Zeva and Nicole) were awesome. Zeva arranged a last minute excursion to Jungle Island and Nicole hand delivered my boarding pass to the room. My husband loved the gym and we both loved the pools and cuisine at Eos -- thanks Alex (our waiter) for explaining the composition of each dish. The views from the 50th floor lounge at night are breathtaking. Free Wi-Fi, kitchenette w/espresso machine, and plush linens. Great shopping and dining are within walking distance. Loved, loved, loved the decor. Everything was top-notch -- sorry I have to leave.

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel I stayed ever”
Reviews.Author: flowrider11
Reviews.Content: Just an experience. Fantastic Hotel. The Junior suite IÂ´ve stayed in was huge and luxurious. The hotel has got a great art deco feeling and the lobby ist exceptional. Really Outstanding however are the to floor pool area which is huge and has tremendous views over miami, and the keys. Also fantastic are the gym with views on the skyscrapers. If you have to stay in Miami Downtown this is the choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - 5 Star Staff”
Reviews.Author: KnoWorries
Reviews.Content: The entire staff, including the front desk, spa, gym and pool attendants, room service, housekeeping, and parking attendants, could not be more friendly, helpful, or attentive to the guest's needs. The pools and sunning areas are awesome. They are truly the highlight of the hotel. The fitness center was well equipped and spacious. The spa area was relaxing and romantic. Room view was of Key Biscayne bay. Balcony overlooked the financial district. Overall, a 5 star hotel of high quality.

Reviews.Title: “This is the hotel to choose in Miami”
Reviews.Author: FilipeLisbon
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel in TripAdvisor. I expected it to be good, but not so good. I generally don't like hotels in USA, as generally they donÂ´t offer a quality comparable with what you find in Europe or Asia, but this was the first one I loved. It is very well decorated with pieces of modern art everywhere. My room was fantastic. The pool was a pleasure to look and swim, and the view at the edge of the pool to Biscayne and South Beach was amazing. The staff is also very, very good, as you expect in a luxury hotel (but frequently you don't find).

Reviews.Title: “One of Miami's Best”
Reviews.Author: suz1951
Reviews.Content: The Viceroy Hotel is an exceptional hotel in every way. It's gorgeous, reasonable in price, and the service is impeccable. I've stayed at many upscale hotels in south Florida and the Viceroy exceeds all of them. If you want to feel like a valued guest and get a great deal at the same time, stay here. You couldn't possibly ask for better.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ktrbtw
Reviews.Content: Visited Club 50 and had a spectacular time, service and ambiance were phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in town”
Reviews.Author: maniabon
Reviews.Content: This is the very best deal in town. Don't miss the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Expect to be happy with your choice”
Reviews.Author: crjohncr
Reviews.Content: The first thing you should know about The Viceroy is... it is a hotel and it isn't. Really what it is, is a boutique hotel situated inside the Icon Brickell residential complex on Brickell Av. Expect stellar service and friendly help. Expect when you walk into the understated and quaint lobby to find mutiple well trained people to whisk you away to your suite. Expect your bellman to show you around and make suggestions, showing you all the features of your suite....there are many . Expect everyone to know you by name the entire time you are there. Expect no concierge because your man in the lobby knows how to get things done quickly, service is that personalized. . Expect a spa which will defy your imagination. Expect the best pool in the world., complete with a view beyond anything you have seen. Expect to lay on thick towels upon firm and numerous (i counted over 50) daybeds at the pool. Expect an attendant at the pools who keeps you hydrated and comfy. Expect the Viceory pool has no cabanas because the entire pool area is a cabana. Expect the spa to have more attendants than attendees. Expect a great attitude at the spa. Expect to spend a day there or at the pool outside wishing for nothing but more sun and a longer afternoon. Expect to find your suite in perfect order. Extremely clean and extremely well appointed. Expect two large screen televisions. Expect two bathrooms in your suite. Expect a very very large balcony. Expect high thread counts and fabulous furniture. Expect to find lots of granite and marble yet softened with leather and hide and fabrics which work well together. Expect lots and lots of big towels and most of all expect your wife to be very happy with you. I would not recommend The Viceroy for: people who like big crowds people who like loud bars people who don't know the difference in fun and enjoyment

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: suzyjacuzzi
Reviews.Content: My 21 year old niece and I stayed at the Viceroy for 4 nights in June. This was a college graduation gift and our intent was to hang by the pool, eat well and use the spa/gym. I researched a lot of Miami hotels prior to this trip and I was extremely happy I selected the Viceroy. The hotel is an easy ride from the airport and is centrally located in the Brickell Bay area. Check in was a breeze with a very friendly front desk staff member. Our room was huge and fabulous! I cannot say enough about how clean, spacious and modern our end unit double queen room was. We were pleasantly surprised with our accommodations! Per the other reviews, the pool area is amazing and offers great views of the bay. There are plenty of lounge chairs, day beds and shady areas. There is a small thatched roof stand right by the pool with an attendant handing out towels every morning. The poolside restaurant, CafÃ© Icon, offered up tasty Panini sandwiches, salads and drinks. They are open for breakfast and lunch. The cafÃ© offers poolside service so itâ€™s easy to wave down a server to order your lunch and/or drink selection. The spa and health club are, by far, one of the best I have ever experienced in a hotel setting. The gym has beautiful views and offers up the latest in cardio and weight machines. The common spa area is incredibly striking with chandeliers, huge floor to ceiling windows and soft music. I did not have a spa treatment during my time but took full advantage of the gym and the spa locker/shower area. The gym also offers a listing of daily cardio classes such as zumba, spinning, yoga, dance, etc. Club 50 at the Viceroy is very cool, however, extremely expensive for cocktails so it would be pricey to stay there all night wining and dining. There are some great restaurants right in the area. The Capital Grill is directly across the street. We ended up there one night at the bar to watch game 7 of the NBA finals. Both the service and food were top notch! We also ventured over to the Epic Hotel which is right next door. They have a happy hour every night with Â½ price drinks (which is helpful considering the drinks are about $18). The bar is trendy and full of after work 20 -40 somethings sipping champagne and enjoying the live music. Right inside the Epic Hotel is a brand new restaurant called Zuma. I highly recommend this restaurant for a night out! We opted for the tasting menu ($90/person) and were offered up a non stop selection of tasty treats! Definitely worth the splurge. Overall, a wonderful stay at the Viceroy and I would not hesitate to return or recommend to anyone visiting the Miami area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great pool, but far from south beach/clubbing/fun”
Reviews.Author: nyctraveler222
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 3 girlfriends over July 4th weekend. The rooms are beautiful, amenities are great, and the pool on the 15th floor is just fabulous!!!!! However, keep in mind that the Viceroy is not just a hotel, but contains many condo units as well. The lobby is very small as a result, and it feels much more like a condo building than a luxury hotel lobby. Concierge was nice, but not very knowledgeable or helpful. We felt that they could have been more friendly. They eventually warmed up to us by the 4th day, but we were checking out at this point. The other issue was the location. There is almost nothing going on in this area (financial district). On Saturday afternoon, we had to walk 6 blocks to get to a Starbucks because the closest one was not open on weekends. My friends and I wanted to go to South Beach every day, and this also became an issue, as cab rides are $25 - $30 each way. If you plan to frequent SoBe, I highly recommend staying at one of the hotels there. I had the pleasure of visiting the Fontainbleau, the W, and the Mondrian, which were all gorgeous and more convenient. One last thing, the illy machine makes great coffee, but it's not free. I believe we were charged $1/pod at check-out. There is also no ice machine. We called the front desk several times a day for them to bring up ice. In summary though, we loved the rooms (very quiet and luxurious), but if you are visiting Miami to party and go to the beach, this might not be the best place.

Reviews.Title: “Viceroy, beautiful eclectic rooms , amazing pool”
Reviews.Author: HelenRH
Reviews.Content: I found the Viceroy staff to be friendly and helpful . The rooms are beautiful and elegant in an eclectic way. Very much my taste.My room was on a low floor facing the street which was a little noisy during work week.I think most of better and higher views belong to condos? I loved all the black marble and fun artwork and colors.Bathrooms are beautiful ,nice showers and soaking tubs are huge. The illy espresso maker was a godsend in the mornings and it was nice to have a small elegant mini kitchen with high end crystal and china along with microwave ,cook top and fridge to store goodies purchased at the huge new Publix at Mary Brickell village. The car service made that so easy. Saved me from purchasing the Ruinart from the minibar twice. Had a couple issues with room service , they actually forgot my dinner order completely one night, but were very nice about it when I called 45- 1 hr later to inquire and comped it after retaking order. Pool Deck is amazing and huge.It was very cool at the time of my stay so the warm jacuzzi pool was perfect . . Only saw pictures of the spa and it looked fabulous but never made it there perhaps next time.Same goes for club 50 pool as weather got colder. all in all a wonderful stay

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful service, very comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: mrsc92
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our one year anniversary at the Viceroy Miami and we LOVED it here. This hotel's really got it all - top notch amenities (i.e. BEAUTIFUL and HUGE infinity pool with amazing views on the 15th floor and complimentary access to the beautiful plunge pools and the fitness center at the spa for hotel guests), unique, modern but comfortable rooms, good food, a bed we did not want to get out of in the morning and reasonable pricing for both room and food. And the staff was AMAZING - exactly what my husband and I love - a friendly, responsive, soft spoken and competent staff that is not overbearing. I even enjoyed the Neil George bathroom products in the rooms - the conditioner was GREAT and not the watered down types that you usually find in hotel rooms. My only issue with the hotel was the distance to South Beach ($25 - $30 cab rides so we rented a car) but I thought the hotel more than made up for the drive in every other way. We just hope the staff keeps up the great work at this hotel because the bar has been set high with our first stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: gooddealhunter
Reviews.Content: The Viceroy was all I thought it would be plus much more! Our wonderful experience began the moment we pulled up. The valet attendants were prompt and courteous and the warmth of the hotels' staff continued inside the lobby. We were checked in promptly and escorted to our room by Rick who was more than helpful with the layout of the hotel and things to get into within walking distance of the hotel. The beauty of the place is awesome, the pool is splendid and the service is exceptional. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Espresso machine in room!”
Reviews.Author: Starfish13
Reviews.Content: Booked into a junior suite. Phenomenal. Was able to check in early too which was a big plus. I can't explain how good the room was. It was HUGE. Just look at the picures. The bathroom was that big, it' was bigger than my bedroom back home! I loved the bathroom amenities, Neil George, that were in pump pack bottles that you can use (if you take, they are $45each so be careful these are not for free!) It was absolute luxury. Two huge LCD TVs, one in bedroom, one in lounge, a big balcony, a very useful kitchen that is hidden away, and an illy coffee machine - NO WAY! Went to the Eos restaurant twice. 5 star all round. It was a bit too cold due to air conditioning on the inside though. The pool - UN-FREAKING-BELIEVABLE! Gobsmacked, speechless. Had a massage at the spa. Once again, PLUSH PLUSH PLUSH. There is an indoor pool for spa guests too. I have stayed at the Versace Hotel in Gold Coast Australia and it does not come close to the Viceroy. Honestly would have to say this has been the best hotel I have every stayed at whilst travelling. The big negative however are the ultra rude valet staff. They are contractors to the hotel, but honestly - get rid of them and find a new company.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and friendly modern hotel at a good location”
Reviews.Author: zertis
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at a junior suite at the end of april in 2010 and liked it a lot. Booked it on expedia and got a great price compared to other hotels in the area. The location is pretty good. ItÂ´s only a short drive to miami beach and you can walk to many restaurants in the area. There is a capital grill just across the street. The junior suite was fantastic. I liked the attention to detail and the fresh look of the room. It just doesnÂ´t look and feel like the thousands of Westins and Hiltons. The decor looks a lot better in reality compared to the pictures. Just donÂ´t expect a more then average view from the hotel room, as the hotel is located on the lower levels of the building. The hotel service was very good and the entire stuff was very friendly. The pool on the 15th floor is huge, but no in the sun most of the day because of the surrounding buildings. The only thing we did not like was the service and quality of the poolside cafÃ©. The menu is very limited and the food is below average there. We did not try any of the other resaurants in the hotel. We did not visit the spa. The roof top pool and bar are great to have a cool drink in the late afternoon. The view is fantastic. I highly recommend this hotel to any kind of traveler. This is one of the best hotels that I have stayed at in the USA.

Reviews.Title: “It definitely provides an indulgent and relaxing experience”
Reviews.Author: AussieTravellers75
Reviews.Content: Wow, wow, wow! This place is wonderful...it had lovely rooms, beautiful toiletry products, gorgeous views, an awesome pool, great restaurant and helpful staff - what more could you want?! We only had a short stay here and in hindsight we would have definitely spent extra time in Miami. While we definitely made the most of experiencing what Miami has to offer we also made sure we enjoyed the great amenities at this hotel too. It definitely provides an indulgent and relaxing experience in a beautiful location with bay views rather than beach views - it is a cab ride to South Beach. We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: MiamiBrideXO
Reviews.Content: I went to the Viceroy this past weekend with my girlfriends. This hotel is absolutely incredible. The service was impeccable. The room was spacious and decorated in a beautiful contemporary style. The beds were absolutely yummy. We took full advantage of the hotel amenities by eating lunch in the cafe icon ( try the pesto chicken sandwich), and breakfast at Eos. We also went into the spa to look around and ended up in the jacuzzi with fruit plates being brought over to us. The infinity pool is absolutely gorgeous and the pool waiter was always on hand. The only complaint I would make is it should be much easier for guests to enter Club 50 Lounge than having to wait in line with everyone else whose not a guest. Other than that, it was great. We went to a few restaurants in the area and took a taxi. Everything was so close that we didn't spend more than $5 on a taxi ride. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I'm actually planning to go back for my anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not the Epic”
Reviews.Author: nickni
Reviews.Content: If you are debating between the Epic and Viceroy, go with the Epic. The pool at Viceroy is beautiful but very crowded and only 2 servers available. We asked for towels after we checked in to use the pool and were told that towel service stops at 5pm, so we had to walk back upstairs and take bath towels from our room. Upon checking out the valet delivered our car filthy, covered in construction dust. The Epic has a smaller pool area but the staff is so attentive, you never wait for anything! The rooms at Viceroy did not have water views and no robes available.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Miami”
Reviews.Author: ari100
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself, the staff and customer service are excellent. In particular, thank you for the kindness demonstrated to me during the few days, during my stay, when I was under the weather. Excellent room, excellent pool, excellent gym, excellent spa, excellent food! Highly recommended to everybody for any occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Messy”
Reviews.Author: Jerseycityjohn
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in a great location. The pool is breathtaking; the rooms are a trendy spectacular; and the restaurant is good quality with great drinks. The downside is that is a mess. We arrived at the pool at 10 AM on a Saturday only to find the pool littered with dirty towels and garbage from the night before. The gym was also a mess with with no towels or water. And walking around the grounds of the property was pretty disappointing -- potentially beautiful park on the grounds and bay walk with uncut grass, liter, and decaying trees. Too bad - this place could be great. Money problems?

Reviews.Title: “really disappointed the second time around - would not return”
Reviews.Author: walNorthAmerica
Reviews.Content: I was hear with my wife 6 weeks ago, and we were upgraded to a two room suite that was quite nice - I wrote a positive review of the experience here on tripadvisor. My second visit here is a disaster. No upgrade, a small dark room where the airconditioner wasn't working. Baked and sweat. Asked for help, a workman came and kept coming in and out while I was trying to work under deadline pressure, and then said I would need to change rooms. This time to a worse room on the fifth floor facing the street noise. The small rooms are not worth the price, I feel really ripped off. I notice the manager responds to these comments on tripadvisor, but I wish he would respond to customer needs while they are actually at the hotel. I expressed my displease twice to the front desk and got nowhere. I will try the Epic of the Mandarian Oriental next time, they are right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel in Miami!”
Reviews.Author: ATM72
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Memorial Day weekend for two nights. This was my second stay at the hotel and it was even better than the first because I was able to enjoy all of the amenities, including the awesome pools! This place has a great view of Miami from the 15th floor pool deck! Beautiful views of the bay, Port of Miami, etc. The fitnees center and spa area is a must see! There is also a smaller pool on the 50th floor wih awesome views of the city! Stayed in a double room in December and was upgraded to a one bedroom suite in May! The rooms are top notch! The Neil George bath products in the suites are to die for! I could just move into this place with my clothes only. The suite was basically a small luxury condo. Staff was very kind and helpful. This hotel is not stuffy and pretentious! Short walk to Mary Brickell Village for Starbucks, PF Changs, Balans, Subway, and other food spots. There is also a Publix grocery store in the village. The hotel sits right next to the Miami River and overlooks the bay. Remember, this is Brickell Avenue (Financial District and lots of Condos, just south of downtown). South Beach is a short drive away if that's what you're looking for. I love the Brickell area and will never stay on South Beach. Other options in the area include the Epic, Four Seasons, JW Marriott, Mandarin Oriental, and the Conrad. I have stayed at all except the Mandarin. The Four Seasons is also top notch (great place to relax, get good sleep, and good service!) but has a different vibe than the Viceroy. The Viceroy is a luxury boutique hotel for those who have an appreciation for the good life!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning....”
Reviews.Author: GrayGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on the final leg of our honeymoon that had started in San Francisco a week and a half prior so was looking fwd to some relaxation time. Received a complimentary upgrade on arrival to a junior suite as it was our honeymoon which i think is a really nice touch as only a few hotels had offered this to us. To offer the upgrade even though we were on a stay 3 nights pay for 2 i thought was extremely generous and its touches like this that make you spread the word about a place and make you want to return.....hence the review. The room itself was simply gorgeous....best ive ever stayed in and ive stayed at a few 5 star hotels worldwide. Doorway lead into main room with black marble floor that housed a kitchen that could be put out of sight with a sliding partition with the most gorgeous furniture that resembled authentic havana. There was a balcony that looked over a beautiful church, next was the bedroom with a beautiful 4 poster framed bed which lead into the biggest bathroom ever. Really loved the illy coffee machine as it was by far the nicest coffee of our trip. The pool area was really nice with loads of loungers available, particularly loved the double loungers....so comfy! The view at the end of the infinity pool was stunning as you looked out towards miami beach. The spa was visually stunning but found it not very relaxing, a bit pretentious if im honest. A bit like the club 50 that i think is affiliated to the hotel, amazing to be in a pool on the 50th floor or having a drink but a bit too pretentious for us, just a personal thing so dont let it put you off. The location is downtown which to be honest i liked as pretty quiet at night but south beach is the place to be in the evening and so you were looking at a $20 taxi each way to get there. We got the bus to south beach for $2 during the day from a stop only 10 min walk from Hotel so getting around is easy. Overall myself and my new wife loved this place and would love to return one day, in fact we are already looking at planning a cruise with a 3 night stop over in Miami so im hoping its sooner rather than later.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: johng1974
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great! The rooms, pool, spa, restaurant, night club, room service and staff are all top notch! I travel often and always stay at top hotels, this hotel is one of the best I have ever been to. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “What Has Happened To This Place?”
Reviews.Author: defore4735
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had frequented the Viceroy about a year ago. One of the things that we noticed is that while the hotel itself is a unique hotel as it relates to the layout and the rooms, we did notice the service of the hotel was actually very good. We travelled about the same time (May) and on our last trip, they had several people at the front desk to help you to your room, nice service by the poo, and excellent spa service. My how a year can make a difference. For most of our stay, what we saw were salesman walking around trying to sell condo units of the Viceroy. Not a problem or a nuisance. What was more troubling was the lack of service provided by the hotel. For example, there was no one in the fitness center to help with machines, wiping down machines, filling up water. Nothing. At the pool, there was no food service at the pool on the 15th floor. You would have to go to the cafe in order to get a drink or food. Last year, we had people helping us often, taking up plates, bringing drinks, and someone offering free fruit as you enter the pool area. What was more disturbing is what was NOT happening on the 50th floor. The pool up there wasn't even staffed. The pool isn't arranged with chairs, it's now more of a seating area I guess for Club 50 around the pool. The bar wasn't open, no one to offer food, and the restaurant wasn't staffed. We found it funny that if anyone wanted a beer, they could help themselves as the chest was wide open for use. All you needed was a bottle opener. It's evident that the hotel is trying to reduce cost as much as possible. Perhaps Club 50 didn't take off the way they had hoped. I mean we even noticed they changed the channels in the rooms. It used to be over 250 channels, now it's about 30. I mean, don't get me wrong, I'm not complaining about that, but it's the little difference you're beginning to see from this hotel. The rooms are still very nice, plenty of towels, nice shower, bathtup is small, but overall still very nice. We had a junior suite, and it was nice and cold as we entered the room. The room thermostat was at 66 degrees (they could probably save money on that by turning it up to 72). We got it for a rate of $185 for 1 night on Perfect Escapes, but if I had paid more, based upon my previous stay, I would have been disappointed. Would I stay there again? Probably not.at least, not if I have to get up and get my own drinks at the pool or have none at all if I go to the pool on the 50th floor.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel.......horrible spa”
Reviews.Author: Michelle_Chicago_1
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff were great and if wasnt for the spa I would have rated it higher, but they claim they are a hotel AND spa and that is too bad. The spa was one of the main reasons my friends and I went to this particular hotel. The spa service started at least 20min late, I had two services and the first one was good the second person who did my pedicure did not speak english very well and definitly did not understand english! I asked her to please not use salt scrub on my other leg after the first one started burning....she smiled and nodded and preceded to use the salt scrub....OUCH, my skin is very sensative. Next, the service was suppose to be 60 min...well she was done in 30!!!!.......this was the MOST expensive and WORST pedicure I have ever had, and I frequent spa's often. You also need to be aware that gratitudy is included in everything...from spa services to the bar drinks. I dont mind tipping.....but I just think I should be satisified with the service provided. I should also say that the staff at the spa did offer me a discount after I complained, but my day was already ruined. Oh and the person who provided the service still got a big tip!! It is too bad that the spa was so horrible......when the hotel is so beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: tamara69
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night only pre cruise but would have loved to stay longer and will go back when next in Miami. A very unique boutique property near pier and excellent location for walk over to Bayside. From check in to check out nothing but friendly service and attitudes. The 14th floor is home to a beautiful restaurant and a most incredible pool area and as well this awesome spa which is a must see. Everything top notch. Would love to move that bedroom and bathroom directly to my home. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “More of a Condo-Hotel, services not up to Hotel Standards”
Reviews.Author: IslanderGirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Viceroy for Easter Weekend (3 nights) we booked the hotel based on the excellent reviews and the amazing photography on the hotel's website. The rates over Easter Weekend were also excellent compared to other hotels in this class, so no regrets, but we would not choose to stay here again for leisure, however I would recommend it for business travel. The reason it isn't ideal for a vacation is that the services you crave are not comparable to usual hotels. This hotel is more like luxury hotel rooms in a condominium complex. The vallet is adequate but not as fast or friendly as you would experience at the Delano. If there is more than one vehicle off loading luggage etc. at the same time you are going to have to wait on getting your stuff to the room, it appears as though there may have only been one bell boy. The reception ok for a condo- small and cold for a hotel. Elevators, hallways etc. everything is very dark. The decor is black and dark greens. In the room the TV was on one of the side walls, so you couldn't watch it comfortably from bed, however there was a sofa in the room for this purpose, but we really wanted to chill out. The upstairs restaurant and roof deck make the hotel, without them this would not qualify at all. The room service, although the food was good, again they don't leave the tray table to eat off of as they need it for other deliveries, so you are left with a little table that is about knee high to eat off of, basically eating off your lap. We had a corner unit and lots of windows, this was a highlight. The bathrooms were very luxurious and comfortable, no complaints there. The beds were comfortable for sleeping (less the position in relation to the TV). The Spa looks amazing form the photos but the pool you can see from the reception desk- no privacy and the whole place was missing atmosphere. Good News- The Mandarin Oriental is around the corner and non-guests are welcomed to use the spa there, so we did and it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Miami!”
Reviews.Author: Natalie_1983062
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend the Viceroy Hotel. We stayed for one night on a shopping trip to Miami and the room was beautiful, the service was impeccable and parking was very reasonably priced. The pool and bar area is fabulous. The gym and spa are the best I've seen in any hotel all over the world. You will be hard pressed beating this hotel in either the downtown Miami area or South Beach. Take it from a regular visitor to Miami - stay at the Viceroy! We also higly recommend the restaurant at Viceroy, Eos - absolutely delicious food.

Reviews.Title: “This Place was AWESOME!!”
Reviews.Author: Flantastic-Four
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days, room was huge, luxurious and views were outstanding. Everything was wonderful. Room service and valet service were quick. When our blow dryer didn't work a new one was made available quickly. Spa was excellent and the relaxation room was grand with a magnificent view (you have to see it even if you don't use the spa, go visit.) I read such good reviews of this hotel and it didn't disappoint. Recommend to couples.

Reviews.Title: “Probably one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in - and I have travelled !”
Reviews.Author: Paul_A_274
Reviews.Content: First class lux hotel in downtown. Room fit out and amenities best I have ever seen, and I have spent the past 10 years travelling the world on business so believe me I've had my fair share of lux hotel experiences. Excellent staff; initial problem with room resolved with upgrade. Good food; restaurant great - room service not as good but still good. Would return. Pool / outdoor area is out of this world.

Reviews.Title: “FAB”
Reviews.Author: PUTNEYBIKER
Reviews.Content: The whole idea here is the Condo element to which is attached a small hotel. That is all forgiven by the fact that the rooms are superb with everyting and more that could be expected. Access to the Condo pools is easy and if nothing else you should stay here just to swim in the fantastic pool. Meanwhile I have to retract a little of enthusiasim, the rooms are very poorly sound insulated and you can hear everey single movement above and beside ones room and at three o' clock in the morning when some of Miami night life is going to bed it is a bit disruptive. I am glad not to have a Condo here built out of the same poor quality sound insulation materials.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Icon”
Reviews.Author: J_and_A_1
Reviews.Content: Having visited the Viceroy in Santa Monica and liking the look and style of the hotel, we decided to try this Viceroy since it is a new hotel and has a similar look. The hotel is part of an imposing complex of three fifty plus story buildings that contain eighteen hundred condos. Less then ten percent of the condos are currently occupied. The lobby of the hotel is nice but a small area, nothing more then a place to check in and come and go. We stayed in a one bedroom suite. There was a living room/dining room that had a great look to it, kind of old Hollywood opulence. There was also a convenience kitchen, hidden behind sliding panels, and a powder room. We liked this room a lot which included a black & green marble floor. The bedroom was good size but a little on the dark side, maybe because the walls were a medium green color. The bathroom was very large and lux with separate tub, shower, and water closet. The lighting was not great and there was no place to put your towel for a shower except on the floor next to the shower door, no hook. The bathroom was so large it would have been nice to have a larger shower or even a piece of furniture in the room. There are several pools located on the fifteenth floor pool level that are also used by condo owners. The standout one is the three hundred foot long infinity edge lap pool. This pool is indeed very cool to look at, and a fun challenge to swim laps in. The infinity edge side overlooks Biscayne Bay and the high rises of Brickell Key. The pools, however, are surrounded closely by the three condo/hotel towers. If you plan on spending more then two hours out by the pool during the winter months, you will need to move around to keep up with the sun as the buildings cast large shadows this time of year. They are also a little intimidating to sit near. There are also several fun and interesting play and lounge areas around the pools. The spa and accompanying gym are a tour de force of high design. The spa pools are in a two story room with floor to ceiling windows with great views. The plunge pools are set in a sea of a white marble floor, flanked by dark wood decorative library areas at each end with fireplaces. The area is very cool looking, and a large yellow Murano like chandelier tops it off. A juice bar is located just off the water lounge area. The adjoining gym is very attractive with a full set of equipment and lots of cardio options. The gym is lined with a wall of windows overlooking the water. The locker rooms are also very nice with more white marble, cool design, steam and sauna, and yet again more windows with great views. The only drawback to the spa is that the location is very far away from the hotel. It is located in a different building requiring you to walk outside across the entire length of the pool level. Not really a problem unless it is raining. We had a package with a credit that we used at the hotel restaurant for two breakfast meals, one lunch, and a room service dinner. The restaurant is located on the fifteenth floor, the same as the pool level. Once again the design of the restaurant itself was fantastic and glamorous. There is also an outdoor seating area. Our meals were good and service in the near empty space fine but we did have a problem with our lunch meal. When the bill came, we were charged ten dollars each for plain non-alcoholic lemonades. We questioned this charge twice and were told it was the correct price. This was six dollars more then what we were charged for the room service price the night before. After leaving the restaurant, I called the front desk to complain and the charge was reduced to four dollars. We felt very strongly that the waiter intentionally overcharged us. The location of the hotel is central, easy to get to South Beach and other areas of Miami. Unfortunately the hotel is located very close to busy Brickell Avenue. There is almost no way to escape the noise of the road since most rooms of the hotel face the direction of the road. A few rooms per floor face north and may have a little less noise but you still see and hear Brickell Avenue. These rooms also have a view of the Miami River so you may want to ask for one of them, but I do not think they get direct sunlight. The entire back side of the hotel is a parking garage so there are no rooms facing away from the street noise. Each room has a balcony but I do not think most people would enjoy spending too much time on them â€“ as most face the street and there is no furniture on them. The club on the fiftieth floor is very nice with great views. The design is very similar to the rooms. The pool at this level seems to be for show only, as it was never available to swim in during the days of our stay. To get to the club, you take a separate set of elevators off the main lobby. This is how the hotel is set up, very cut up with no central core to it. All the public areas of the hotel are in very different places. This was not a problem for us, but it can make you feel like you are staying in an apartment building, and not a hotel. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the hotel. Other then the issue at the restaurant, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The dÃ©cor of the hotel is really great and different. We also liked the free internet, something more hotels should be providing. The spa area and gym are also available without the extra charge many hotels like to add on. Street noise and a cumbersome layout would be our only complaints. But the unique dÃ©cor, fantastic pool, outrageous spa, all combine to make a stay worthwhile especially before all those condos start filling up and residents start taking more space at the pool and spa.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful staying”
Reviews.Author: RhodamGreaterLondon
Reviews.Content: Great location with stunning view on the south beach, best room I've ever seen, super service everything was absolutely perfect. You have definitely to stay in this hotel, once you're supposed to come to Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury without the Attitude”
Reviews.Author: jeanmcramer
Reviews.Content: We're definitely staying here the next time we go to Miami. One of the nicest hotel rooms we've stayed in ever - and both of us have done extensive traveling. In the past, we have stayed in South Beach, but this time, we knew the weather wasn't going to be great and we had a 3 1/2 year old, so we wanted to stay at a hotel that was nicer, in case we ended up spending more time in the room than we'd like. Thank goodness we did. We found a great deal - stay for 3 nights, get the 3rd night free. I think we were upgraded to a suite. We walked in and immediately to the right was a 1/2 bath. Then a dining table and kitchenette (mini fridge w/room in it, stovetop, sink, dishes, silverware All-Clad pots/pans, Illy espresso maker), leading into a living room area w/ couch, 4 chairs, desk & flat screen. The bedroom was behind two doors and led to the biggest bathroom. So much privacy! We had our own room and our son slept out in the living room on the couch (we moved some chairs/table around so he was blocked in and couldn't fall out.) We had a river view, looking right out over the bridge, which was great b/c our son got to watch the boats go by and the bridge go up and down. We kept the sliding door open all night, so it was somewhat noisy with cars driving by, but not bad. And we never heard another guest the whole time. The pool area was incredible. I wish the weather was warmer, but it didn't stop us from swimming both days, even when it was stormy and windy (and it can get windy up there), as the water was warm. We had breakfast only at the hotel - once at the restaurant and once at the cafe. It was good, but it was expensive. Especially when all I wanted was a cafe con leche and pastel from a neighborhood cuban spot. They were doing a photo shoot at the cafe when we got there, but the waitress was super nice and got us in the back. For lunch/dinner, we ended up hopping on the Metromover (free train) a block away to go to Mary Brickell Village (I think that's the name - you could walk there too) where there was everything from very nice restaurants to a Baja Fresh, and a less expensive italian spot, just past Baja, in which the food was brought out super fast - a plus when you have a hungry, tired kid. The best part for me was the spa/fitness area. They have classes that hotel guests are able go to for free. I did a yoga class that was supposed to be poolside, but due to the weather was brought indoors. No one else was there, so I had a private yoga session with a great teacher. Then I stayed for a Zumba class afterward. There were a few other women in the class and everyone was so friendly! I wish I could have had more time to go to the spa b/c it looked beautiful. Next time. My husband used the weight room and said it was one of the nicer hotel gyms he's seen. All the staff at the hotel was very nice - from the time I called a few days before our trip to check on transportation options, through the end. I was worried about bringing a pre-schooler to an "it" hotel like this. But I never got the feeling he wasn't welcome. As I mentioned the weather wasn't cooperative, which was a big bummer. So thankfully, this hotel saved our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “You never have to leave the Place”
Reviews.Author: katktoure
Reviews.Content: This place is great.....Great location on Brickel close enough to the beach but not in the middle of the crowd....
