Great resturant on site and great mgmt.....They know you by name and are QUICK to right any wrongs. Club 50 is free for guest and better than any club that I have been to on south beach.. Great price found on a travel site and the rooms look just like the pix on the website. .....This is the only place I will stay now when in MIAMI

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: sueBoston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a few days away from our stay with family in Delray Beach to escape to Miami. Rather go to South Beach this time we found a great rate at the Viceroy and stayed here for 2 nights. The accommodations were wonderful. Clean everything, great service, beautiful surroundings, etc. We manged to find a number of good restaurants within a 15 minute walk and never moved our car for a few days. The pools, spas and sitting locations were great and R & R was a huge plus. Only challenge was the lovely spa was all glass and I had a bad bump into the glass wall and landed with a black eye. The staff were caring and attentive. We would go back here in a minute and certainly recommend the facility to anyone looking for a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “5-Star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sucheslife
Reviews.Content: Based on the recommendations on Tripadvisor I elected to stay at the Viceroy for 4 nights to attend a convention at the MiamiHilton. The choice was between the Viceroy and the Epic. Compared to the Marriot at $400 per both were a deal. I choose the Viceroy based on room descriptions and free internet. I was not disappointed! The hotel is at the north east end of the financial district. The Epic, across the waterway, includes a yacht club and is a bit more impressive from the exterior. The Viceroy is more discrete but wonderful from the interior. The Viceroy is an astounding hotel. The Junior suite was spacious, well appointed, private and very comfortable. The staff were attentive but discrete. Several here have commented on the room and it was great. The bathroom is a large room appointed in granite and marble. it has double sinks, separate shower and bath with plenty of space. If you are in to exercise this is the place for you. The exercise room is part of the spa and includes cardio and circuit equipment and free weights and is equipped with TVs. It overlooks the Biscayne bay . I used it every day. It was great. The deck on the 15th floor was everthing previous reviewers have covered with several heated pools and astounding views of Biscayne Bay. The Viceroy pays very careful attention to security. The elevators are keyed. It was not unusual to encounter a roving security person daily walking the halls. At one point I noted one checking doors to ensure that guests had completely closed their doors. On the pool level it was quite common to see a security guard discretely walking the pool area. As with the other services of the hotel the attention to security went far beyond what I have encountered at Marriot, Hyatt or Westin. The 15th floor restaurant is gourmet. At breakast the servings are large. At dinner they are small. The small-portion concept used by the restuarant at dinner takes a bit of getting used to but, by encouraging the incorporation of multiple small-servings in the meal it made for great gourmet dining. It reminds me of my trips to New Orleans where I typically order multiple appetizers instead of an entree because I want to experience all the flavors. The Viceroy is a special hotel and deserves its 5 star rating. If you can sneak in at a discount rate do it. As it becomes better known these inexpensive rates will disappear. I will be heading back. I will take my wife next time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms”
Reviews.Author: chiacapz
Reviews.Content: Well on a visit for a concert, I searched the web for a great rate. I came across the Viceroy re-grand opening special. I booked the king suite. It was little tricky to find being downtown and connected to condos. But once we got in we were happy. As we were checking in so was a celebrity which made us feel so hip. The room was so clean, modern, and big. The tub was large and was on the other side of a wooden lattice frame. The bathroom was giant. The little kitchenette was nice and had a electric stove. The view from the stunning pool was so nice. This place makes you feel great and hip.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Raulel
Reviews.Content: The Building was stunning, gorgeous 15th floor swimming pools and sundeck, and some of the most impressive decor ever! Besides, the rooms were absolutely beautiful and spacious. An excellent choice for a holiday in Miami or for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: ElsaandMark
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location and I had a reasonable experience apart from the hairs in the bath. However, the stream of unauthorized charges that followed was not a good experience and the refusal to answer email or connect me to someone to discuss them was even worse.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with the most comfortable beds and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mai582
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights and had a wonderful time. There was a slight problem with my reservation, but the front desk agent took care of it smoothly and professionally. When I got to my room, I was amazed by the spaciousness of the bathroom. Everything was beautifully decorated and the bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on. Everytime I walked into the lobby, the front desk staff welcomed me back with a warm smile. I will definitely stay here again on my next visit to Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Rooms, Luxurious Spa, Huge Pool, Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: wetanson
Reviews.Content: In an era where hotel rooms are tiny and hotel gyms are even smaller, the Viceroy Miami is a fantastic surprise. I stayed for five days over the Christmas holidays and was able to unwind with ease. The room was super spacious, especially the bathroom. Huge bathtub and shower made for relaxing evenings in the room. The spa and gym are an amazing feature at the hotel. With views of the water, I worked out and never thought the gym lacked for equipment. The spa offers a signature raindrop massage with six essential oils. It's a must. Plus, I took advantage of the indoor jacuzzis and plunge pools, which hotel guests can use at any time without an extra fee. The only downside to this hotel is the lack of staff at times. If they hired a few extra people, service would improve -- this seems like an easy fix. If you are looking for a quiet getaway with big resort facilities, this is a great choice. Going into South Beach is a short cab ride away as well.

Reviews.Title: “BETTER THAN ALICE'S WONDERLAND”
Reviews.Author: usa_expat1
Reviews.Content: I travel all over the world and enjoy staying in fine places but this hotel is nothing short of amazing. At every turn (and there are a lot of them) Viceroy Miami just takes your breath away. As much as you just want to stay in your fantastic room .... don't. You have to go and explore the property. Infinity Pool is nothing short of incredible. The lobby at the "residence" entrance took me back to great memories of my college days experimenting with wonderful psychedelics. The view from the 50th floor outdoor pool and bar cannot be missed. And I won't even try to describe in words what you see and feel when you walk into the spa. You will just have to go and then you will know why. If I knew this is what heaven was like I surely would have tried harder to get in. Heaven will be my loss but "I'll always have the Viceroy Miami kid". The only negative I can muster here was the $35 charge for my mistress' car being parked there overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique on Brickell Ave”
Reviews.Author: nickarr27
Reviews.Content: Chic hotel on Brickell Ave. We got a one bedroom suite. Nice batroom that would put to shame the ones at The Four Seasons with Neil George toiletteries. Don't take any or they will charge you $45. The room comes with a small two burner's stove, plates, pans, chic coffee maker, two 42" plasma tvs, enough towels for 4 people although we were only two and marble everywhere you look, a shower stall and a tub, double sinks. One and half bathroom, $30/day valet, three good restarurants, gorgeous spa, 4 pools, enough said, I'm definately staying here again and customer service?...splendid.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Cool Hotel on Brickell”
Reviews.Author: EYtraveller
Reviews.Content: I recently spent two nights at the Viceroy on Brickell with my girlfriend. I must say I did really enjoy my stay. If you are looking to stay on Miami Beach this is not he hotel for you. It is located on Brickell Avenue which is in the financial district and an easy $20 +++ taxi ride to Miami Beach. The hotel is only a year old and is very trendy and modern. At night many people come to go to Club 50 and the incredible views. The hotel room was very large. We had a corner room with a terrace. The bed was a large modern four post bed and was very comfortable. Room had a flat screen tv. There was also a sitting area. The room overall was very spacious and larger than I expected. The bathroom was huge. It had a good size tub that filled up quickly and a very good shower. The toilet was in a separate room. Hotel had very good water pressure. Just a key note, dont take the soap,shampoo etc. The hotel uses this "Neil George" line of products, which I have never heard of, but the hotel charges you $45 for every bottle you take. Its ridiculous. The staff at the hotel is very friendly and professional. The maid did an excellent job cleaning the room and they had a turn down service as well. Front desk staff was very helpful. The rooftop pool is amazing. It is a huge infinity pool that is heated. There is plenty of seating. Seating included lounge beds and chairs. There are great views of the water as well. The Spa for the hotel is amazing. Great sauna, steam room and plunge pools. It feels like a library. Very trendy. The fitness center is more than sufficient for a hotel. There are large dumb bells, plenty of cardio machines and free classes ( spin, pilates etc). I would definitely stay here again. One thing that is horrible is the $30 a night parking. It definitely pissed me off. Other than the $30 parking and the $45 shampoo ( i didnt take it obviously) the stay could not have been better. If you want to be on Brickell I would stay here over the JW Marriott or the Conrad. Mandarin Oriental is ridiculous and I think is classier.

Reviews.Title: “Simply breathtaking!!!”
Reviews.Author: patricialuvsclay
Reviews.Content: Wow....all I can say is wow. From the moment I arrived at the Viceroy to the moment I left, I felt absolutely spoiled. We booked through a travel site and received a phenomenal rate for a king size suite and I must say I am in love with this hotel. Even my husband who doesn't say too much about hotel accommodations can not stop talking about the fantastic Viceroy Miami. The room was impecable and immaculate. I did not see a speck of dust anywhere. The bathroom was absolutely huge and beautifully decorated, the only drawback was that it didn't have a soaking bath only a shower. They have not spared any expense at this hotel. From the ornate fixtures to the solid (and I mean solid) marble ice buckets....to the South Coast down pillows and fluffy bedding, everything was top notch. We were impressed at the speedy check in process (even though we checked in around midnight when they were busy with people going up to the club 50.) Unfortunately we were too tired to check the Club out....perhaps next time. The pool on the 15th floor is something of a wonder. With all it's little nooks and crannies there is something for everyone....whether you just want a quiet siesta in one of the cabanas or a relaxing soak in the huge hot tub. The Viceroy has it all. I think we were the only people at the pool on Sunday morning and we enjoyed it for a few hours it was so tranquil. Teh pool area was so breathtakingly beautiful it was hard to leave. On Sunday morning, before hitting the pool area, we enjoyed Brunch in the restaurant and it was really yummy the champange/orange juice drink was a nice touch and the way they present the condiments for breakfast was really attractive. The hostess was very accommodating when we were not happy with our table and requested another and the wait staff were very friendly...they even noticed us taking our self-portraits and asked if we would like them to take the picture for us. I had a wonderful time at the Viceroy and cannot tell enough people about my experience while I stayed there. If I am so lucky to find myself back in Miami, I will definitely stay at the Viceroy.

Reviews.Title: “Geeat Hotel not so great service”
Reviews.Author: vigilanteviajero
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. Superb rooms, great location, wonderful ambiance and a real jewel in Brickell Avenue. Close to my corporate offices. Just a walking dsitance! Bathrooms are large with a great shower and wonderful, well lighted mirror. Excelent bed and pillows. Slept like a baby! The hotel is indeed great and my only complaint is bad service they gave me at the restaurant. The staff just does not care. They are lazy and careless with the service. Nevertheless, the valet parking staff is great. Friendly and service oriented.They must work on improving staff attitude at the restaurant and get them to be service oriented and once that is reseolved they will have a top notch place in Downtown Miami.

Reviews.Title: “WOW....just wow”
Reviews.Author: mmen322
Reviews.Content: Everywhere you look is something beautiful to look at. The 15th floor pool deck is amazing. If I could stay up lounging in one of those daybeds overlooking the water I wouldn't need the room. The room was spacious with an almost obscenely large bathroom, it was wonderful! I only wished it were quieter on the balcony due to the traffic, but weekends are not so bad. We stayed for 6 nights and I wish I could go back but the rates now are just too expensive. We must have gotten an opening special or something where it was less than $100 a night. I wish there was a self park option, valet only is $30 a night which is normal in miami, but having the valet get your car and tips each time, it all adds up. I wouldn't have minded paying 20 for self park or even 30. Anyways my major bummer was the 50th floor pool. Its a brand new hotel so I can't understand why it wasn't open when we went. It looked like they were demolishing the marble around the pool, maybe they changed their mind on the finishings, I don't know. When I saw the pictures on the viceroy miami website, I was inspired to purchase an engagement ring to propose to my girlfriend and imagined doing it up there on top of the world. It was a major bummer that it was closed! Now I have to save and fork up almost $500 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - great location, elegant rooms, and relaxing pools”
Reviews.Author: Tracey_Travel
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the Viceroy. Went on trip in August and was looking for relaxation and found the place. Checked in the one bedroom sweet and was not dissapointed. The room was very large - comfy bed, un-cramped bathroom, and nice amenities. The roof top infinity pool was unfortunately only open on the weekend. However, there is an infinity ppol on the mid-level that was ver nice and relaxing. Pool was very large as was the hot tub. The only real parking option was valet ($30) but something you would come to expect for downtown Miami, Overall - great stay and planning on re-visiting with my wife to spend a relaxing weekend!

Reviews.Title: “5+ Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: REICH44
Reviews.Content: I strongly recommend the Viceroy for an experience to remember. The service, rooms and amenities were first class. Their pool area is the best I have ever seen. It includes a children's pool, spa, and an infinity pool that you have to see to believe. There is a club on the 50th floor that has the best view in Miami with entertainment at night. There also are many great restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bradb1108
Reviews.Content: As one might expect from an high end downtown hotel, this one had it all and more than we could take advantage of in our long weekend. They are supposed to have a terrific spa and health club, which we did not have time to experience. Service was friendly and helpful, rooms were spotless and very well appointed. The bed and bedding was comfortable as well, and it was nice to have the sofa in the junior suite which it turned out was not too much more in price than their standard room. There are three pools on the 15th floor and a great view over Biscayne Bay. One pool is great for lap swimming since it is probably 150 feet long. You really could not go wrong staying here. The Club 50 on the top floor, with inside bar, outside bar, and rooftop pool is very nice as well. My only negative comments are that the lobby seemed small, and you would not feel comfortable sitting in it for any length of time. I also forget that a downtown hotel will charge you for parking. The daily rate was $30. Factor that into your budget. The hotel information said they have a courtesy car where they will take you anywhere within a 2 mile radius which would include the Bayside shopping and entertainment area and the American Airlines Arena for basketball, etc. We did not use it. However, for the cost of parking, it may be worth taking cabs to/from the airport and South Beach, and the courtesy vehicle to/from Bayside.

Reviews.Title: “So Sexy!”
Reviews.Author: firstlady4e
Reviews.Content: If you're on a trip with your other, then this is the best hotel to stay at. No privacy, if you know what I mean.. the biggest Jacuzzi, I think in the country and the longest pool in the country. There's also a very private, adults only pool on the 50th floor. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Spa......”
Reviews.Author: jacqrio
Reviews.Content: The decoration of this hotel is nothing I would want in my home, but kind of fun for "getting away". The staff was very helpful regarding my strange travel schedule. The spa and pool were just beautiful. My room was not large, but unlike another reviewer, was not open to the bathroom. I wouldn't really call a laptop in the small lobby a "business center", but expect most travelers bring their own - and business doesn't appear to be their market. I will definitely make every effort to visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful new hotel, beautiful people, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Travelling-Buckeye
Reviews.Content: We got the Viceroy on Hotwire (4 1/2 stars) for an incredible $69 / night. It is a wonderful hotel. Someone has spent (and is losing) a LOT of money on this enormous multi-tower hotel and condo development. That said, their loss is our gain. Rooms are very comfortable, beautifully appointed and very high quality. We ate in the 15th floor rooftop sandwich shop (Cafe Icon) - food was tasty. The 3 - 15th floor roof top infinity pools are amazing (I wish I'd brought my swimsuit). Service was nice. The 50th floor club (Club 50) has unbelievable views of the bay and a pool (expensive drinks, but worth it because of the view). Trendy, sophisticated, somewhat Asian decor. Good service. All in all, one of the nicer hotels I've every stayed in, and certainly the best every for what we paid on Hotwire... enthusiastically recommended. In season (and in a good economy), I expect this is a $450-$500/night hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in downtown miami, wow of an infinity pool on roof, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Fikoukla
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at the Viceroy. Although I'd read good reviews, having stayed at its LA sister I was expecting style over substance. I'm glad to say I was proved wrong. I was here for a business conference, and they hosted us really well. Very attentive staff, and the setting was efficient while not being corporate. The whole place has a wow about it, and I don't know how other visitors can criticize the decor. It is certainly quite eclectic - a fusion of Asian inflences - but it is a refreshing change from the yawn understated minimalism of so many modern 'design' hotels. All put together with a good eye and with quality pieces. The rooms feel luxuriously appointed, very comfy beds, and even the standard ones come with a very clever hidden little kitchenette (though who would stay at this type of hotel, I don't know). Lovely bath with large separate shower. It's partly open to the bedroom - which I really like. (But if you're sharing you'll need to remember to shut the door to the loo!) The suites are - of course - even nicer. There's a fabulous bar on the 50th floor. Amazing views. It comes with its own pool and has indoor and outdoor space. It is expensive, but I don't think it's out of line with other similar type places. The bar staff were friendly and knowledgeable, and had time to recommend other lesser-known spirits. The bar shut early - at midnight - and there was no effort to warn us it was closing which was a little irritating. The restaurant on the 15th floor, Eos, was again beautifully appointed. The staff seemed a little all over the place, though very friendly. No maitre d' meant that it took ages to get seated, with the girl at the bar taking over so that we didn't have to stay standing. The food is expensive for what it is - and is guilty of trying too hard to be different. Lots of strange combos that probably shouldn't have made it past the experiment. The real 'wow' is the pool deck, on the 15th floor. It is very large - it would have to be seriously busy to feel crowded. The view is broken up by lots of low trees, so it feels fairly private despite sitting between 3 towering apartment blocks. The pools (there are 3) are amazing. 1st a large square paddling pool - I guess for kids or for people who just want to cool down on a hot day. 2nd a large square heated pool, not deep but swimmable. And then finally a very big and long infinity pool - it looks like you could swim off the side of the building. In fact when you get down that end you see that there is actually another lower deck where you can sit on day beds and stare out at Brickell Quay. Quite incredible. And then the Spa - another wow space. It has what it calls a wet lounge - seats and sofas dotted around a white marble room with a shallow water floor, and then places with deeper hot and cold jacuzzis. My description doesn't do it justice. The prices were pretty eye-watering however, so I'm afraid I can't comment on the quality of the treatments. A well equipped gym also. It's in the business district so it may not be the spot for a weekend in Miami when people tend to want South Beach. But for a business trip combining pleasure I'd say it would be perfect. From the pool deck you can see the Mandarin Oriental sitting on Brickell Quay. I've stayed there many times, and it's very good also, but the Viceroy blows it out of the water.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SQUANTZ73
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful. Modern and contemporary. The rooms were well appointed, nice balconies, a kitchenette with mini bar. Everything was dark wood, tile, marble and glass. Beds were comfortable. The disappearing edge pool on the 15th floor was fantastic, extremely long pool. Incredible views from the dozens and dozens of canopy lounge beds and lounge chairs that were all over the outdoor area around the pool. There was also a very large, pool size jacuzzi and a similar size shallow pool. Another smaller but beautiful disappearing edge pool was on the 50th floor, rooftop. There is a bar there and plenty of room to sit and enjoy the views of Miami beach in the distance (about 10-15 minutes away by car). Next to the pool on the 15th floor was a Cafe that serves light fare all day, coffee, etc... My only concern there was that the Cafe tried to be so modern and contemporary that it's usefulness as a place to just sit with a book or a laptop were overlooked. There are no outlets, not very many tables and chairs even though there is lots of space for them. The food was excellent, as was the coffee and the service. The manager was exceptionally friendly. We definitely enjoyed it. We went to the club in the hotel, Club 50, on the 50th floor on Saturday night and it was a great hot spot. Smart dress code, trendy...incredible city lights and ocean views at night. Within walking distance is a downtown outdoor shopping village area with bars, restaurants and stores. Most of the bars and restaurants we went to in and around Miami include the gratuity in the total, so watch for it on the check. If they don't give you a check, just a verbal total, ASK if the gratuity is included...otherwise you are doubling your tip. When I asked, it was...I was glad I asked. From this hotel we drove to Key West for the day and came back that night.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is absolutely amazing and the staff is always ready to provide excellent service”
Reviews.Author: travelinggirl559
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Viceroy Miami was absolute wonderful. We got to the hotel a few hours before check in, and the attendant at the front desk made sure to get us a room right away. As soon as we walked in the room my husband and I knew we had picked the best hotel in downtown Miami. The room was very spacious, with modern dÃ©cor and had a fabulous view of downtown (itâ€™s walking distance to everything) the pool on the 15th floor was amazing! There were actually three large pools which seamed to stretch the length of a football field! The gym was great as well. (not like most hotels were thereâ€™s a treadmill and a bike) this one has it all! I definitely plan on staying here again when I visit Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Better than there web site.”
Reviews.Author: absherkathy
Reviews.Content: Perfect Service, friendly staff.clean room every thing we expected and much much more. Only draw back. I wish the 15th floor pool would stay open after dusk. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Could they "Not get it" anymore????”
Reviews.Author: Mexican_Caribbean
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have ever written a review here, but Wow this place just does not get it. First off there is no partition between the bedroom and the bathroom. That means if your sitting on the bed you are watching someone on the toilet. 5 star quality?? Then the price are insane. $26 for a mixed drink in the bar???? For real... Is it still 2006 and everybody who stays there is making money flipping condos? Apparently the management staff thinks so. In a more personal note, left my $600 Blackberry on the table in the bar on the 50th floor. I guess the waitress was mad because she only made 18% on my tab and I didn't double tip because when I got back she wouldn't even come tell me if she had found my phone or not, but sent someone else to do it. Then when the manager finally came out his great response was "If they would have found the phone, I would have it". Maybe she took my phone maybe she didn't, but I expect more from a 5 Star Resort. Great customer service especially at $500 a night and $26 a drink... Move on, they don't get it...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, super friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Juholland
Reviews.Content: The Viceroy offered a deal when they first opened so I got a great price for two rooms. One for my husband and I and the second for my sister, her husband and two kids. We got a standard double and they got a standard twin (two Queen sized beds and a big size room). Firstly, the rooms are sooo not standard. Really lovely decor that makes a big impression when you get settled in. The staff are very friendly and make you feel welcome in every part of the hotel. The hotel is most probably more of an adult environment (quite chic and stylish) but they were friendly to the kids and it was not at all stuffy. We stayed for three nights and tried local eateries for variety and price (it's a relatively expensive hotel where you could easily rack up the bill). The Mary Brickell Centre is a five minute walk away with an excellent selection of restaurants at all price points......Ballans, good for breakfast and Dolores but you can call me Lolita.......great value and hip environment for the evening. We rented a car and found the area a great base and did not miss being on South Beach one bit. If you are in the area on business, going on a cruise, on a romantic trip with your partner or wanting a faubulous spa break, (spa/gym is off the scale) this hotel is for you. If you want a very hip hotel for a friends trip away this would also work. If you want lots of guys and girls and that South Beach action.....maybe not so much. Friday night did have the trendy after work crowd, but it is not really a singles spot as such. We loved it and I would go back in a shot!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Rooms and Huge Pool”
Reviews.Author: vlust
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure recently to stay at the Viceroy Miami for a 1 nights stay and a day at the spa. This hotel is very nice and new everything. First upon driving up I was impressed with the entrance, but once I got inside the lobby I totally felt like I was going to a condo residence. The lobby is very narrow and small for a lobby but very nice and new decor made it look quite expensive. The front desk guy Andrew or was Andre walked me up to my room and I was not ready for this but lets just say the room is more than enough. I'm sure I had just a regular room and even this impressed me and made me wonder what the suites would look like. Well the bathroom has double door entrance a separate tub and separate shower and a water closet with double sink, very nice! Again great size, even a small kitchenette with two stove top burners. Nice coffee machine and microwave. The bed was so nice large and comfortable and the balcony was nice touch even though I did not go out. Because the hotel is still very new it wasn't a lot going on. The restaurant was empty but the decor was beautiful. The pool on the 15th floor was so huge even I wanted to get in. The pool area is very nice and large. The pool is the size of a football field I believe. I only wish there was a pool bar so that one could grab a drink and lounge around. Very nice view of the Miami River and other locations around. There is also a pool on the 50th floor at Club 50, the concierge was nice enough to escort me up since it was a private party going on. Once up there the view is breathtaking. I loved it I wanted to host a party there its prefect for something like that. Not sure why the pool is there maybe the Club 50 is open in the day time. Its a very nice touch, but is it useful I can't say. The spa is one of the bigger spas I have ever been inside; the spa is 23,000 sq ft, with a beautiful water lounge. My service was good I got the canvas massage and pedicure. Its pricey, but the facility was great and nice. Everyone in the spa was nice and helpful. Great juice/fruit bar. So the area this hotel is located in is very nice downtown Miami Brickell area. Next door is the brand new Epic Hotel. I did not go over there, but I wanted to and never got the opportunity. This area is a late area, nothing to do before 11pm and the crowd is very mature at least that was the crowd around 9pm. But the hotel is great and I have already told many many friends about it. Great if you want to get away from the South Beach mess.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: Oli-on-trip
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this brand new hotel during the opening week and had a really good deal. The location on Brickell Avenue is good for business travelers but aside from business there is not so much to in downtown Miami. The hotel and condo complex is very impresive. There are several restaurants, bars and two pools. The main is very huge the ohter small rooftop one is on the 50th. floor. What an awesome view especially during the night when there is a bar. The rooms are spacious. The bed is comfortable and the the bathroom with seperate shower and tube is great. There is a big TV with a lot of channels and a small balcony. Had a room facing brickell on a lower floor so i had some traffic noice but it was not too much thanks to the good windows. The rooms have free wifi and received dayly a free bottle of water by the nightly turndown service. Staff is friendly and attentive. Food including breakfast is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Gatoresq
Reviews.Content: Went with my wife to celebrate our anniversary (without the kids) and we were really happy to find this place. Top-notch service throughout the property, not to mention that it's gorgeous - beautiful things everywhere - really high-end design wherever you look, almost as though it was "staged" to perfection. Yet even with the very cool, hip and blisteringly expensive vibe going on, it was still very comfortable, and although we have our own kids, we were selfishly happy NOT to see a ton of kids there - especially with spring break going on locally. Mind you, though, the hotel is part of a condo complex (The Icon - three 50 story towers) which although completed, was 99% unoccupied (typical now-a-days in South Florida), but once it fills up (which in the current economic climate could take years...) the incredible peace and quiet that we found throughout the property will likely (and sadly) dissipate to some degree. But for now, our room was nice. We had a 1 bed/2 bath suite. Great AC, spotless throughout, mainly a city view (although you could see the water also) and although there was no furniture on the balcony, we were very-well provided for inside, so we didnt care. Comforable beds, large marble-covered bathrooms, and even a small kitchen-ette complete with cook-top, microwave, sink and espresso maker. Overall, very comfortable, clean and pleasing to the eye. The pool areas on floors 15 and 50 were both beautiful - and the private club way up on 50 was Vegas/SoBe cool - but my favorite part of the hotel - by far - was the spa. Holy moly it's gorgeous! For gym/spa freaks, you really have to see it to appreciate it...and the staff there can't do enough for you; the trainer was totally game to help me out in the gym, which had tons of cardio machines and was loaded with both free weights and top-of-the-line Technogym machines. I did a spin class also. Good instructor, and he played some really cool house music from this incredible sound system, which made the 1 hour class fly by. Locker room w/ steam, sauna, and, again, marble everywhere. Overally, an incredible facility - so much more beautiful than any spa I've ever been too, not to mention, again, that it was empty, which made it than much quieter. Didn't get any spa treatments, not so much because of the astronomical prices, but more so because I was relaxed enough without it. The only area that we thought could be improved was in the food (taste - not service) dept - lunches were good, dinner good but not great, and room svc breakfast was "eh" at best. We were told that the hotel is bringing in a michelin-starred chef within the next few weeks - and if he's worth his "star", then that could the proverbial icing on the cake... We'd definately return. Enjoy the "introductory" rates while they last, because I have a feeling that once word gets out about this place, they are undoubtedly going to shoot up.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: Chicago-60653
Reviews.Content: This is the most incredible hotel I have ever stayed at in the world. The hotel is classified as a 4 1/2 stars, but should definitely be moved up to 5 stars. This a new hotel which opened in early February-2009. We stayed for 3 weekend nights in March-2009. The following are the things that most impressed me about this hotel: (1) The hotel service exceeded my expectations. From the moment you drive up to the minute you leave, you are treated like a King. There are no airs put on by the staff, but rather they are extremely friendly and attentive to your needs. (2) The size of the rooms are beyond adequate. I received a special rate on a one bedroom suite which measured about 780 square feet. This is quite large. Even their standard King rooms measure about 500 square feet, which is more space than you will get at most hotels. (3) The outside deck on the 15th floor is worth the visit alone. The space covers 2 acres and has one of the world's largest infinity pool that I have ever seen. There are at least 3 large pools on the 15th floor and the most comfortable seating & lounging spaces. (4) An included fitness center and movie room as part of the hotel. I could not believe the fitness center and movie room were free of charge. I would of happily paid to use this great space, but to my surprise it was indeed free. There is also a nice spa which charges reasonable rates. I could go on for days talking about this hotel. Simply put, this is a must stay at hotel. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JonathanA8
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful (rooms look exactly the same as in the hotel's photographs). The staff was really fantastic. The pool on the hotel's top floor (Club 50) is very nice, calm and relaxed, and the views are great from the 50th floor. Views from the hotel rooms look toward the city and not the bay (some of the rooms look over the Miami river and the city around it). The restaurant is very good. The menu isn't adventurous, but the quality is very high. I'd be happy eating there any day; the staff is great. The gym and spa at the condominium part of the complex is also beautiful (and huge). As an aside, we stopped by the Mandarin Oriental (5 minutes away) for an early dinner before we flew out of town. Both the food and the decor there felt very dated.

Reviews.Title: “Still not fully functional”
Reviews.Author: jrankw
Reviews.Content: We had great expectations for the opening weekend stay. When we got there at 5 pm we were told our room wasnÂ´t ready (3 PM check in and mind you this is opening weekend but didnÂ´t seem like many guests). We were told they couldnÂ´t give me a time when the room would be ready and to check the hotel out and Â´chill outÂ´. Lunch was free. The main pool was still under construction and other details still missing. Once we settled in everything was better and good service. For the price IÂ´d rather stay at the Four Seasons or the Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Best hotel we have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeTraveler97
Reviews.Content: Extremely clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff, great location with great views.
